loans.name: Smith Marlene

texts.es:
Préstamo anterior: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id= 102622&_tpos=7&_tpg=1
Smith  es socia del Bancomunal Virgen de las Mercedes.
Smith  tiene  un tío que tiene un puesto de venta de tubérculos en la parada, y por la edad decide dejar el puesto a su sobrina Smith, ella con su esposo empezaron a administrar el puesto de tubérculos en la parada y dedicarse a al venta al por mayor y menor de tubérculos.
Desde que Smith esta en Finca aprendió valores, aprendió a respetar las reglas, ella era muy tímida y las reuniones le ayudaron a expresarse y a querer surgir. 
Smith necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, para la compra de sacos de papa.
El sueño de Smith es comprar directamente a la chacra, sin intermediarios, pero necesita ahorrar más.
texts.en:
Smith is a member of the Virgin of Mercedes (Virgen de las Mercedes) Community Bank. Smith has an uncle, who has a stand where he sells tubers in the market. He decided to leave the stand to his niece Smith. She and her husband began to run the tuber stand in the market. They pursue large- and small-scale sales of tubers. Since Smith has been with Finca, she has learned values and has learned to respect the rules. She is very shy, and the meetings help her to express herself and to want to go forward. Smith needs a loan for 2000 soles to buy sacks of potatoes. Smith’s dream is to buy directly from farms, without intermediaries, but to do this, she needs to save more money. Previous loan: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=102622&_tpos=7&_tpg=1

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of potatoes

loans.name: Biqui Virginia

texts.es:
La señora virginia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa C. de Barco”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Chucuito Sector Barco, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 38 años de edad, estado civil casada, es madre de 03 hijos y tiene estudios de segundaria completa, vive en Chucuito  Sector Barco II.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 11 años,  obtuvo un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizó para la compra de abarrotes. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 800.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos, conservas, harina, etc. con los cual quiere  surtir mejor su tienda, además tiene su negocio de crianza de truchas.

Su deseo es hacer crecer su negocio para así educar a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan la cuenta interna la facilidad en los préstamos y la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Sra. Virginia belongs to the Communal Bank “Santa C. de Barco”, which is located in the district of Chucuito Sector Barco, Chucuito Province, Department of Puno. She is 38 years old, married, and the mother of 3 children. Sra. Virginia completed her high school education. She lives in Chucuito Sector Barco II.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 11 years. She used her initial loan of 300 soles to buy groceries.

At the moment, she needs a loan of 800 soles to buy rice, sugar, milk, noodles, canned goods, flour, etc. This will improve the inventory of her store. She also has a business raising trout.

Sra. Virginia hopes to grow her business so that she can educate her children. She likes the simplicity of managing her loans and their timeliness.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, milk, noodles, canned goods, flour, etc.

loans.name: Vasil

texts.en:
Vasil is married and has two children. He makes a living selling agricultural produce from his van. He buys produce in bulk in nearby villages and transports it to his customers. Vasil is known for selling fresh fruits and vegetables and has many regular clients. 

Vasil has been in this business for 15 years. It's not an easy way to make a living, because he has to be driver, delivery man and sales person all at once. But the business allows Vasil to provide for his family. He is a very optimistic person, and believes he can manage his work successfully, however hard.

Vasil would like to borrow $1,850 to buy more produce. Increasing sales would help him make more money and take better care of his family.

loans.use: to buy more produce to sell to his customers

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es:
La señora Natalia es socia, del Banco Comunal “3 de Mayo II”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Puno, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 49 años de edad, estado civil soltera sin hijos y tiene estudios superiores, vive en el Jr. Atahualpa.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace casi 06 años, con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, para la compra de abarrotes. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 3,000.00 Nuevos soles, para invertirlo en la compra de gaseosas al por mayor, también nos cuenta que esta iniciando un negocio de farmacia.

Su sueño es agrandar y llenar su farmacia.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y los encuentros además la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Sra. Natalia is a member of the Communal Bank “3 de Mayo II”, which is located in the district of Puno, Puno Province, Department of Puno. She is 49 years old, single, and does not have children. Sra. Natalia completed her high school education. She lives in Jr. Atahualpa.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for nearly 6 years. With her initial loan of 300 soles, she purchased groceries.

At the moment, Sra. Natalia is requesting a loan of 3000 soles to purchase soft drinks wholesale. She also indicated that she is opening a pharmacy.

She hopes to enlarge and stock her pharmacy. Sra. Natalia enjoys her savings, her group meetings, as well as being punctual.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks wholesale

loans.name: Caren

texts.en:
Caren is 35 years old and has four children. She makes a living running a small stand in the Gikomba market in Nairobi where she sells tomatoes and onions. Caren has run this business for the past three years, and before that worked as an exporter at the airport.  She has requested her first loan of $275 to expand her stock of items to sell. Caren hopes to one day buy and develop a plot of land on which she can build rental units. On a personal level, she would also like to one day own her own home. She describes herself as a diligent worker and as someone who enjoys the company of other people.

Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. It recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Juan De La Cruz

texts.es: Juan de la Cruz B. C. tiene 39 años. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que sus inicios se dan por su compañera de vida ya que ella le dio la idea para que ambos trabajaran juntos y así lo hicieron. Por lo que ahora ambos recorren las diferentes calles cargando los bolsos en donde trasladan la mercadería y mostrarlas a sus clientes. A pesar de que su trabajo es muy agotador no deja de soñar que algún día tendrá un medio de transporte para facilitar la entrega de sus productos. El destino del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de bolsos, calzado y ropa en general. Su deseo es establecer una tienda para exhibir sus productos.
texts.en:
Juan de la Cruz B. C. is 39 years old. The economic activity in which he is engaged is the sale of general merchandise. He’s been in this business for more than 5 years. The beginnings of the business came about through his life companion. She gave him the idea in order that they could both work together and, so, they did it. That’s why now they both go through different streets carrying bags into which they’ve loaded their merchandise to show to their customers.

In spite of the fact that his work is very exhausting he hasn’t given up dreaming that some day he will have a means of transport that will make it easier to deliver his products. The purpose of the financing is for working capital for the purchase of bags, footwear, and clothing. His wish is to establish a shop in order to exhibit his products.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To sell essential goods

loans.name: Braulia

texts.es:
La señora Braulia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Cruz de Barco” que esta ubicado en el distrito de Chucuito Sector Barco, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 57 años de edad, estado civil Viuda, con 4 hijos y estudios de primaria incompleta (3er grado), vive Chucuito Sector Barco.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 9 años, con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, para la compra de pescado. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de pescado para luego venderlo en la ciudad de Puno y en el mercado de Chucuito.

Su deseo es poder formar una empresa de truchicultura.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las reuniones.
texts.en:
Sra. Braulia belongs to the Communal Bank “Santa Cruz de Barco”, which is located in the district of Chucuito Sector Barco, Chucito Province, Puno Department. She is 57 years old, widowed, and the mother of 4 children. She has a 3rd grade education. Sra. Braulia lives in Chucuito Sector Barco.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 9 years. With her first loan of 300 soles, she purchased fish.

At the moment, Sra. Braulia is requesting a loan of 500 soles to buy more fish that she can sell in the city of Puno and at the market in Chucuito. She hopes to establish a trout farm. She enjoys her savings and the Communal Bank meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fish

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 25 years old, married and expecting his first child. He runs a small restaurant in the Pipeline area of Nairobi, and is grateful to Faulu for its help increasing his business skills through various training programs, especially one that taught him how to maintain business records. 

He has requested a loan of $675 to buy additional supplies of beans, maize, flour, cooking fat and other ingredients for his business. The loan will allow him to buy the goods wholesale, thus increasing his profits. He hopes to one day open a second restaurant in town. He also wants to improve his family's living standards, and hopes his child will one day go to university.

Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To buy additional supplies of beans, maize, flour and cooking fat

loans.name: Nora

texts.es:
La señora Nora es socia del Banco Comunal “Chijuyo Copapujo”, ubicado en el Centro Poblado de Chijuyo, Copapujo del distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 27 años de edad, de estado civil casada, es madre de 2 hijos. Juana estudió secundaria incompleta (4to grado), vive en el centro poblado de Chijuyo Copapujo.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace casi 02 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, monto que utilizó como capital para la fabricación de sogas.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional, por ello viene solicitando la suma de S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles, con este monto ella va a adquirir cabuya (material para elaborar sogas) en el distrito de Desaguadero, las sogas las vende en las ferias de ganadería.  Ella también se dedica a la crianza de ganado mayor.

Su deseo es poner otro negocio ya que hay mucha competencia.

A ella le gustan las reuniones y  los ahorros.
texts.en:
Nora is a member of the “Chijuyo Copapujo” communal bank located in Chijuyo, El Collao district, Puno department. She is 27 years old, married with 2 children. She reached 4th grade, but did not complete her school studies. She lives in Chijuyo Copapujo. Nora has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for nearly 2 years. Her first loan was for 500 soles, which she used as capital for rope making. Currently, she needs an additional loan of 1500 soles to purchase materials to make rope in the Desaguadero district. She sells the rope in the livestock markets. She also works raising cattle. Her dream is to become involved in another business, as there is much competition in this one. She enjoys the [communal bank] meetings, and having savings.

Translated from Spanish by Kristen Beck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase material to make rope

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For growing corn

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For growing peanuts and corn

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora Maria., pertenece al Banco Comunal “3 De Mayo II”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Puno, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 38 años de edad, de estado civil casada, es madre de 05 hijos y tiene estudios de secundaria completa, vive en el Barrio Alto Alianza  Jr. Tribuna.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela R. desde hace 6 años, obtuvo un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizó para la compra de cuyes. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1,200.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de cuyes y aves de corral.  Maria los vende en el mercado Unión y Dignidad de  Puno.

Su deseo es poner una granja de cuyes ya que nos dice que tiene buena demanda.

A ella le gustan la unidad en las socias y la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the 3 de Mayo II (Third of May II) communal bank, located in the Puno district. She is 38 years old, married, with 5 children. She finished her school studies. She lives in the Alto Alianza Jr. Tribuna neighborhood. Maria has been working with the Manuela R. Movement for 6 years. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to buy guinea pigs. Now she needs a loan of 1200 soles to purchase guinea pigs and fowl. Maria sells these at the Union y Dignidad market in Puno. Her dream is to have a guinea pig farm, as there is high demand. She enjoys the unity and regularity of the [communal bank] meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Kristen Beck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase guinea pigs and fowl

loans.name: Maximiliano Javier

texts.es: Don Maxiliano es soltero, de 42 años de edad, tiene una hija y una nietecita que habitan junto a el, trabaja en el Matadero Central MACESA desde hace 9 años.  Esta solicitando su 7mo credito para mejorar su vivienda construyendo un closed en su cuarto y ademas hacer el baño e inodoro dentro de su casa y asi contar con comodidades para su vejéz, cabe señalar que los creditos anteriores los ha utilizado para mejorar su casa pero hasta en este credito espera ser beneficiado con el fondo KIVA.  El mayor sueño de don Maximiliano es seguir dando comodidad a su casa pues es el patrimonio que dejara a su familia.
texts.en:
Maximiliano is 42 years old and single. He has a daughter and granddaughter that live with him. He has worked at the MACESA Central Slaughterhouse for 9 years. He is requesting his 7th loan in order to make improvements on his home, building a closet in his room and adding an indoor bathroom, adding some comforts for his old age. His previous loans were used to improve his home, but now he hopes to benefit from KIVA credit. Maximiliano's greatest dream is to continue improving his home, as it is the inheritance he will leave to his family.

Translated from Spanish by Kristen Beck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: build a closet, indoor bathroom

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es: María Antonia Maradiaga tiene 58 años de edad. Es una mujer casada. Tiene 6 hijos y todos traban de manera independiente. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta y elaboración de tortillas. Hace más de 20 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que inicio porque no tenía suficientes ingresos para mantener a su familia y como madre responsable decide establecer este negocio para proporcionarles a sus hijos lo necesario. Ella tiene más de tres créditos con Fundación ha sido una excelente cliente y con el esfuerzo de su trabajo ha logrado pagar en tiempo y forma. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de sus productos. El sueño de María es seguir adelante con su negocio.
texts.en:
María Antonia Maradiaga is 58 years old, married, and has 6 children who are all independent. For over 20 years, she has been making and selling tortillas. She started her business because she did not have sufficient income to support her family. As a responsible mother, she needed to provide for her children’s necessities.

She has had more than 3 previous loans with the Foundation. Sra. María puts much effort into her work, which has allows her to make her payments on time. The loan she is requesting will be used as operating capital to buy ingredients used for making her products. She dreams of continuing to move her business forward.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For growing sweet potatoes and corn

loans.name: Daina

texts.en:
Daina is a 36-year-old mother of five who owns a beauty salon in the Pipeline area of Nairobi. In her seven years as a Faulu client, she has successfully repaid 10 loans. She is now applying for a loan of $925 to buy a hair dryer, various beauty supplies and cosmetics. Daina also runs a small grocery store near her salon, where she sells vegetables and charcoal. She will also use part of the loan to buy additional charcoal to sell. She hopes to one day start a beauty school, and become a charcoal wholesaler.

Since becoming a client of Faulu, Daina has not only expanded her business, but has also purchased a plot of land outside the city, and paid her children's school fees. In the future, she wants her family to have better living standards, including good meals, good health and a good education. Daina describes herself as hard-working, patient and determined.

Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. It recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Buy a hair dryer, beauty supplies and cosmetics

loans.name: Tomasa Del Carmen

texts.es: Tomasa del Carmen C. F. tiene 52 años de edad. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 17 años que se dedica a este negocio por lo que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado mantener. Este negocio lo inicio por su hija porque ella le ayudo a conseguir los productos en precio mucho más accesible al inicio fue un poco difícil pero con la experiencia que logro adquirir salió adelante. A pesar de los desafíos que enfrento como fue el comunicarse con sus clientes, ya que en su mayoría eran jóvenes, y esto se le dificultaba, pero con el paso del tiempo fue aprendiendo lo adecuado. Su mayor sueño es proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Tomasa del Carmen C. F. is 52 years of age. Her economic activity is the sale of general merchandise. She has engaged in this business for more than 17 years. With a lot of effort she has succeeded in keeping it going.

This business began through her daughter, who helped her get products at a good price. At first, it was a little difficult, but with the experience she succeeded in acquiring she got ahead. She confronted challenges as she communicated with customers since most of these were young people, and this was difficult for her, but with the passage of time she learned to adapt. Her biggest dream is to improve her way of life.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: David

texts.es: David tiene 24 años, es un joven padre de familia que vive con su pareja y madre de su hijo, a quien ama mucho. Por el momento habitan en la casa de sus padres. Asimismo, ellos le facilitan sus chacras para que pueda realizar sus propias siembras, ya que aun no posee terrenos propios, adicionalmente también trabaja en los cultivos de papa de sus padres, quienes le pagan por su trabajo. Cuando su esposa le propuso sembrar arvejas, David aceptó muy contento tal propuesta, ya que ha visto que varios vecinos, gracias a este cultivo se han levantado rápidamente y él también espera tener buenas cosechas. Con las ganancias que vayan obteniendo desean construir su propia casa, en aras de evitar algún problema futuro por vivir todos juntos. Por lo demás, está muy contento con sus cultivos de arvejas y más aún porque no tiene que realizar mucha inversión en fertilizantes, puesto que usa las tierras que sus padres abonaron para la papa. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, durante el ciclo pasado pagó puntualmente sus cuotas y también asistió a todas las reuniones de su banco comunal, donde se siente muy bien en compañía de sus demás compañeros. El dinero que ahora solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de dos bolsas de arvejas y fungicidas para evitar las plagas.
texts.en:
David is 24 years old and a young father. He lives with his common law partner and the mother of his son, whom he loves very much. At the moment, they live in his parents’ house. They also allow David to use their fields so that he can grow his own crops, since he does not yet have his own land. He also cultivates his parents’ potato crops, and is compensated for this work.

David’s wife suggested that he begin planting peas. He happily accepted her advice because he has several neighbors who are potential customers. Thanks to his wife’s suggestion, this crop is growing rapidly and he also hopes to have a good harvest. With the profits he will earn, he plans to build his own house to avoid problems that exist with his current living situation. He is very happy with his crop of peas because it doesn't require much fertilizer and it occupies the same land used for growing potatoes.

This is David’s second loan with MFP. During the last cycle, he made all of his payments and attended every one of his communal bank meetings, which was appreciated by the other members. The money he is requesting will be used to purchase two bags of peas (seedlings) and fungicides to prevent infestation.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase peas (seedlings) & fungicides

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For growing cassava

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es:
La señora Marleny, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres del Siglo XXI”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Juli, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 24 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, es madre de 01 hijo y tiene estudios de secundaria completa, vive en Barrio San Juan de Bellavista.

Es socia nueva, ella requiere un préstamo inicial de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles,  para aumentar el capital de su negocio, se dedica a la venta de bordados en bayeta (tela de la zona).  Con este dinero comprará lanas de diferentes colores y bayetas.  También elabora tejidos de prendas de vestir como chompas, chalinas y guantes.. 

Su deseo es poner una tienda de abarrotes  y vender al por mayor.

A ella le gusta la puntualidad en los préstamos.
texts.en:
Señora Marleny belongs to the “Mujeres del Siglo XXI” (Women of the 21st Century) Community Bank which is located in the district of Juli, in the province of Chucuito, Puno Departament. She is 24 years old, single, and has a son. She has completed high school and lives in the neighbourhood of San Juan de Bellavista. Marleny has recently joined the bank. She requires an initial loan of S/.500 soles to increase her business capital. She sells fabric that she has embroidered. With the loan she plans to buy wool in a variety of colours and more fabric. Marleny also knits clothing such as sweaters, shawls, and gloves. One day she would like to open a grocery store and sell goods wholesale. She likes the timeliness of the loans.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fabric and wool in different colours

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es: Hugo tiene 42 años, tiempo atrás pensó en casarse, pero le fue imposible, debido a lo costoso que es una boda. Vive actualmente en su casa propia con su pareja y sus hijos. Para lograr tener buena vida trabaja diariamente en sus cultivos de papas y arvejas, aunque lo que le gusta sembrar mayormente es maíz, ya que los vende en choclos por fanegas de 60 kilos a 50 soles y en caso de bajar los precios en el mercado, ya no los vende como tal, sino que los hace secar para desgranarlos y venderlos por arrobas a 23 o 25 soles. En esta labor su esposa es su brazo derecho, ya que es muy hábil en la comercialización, llevando todos los miércoles y sábados un saco de maíz al mercado, donde los revendedores la esperan, es ahí donde su esposa muy alegremente ofrece su producto y él la ayuda. Terminada la venta, los dos compran los víveres para la semana y muy felices parten a su pueblo. Una vez en casa, Hugo nuevamente se dedica al trabajo duro de su chacra en aras de cumplir sus sueños de tener una mejor calidad de vida. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, los 4 préstamos anteriores los  pagó puntualmente y promete seguir con la misma dinámica, ya que se siente muy contento de pertenecer a su banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes químicos para abonar su chacra de  maíz y arvejas.
texts.en:
Hugo is 42 years old. In the past he considered getting married, but it was impossible because of the cost of a wedding. He currently lives in his own house with his partner and their children. So that he can have a comfortable life, he works every day in his potato and pea fields. However, what he most likes to grow is maize as he sells the corn in 60-kilo bags for 50 soles. If the price drops, he doesn’t sell the corn this way, but lets it dry, removes the kernels, and sells them by arrobas (1 arroba = 12 kg) for 23 to 25 soles. His wife is his right hand in this work since she is a very skilled businesswoman. Every Wednesday and Saturday she takes a bag of corn to the market where the sellers are waiting for her. His wife happily does the selling, and he helps her. Once the sales are made, the two of them buy their supplies for the week and set off cheerfully for home. When they get to their house, Hugo again resumes working hard in his fields in order to fulfill his dream of a better quality of life. This is Hugo’s 5th loan with Kiva partner MFP. His four previous ones were paid back punctually, and he promises to do the same this time as he is very happy to belong to his community bank. The money will be used to buy fertilizer for his corn and pea fields.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
La señora Candelaria pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Cruz de Bellavista”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Puno, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 48 años de edad, de estado civil casada, y es madre de 04 hijos.  Tiene estudios de secundaria completa, vive en Barrio Tupac Amaru.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 03 años, obtuvo un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que lo utilizó para la compra de combustible. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, para invertirlo en la compra de combustible, repuestos para carro (solo por pedidos), esta operación ella lo realiza una vez por semana.

Su deseo es construir su casa, poner una tienda de repuestos para autos.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y los encuentros.
texts.en:
Señora Candelaria belongs to the “Santa Cruz de Bellavista” Community Bank which is located in the district of Puno, in the province of Puno, Puno department. Candelaria is 48 years old, married, and has four children. She has completed high school and lives in the neighbourhood of Tupac Amaru. She has worked with Kiva partner, Manuel Ramos, for three years. Her first loan was for S/.300 soles which she used to buy gas. Now she needs a loan of S/.1000 soles to buy gas and spare parts for cars (orders only). She takes orders once a week. One day she would like to build a house and open a store selling spare parts for cars. She enjoys saving money with the bank and meetings with her fellow members.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy gas and spare parts for cars.

loans.name: Amivi

texts.fr: Cette dame habite le quartier Agoè à Lomé et fait le commerce de maïs, elle exerce ce commerce dans son quartier et au marché local d’Akodesséwa. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants ; elle sollicite un prêt de WAGES pour  agrandir son stock actuel avec 20 sas de maïs. Elle exerce ce métier depuis 2004.
texts.en:
Ms. Toutouvi DOTSE was born on July 6, 1979.  She is married and the mother of five and manages to help cover household expenses, thanks to the revenues from her business: agriculture.  She has a lot of experience in agricultural work and has a good command of growing sweet potatoes and corn.  Thus, she is requesting financing that will enable her to extend her arable land and to buy fertilizer.  She will then be able to increase her revenues in order to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For buying sacks of corn

loans.name: Luzmila Hilda

texts.es:
La señora Luzmila, pertenece al Banco Comunal “3 De Mayo II”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Puno, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 39 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, es madre de 02 hijos y tiene estudios de secundaria completa, vive en el Barrio Manto Jr. Emancipación.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 2 años, obtuvo un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizó como capital para su negocio de compra y venta de huevos. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, para invertirlo en la compra de huevos al por mayor, además para la compra de pasteles que vende todos los días por las diversas calles.

Su deseo es poner una  tienda de barrotes.

A ella le gusta la puntualidad que hay en el Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Sra. Luzmila belongs to the Communal Bank “3 De Mayo II”, which is located in the district of Puno, Puno Province, Department of Puno. She is 39 years old, in a common law marriage, and the mother of 2 children. Sra. Luzmila completed her high school education. She lives in the neighborhood of Manto Jr. Emancipación.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 2 years. With her first loan of 300 soles, she purchased eggs to sell at her business.

At the moment, she needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy eggs wholesale. She will also purchase pastries to sell every day as she travels through the different streets.

Sra. Luzmila hopes to open a grocery store. She enjoys the punctuality of her Communal Bank.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase eggs wholesale & pastries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For growing sweet potatoes

loans.name: John

texts.en: John B. is married and has 8 dependents. He has received schooling through junior high. John operates a cold store selling frozen meat and fish at Kwamikrom, which he has done since 1996. His wife is a petty trader who makes very little money. John uses his income solely for the upkeep of his large family. John will use the loan to purchase fresh fish, meat, and livestock to sell to expand the business. With the new profits from his expanded business, John plans to reinvest.

loans.use: purchase fresh fish, meat and livestock

loans.name: Marilli Viky

texts.es:
La señora Marilli es socia del Banco Comunal “30 de Agosto”, en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 23 años de edad, de estado civil soltera y es madre de 4 niños, ella tiene estudios de educación secundaria completa.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 3 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para adquirir abarrotes.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional de S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, el préstamo le servirá para poder comprar azúcar, arroz, leche, aceite, huevos, sal, harina, etc.

Su sueño es comprarse una casa en Arequipa. 

A ella le gustan los ahorros y  las reuniones.
texts.en:
Sra. Marilli is a member of the Communal Bank “30 de Agosto”, which is located in the district of Ilave, El Collao Province, Department of Puno. She is 23 years old, single, and the mother of 4 children. She completed her high school education.

Sra. Marilli has been working with Manuela Ramos for 3 years. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to purchase groceries.

She currently needs another loan of 3000 soles to buy sugar, rice, milk, oil, eggs, salt, flour, etc. Her dream is to buy a house in Arequipa. She enjoys her savings and the Communal Bank meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sugar, rice, milk, oil, eggs, salt, flour, etc.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: Carlos Alberto P. S. tiene 42 años. Es un hombre casado. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica es la compra y venta de carbón y leña. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio, es un hombre muy trabajador y con mucho esfuerzo logra sacar adelante a sus hijos. Carlos recorre todos los días diferentes calles ofreciendo carbón y leña. La ubicación de su negocio es de manera ambulante. El es un hombre muy humilde y disfruta mucho de su trabajo ya que la mayoría de sus clientes dicen que es una persona muy alegre. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo ara la compra de carbón, leña y además darle mantenimiento a su medio de transporte. Sus deseos son que sus hijos estudien y se preparen lo suficiente para que no tengan otras oportunidades
texts.en:
Carlos Alberto P. S., aged 42, is married and has two dependent children. He has been a trader of coal and firewood for more than seven years. He is a very hard-working man and with a lot of effort he succeeds in helping his children to progress. Carlos is a hawking trader who travels every day through various streets and offers his coal and firewood for sale. He is a very humble man and enjoys his work a lot because most customers appreciate his cheerfulness.

Carlos applies for a loan to expand his working capital. He will buy coal and firewood, as well as repair his cart. His wish is that his children study and get ready for life as they have no alternatives.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For growing cassava and corn

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a roasting machine for cereals

loans.name: Pedro Electerio

texts.es: Pedro Electerio T. tiene 56 años. Su actividad económica es la crianza de pollos. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio. Esta pequeña actividad dio inicio porque Pedro tenía ciertos ahorros y con su poca cantidad de dinero decide comprar 3 pollos. A pesar que solo compro pocos pudo empezar con ellos. Ya que este empieza hacer la mayor fuente de ingresos para su familia. Decide continuar con su negocio además tiene experiencia en la compra y venta de ganado y esto le ha favorecido pues le ha dado la experiencia que tiene hasta los momentos. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de alimentos para pollos. El sueño de Pedro que su negocio logre aumentar lo suficiente.
texts.en:
Pedro Electerio T. is 56 years old. His economic activity is raising chicken. More than three years ago he started this small business. He had some savings and decided to buy three chickens with his small amount of money. Despite the reduced number of chickens, this was the beginning of an activity that has become the biggest source of income for his family and he decided to continue with it. Furthermore, he gained some experience in trading with cattle and so far this was useful.

Pedro applies for a loan to expand his working capital. He will buy chicken food. Pedro dreams to expand his business sufficiently.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For growing corn

loans.name: Yésica Maydana

texts.es:
La señora Yesica, pertenece al Banco Comunal “3 De Mayo II”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Puno, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 27 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, es madre de 03 hijos y tiene estudios superiores (Derecho 5 Nivel), vive en la Torres de San Carlos Puno.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 5 años, obtuvo un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que utilizó para la compra de zapatillas. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 2300.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de zapatillas, juguetería y utensilios de cocina, los cuales los compra en Arequipa, Tacna y los vende en el mercado de Puno.

Su deseo es poner una  tienda para vender juguetería y ropa de niños.

A ella le gustan la unidad en las socias y los ahorros.
texts.en:
Doña Yésica, aged 27, lives with her partner and her three children. She studied law at the university until level 5. She lives in the neighborhood of Las Torres in San Carlos de Puno. She is a member of the Communal Bank "3 De Mayo II" (May 3rd II) located in the district of Puno, province of Puno, department of Puno.

Yésica has worked with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for five years. She used her first loan of 300 nuevos soles to buy slippers.

Now she applies for a loan of 2300 nuevos soles to buy slippers, toys and kitchen utensils in Arequipa and Tacna, which she will sell at the market in Puno. Her desire is to open her own store and sell toys and children's wear. In her group she likes the savings and the unity with the other members.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy slippers, toys and kitchen utensils

loans.name: Nora

texts.es: Nora tiene 37 años de edad, es una mujer muy serena y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo y sus 4 hijos. Desde pequeña trabajó labrando la tierra, ahora que es madre aprendió a medir su tiempo y organizarse en sus labores de casa para después trabajar en sus chacras. De trabajar con su esposo termina de cultivar rápidamente y dispone de tiempo libre, el cual aprovecha en trabajar en las chacra de sus vecinas, removiendo la tierra y otras veces recogiendo arvejas, por este trabajo le pagan al día 13 soles, pero ella prefiere ganar según la cantidad que recoge, por lo que se esmera en recolectar la mayor cantidad de arvejas. Cuando tiene que cosechar sus propias siembras se levanta a las 3 de la mañana para cocinar los alimentos y posteriormente procede a la recolección de las arvejas, para que en la tarde ya estén listas para llevarlas al mercado de la ciudad, donde generalmente obtiene un buen precio, y eso la hace muy feliz y la motiva a seguir sembrando. Este su quinto préstamo con MFP, con los préstamos anteriores demostró pagar sin dificultades y promete hacerlo así, con este nuevo crédito. En su banco comunal es muy paciente en explicar a sus compañeras cuando no pudieron entender con claridad algún tema, por lo que le tienen mucho aprecio. El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes químicos para su próxima siembra de papas y arvejas.
texts.en:
Doña Nora, aged 37, is married and the mother of four children. They live in their own house. She is a very quiet and hard-working lady who has worked in agriculture since a very young age. Now that she is a mother, she has learned to organize her time and take care both of her home and her farm.

As Nora works with her husband, they finish early and she has enough time left to work on her neighbors' farms, where she usually turns over the earth and harvests peas. She earns 13 nuevos soles (US$4.40) a day for this work, but she prefers to be paid depending on the amount of harvested peas, as this motivates her to pick as many peas as possible. When she has to harvest her own crop, she gets up at 3 a.m. to prepare the meals and then pick peas. In the afternoon of the same day, she sells her peas at the city market where she can usually get a good price for them. This makes her very happy and motivates her for a new sowing cycle.

This is her fifth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She repaid her previous loans without difficulty and promised to do so also this time. In the meetings with her Communal Bank she patiently explains to her group members any topic which they might not fully understand, and they are grateful for this. Nora will use her loan to buy chemical fertilizers for her next crop of potatoes and peas.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Amavi Sefenya

texts.fr:
Cette femme a appris la couture, faute de moyens pour ouvrir son atelier, elle s’est lancée dans le commerce de produits congelés, elle a associé après à ce commerce la vente de cartes de recharges  téléphoniques.son stock de produits congelés a connu une baisse, elle veut se réapprovisionner et sollicite par conséquent un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 7 cartons de poissons, 10 cartons de poulets et gonfler son stock de cartes de recharges avec 10 cartes de recharges TOGOCEL et 10 cartes de recharges ILLICO.
Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants.
texts.en:
This is a woman who learned how to sew.  Lacking the means to open her workshop, she started off in the commerce of frozen foods.  She has included with it commerce in mobile phone recharge cards.  Her inventory of frozen goods has experienced a drop.  She wants to stock up again and consequently is requesting a loan from WAGES for buying 7 boxes of fish and 10 boxes of chicken and also for expanding her stock of recharge cards with 10 boxes of TOGOCEL cards and 10 boxes of ILLICO cards.  She is married and the mother of two children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For buying frozen foods and phone cards

loans.name: Edith Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Edith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Cruz de Bellavista”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Puno, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 29 años de edad, estado civil conviviente, es madre de 02 hijos y tiene estudios de segundaria completa, vive en Barrio Laykacota Jr. Banchero Rossi.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 01 año y medio, obtuvo un préstamo inicial de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, este dinero lo utilizó para la compra de combustible. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de chocolates, caramelos, galletas, yogures, dulces, gaseosas, jugos, chisitos, etc.

Su deseo es poner una tienda de abarrotes al por mayor en Puno.

A ella le gustan las reuniones y las facilidades en los préstamos.
texts.en:
Sra. Edith belongs to the Communal Bank “Santa Cruz de Bellavista”, which is located in the district of Puno, Puno Province, Department of Puno. She is 29 years old, in a common law marriage, and the mother of 2 children. Sra. Edith completed her high school education. She lives in the neighborhood of Laykacota Jr. Banchero Rossi.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 1½ years. Her initial loan of 500 soles was used to purchase fuel.

At the moment, Sra. Edith is requesting a loan of 500 soles to buy chocolates, caramels, cookies, yogurt, candy, sodas, juices, cheese puffs, etc. She hopes to have a wholesale grocery store in Puno. She enjoys her Communal Bank meetings and the simplicity of her loans.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chocolates, caramels, cookies, yogurt, candy, sodas, juices, cheese puffs, etc.

loans.name: Viviano

texts.es: Viviano es un hombre muy atento, dedicado a la agricultura, tiene 36 años de edad y hace poco terminó de construir su casa propia, donde vive con su pareja y madre de sus 2 hijos. La siembra y el cuidado de sus cultivos es su mayor placer, ya que desde niño su padre le enseñó a tenerle gratitud a Dios y a la tierra. Al ver fructificar sus plantas se regocija mucho, puesto que cuando coseche tendrá la oportunidad de comercializar sus productos directamente en un mercado importante de la ciudad de Lima. La decisión de enviar sus cosechas a la capital es porque le genera mejores ganancias y ello le da la oportunidad de pagar el alquiler de la chacra y la compra de fungicidas en aras de prevenir el acecho de las plagas. De terminar sus labores agrícolas, Viviano busca trabajar en las chacras de sus vecinos, para de ese modo cubrir los gastos de alimentación diaria de su casa, ya que por ello le pagan 15 soles al día y a su esposa 12 soles. Por el momento, Viviano seguirá trabajando arduamente para el bienestar de sus hijos. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, durante los ciclos anteriores demostró ser una persona muy puntal en cada uno de su pagos, por lo que todos los integrantes de su banco comunal lo reconocen; asimismo, menciona sentirse muy bien con todos ellos. El dinero que ahora solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes químicos para abonar sus chacras de arvejas, donde posa para la foto.
texts.en:
Vivian is a very thoughtful man dedicated to agriculture. He is 36 years old and has just finished building his own house where he lives with his partner and mother of his two children. The planting and care of his crops is his biggest pleasure because, ever since he was a child, his father taught him to give thanks to God and to the earth. Upon seeing his plants bear fruit he rejoices, as when he brings in the harvest he will have the opportunity to sell his products directly to an important market in the city of Lima. He sends his harvest to the capital because this generates the best income and gives him the ability to pay the rent for the farm and buy fungicides in order to ward off plagues. Upon completion of his own agricultural labors, Viviano looks for work on his neighbors’ farms. With the 15 soles a day they pay him, and the 12 soles a day they pay his wife, he is able to cover the household’s daily costs of food. For the moment, Viviano will continue to work arduously for the wellbeing of his children. This is his fifth loan with MFP. In the previous series, he demonstrated he was prompt in every one of his payments. All the members of his communal bank recognize him and, in the same manner, he feels good with each of them. With the money that he is currently requesting, he is planning to invest in the purchase of chemical fertilizers to improve his pea fields, where he is posing for the photo.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For making and selling food

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth N. sells assorted Milo (cocoa drink), powdered milk, sugar, and other provisions at Jasikan. Elizabeth has received junior high education. She is married and has 4 dependents. Her husband is a petty trader whose income is low to take care of the family.

Elizabeth has been selling provisions since 1995. She uses her income to help her husband with the housekeeping expenses. Her loan will be used to buy more of the assorted provisions she sells. She hopes to reinvest the new profit from the expanded business back into the business.

loans.use: to buy more of assorted provision to sell

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: Wilfredo tiene 39 años, es un hombre felizmente casado, de buen carácter y sobre todo, muy responsable para con sus 4 hijos, quienes viven con él en su casa propia. La mayor preocupación de Wilfredo es darles un nivel de vida muy confortable a sus hijos y se conviertan profesionales. Por ello, se dedica íntegramente a su chacra desde 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde en compañía de su esposa, ya que poco a poco vienen creciendo en sus siembras, donde esta temporada lograron sembrar dos bolsas de arvejas y eso lo llena de mucha satisfacción. Asimismo, para el próximo año se está proponiendo a sembrar el doble de papas, es decir 10 sacos de semilla, ya que en esta temporada en el mercado de la ciudad de Tarma le cotizaron a buen precio y eso le permitió acumular ganancias que invirtió en otra siembra de arvejas. En la foto nos muestra orgulloso las vainitas de sus arvejas, a las cuales le faltan algunos días para ser cosechadas. Wilfredo está muy pendiente del mercado y espera que se eleven los precios para obtener mayores ganancias. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, durante esta temporada ha demostrado ser un cliente muy cumplidor, no solo en los cuotas, sino también en la organización de su banco comunal, donde se siente muy a gusto. El préstamo que viene solicitando es para la compra de fertilizantes químicos para su nueva siembra de papas y el abonado de sus arvejas.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is 39 years old and happily married. He has a good character and above all, is very responsible for his four children, who all live with him in their house. Wilfredo's greatest concern is to give his children a very comfortable standard of living and set them on the path to good careers. To do that, he goes to work in his fields every day from 8 am to 6 pm, with his wife by his side. Little by little, they are expanding their crops. This season they managed to plant two bags of peas, and that filled them with much satisfaction. For next year, Wilfredo is planning to plant twice as many potatoes, which would be 10 sacks of seed, because potatoes earned a good price this season at Tarma's market and this would permit him to earn profits that he could invest in another crop of peas. In his photo, Wilfredo proudly shows us his pea pods, which will be harvested in a few days. Wilfredo is very dependent on the market, and he hopes that prices will go up so he can earn greater profits. This is Wilfredo's fifth loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA. This season, he has demonstrated that he is a very responsible client, not just in making his payments on time, but also in the organization of his communal bank, which he really enjoys being a part of. The loan that he is requesting is for the purchase of chemical fertilizers for his new crop of potatoes and his next planting of peas.

Translated from Spanish by Leah Karlins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For growing corn

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To bolster his shop

loans.name: Mery Celina

texts.es:
La señora Mery es socia del banco comunal “30 de Agosto”, en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 40 años de edad, es casada y madre de 03 hijos, ella pudo estudiar educación superior.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 3 años, su negocio es la venta de abarrotes, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para adquirir abarrotes.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional, por ello viene solicitando la suma de S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles, el préstamo le servirá para poder comprar azúcar, arroz, leche, fideos, aceite, conservas, etc.

Su deseo es poder llenar su tienda para que haya más movimiento de clientes, por lo que obtendría mas ganancias para  ayudar a sus hijos.

A ella le gusta de Manuela la puntualidad y la organización.
texts.en:
Sra. Mery is a member of the Communal Bank “30 de Agosto”, which is located in the Illave District of El Collao Province, Department of Puno. She is 40 years old, married, and the mother of 3 children. She was able to pursue a higher education.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 3 years. Sra. Mery operates a grocery store. Her first loan of 500 soles was used as operating capital to acquire groceries.

She is requesting another loan in the amount of 1500 soles to buy sugar, rice, milk, noodles, oil, canned goods, etc. She hopes to fill her store to encourage more customer traffic, which will result in more earnings for her to support her children. Sra. Mery likes the punctuality and organization displayed by Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sugar, rice, milk, noodles, oil, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: La Superación 3 Group

texts.en:
Ana P. (second from right) and four other members of La Superación are all seeking their very first loan with Esperanza.  Living on a hill just outsiD. of Samaná, Dominican Republic, Ana is anxious to start her very first business venture with this loan.  She plans to start a store which sells various sorts of food and drink, including chicken, vegetables, fruit and soft drinks.

Ana currently lives with her parents in a cramped home, with her two small children and another young cousin.  Looking into the future, Ana is hoping to proviD. for her children as they grow – they are currently just 2 years old and 8 months.  Currently planning on selling her wares from home, Ana seeks to one day have her own little store.  A home for her children, while still a goal some time in the future, is something she is already dreaming about.

I urge you to consider loaning to Ana and the others in her solidarity group.  All five of them have inspiring stories which have led them to take out their very first microloans.  It would be wonderful if you were to support these first-time entrepreneurs, discovering how to do business in the Dominican Republic.

For a list of all other Esperanza loans currently waiting for funding on Kiva, click on the following link:  Currently Fundraising Esperanza Loans.

Muchas gracias!

loans.use: chicken, vegetables, fruit and soft drinks

loans.name: Sandra Zenobia

texts.es:
La señora Sandra, pertenece al Banco Comunal “3 De Mayo II”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Puno, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 44 años de edad, estado civil Soltera, es madre de 03 hijos y tiene estudios superiores (Agropecuaria), vive en el Barrio Bellavista jr. Bellavista 255.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 6 años, obtuvo un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, este dinero lo utilizó para la compra de abarrotes. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1200.00 Nuevos soles, los cuales los va a invertir en la compra de arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos, conservas, aceite, etc. Además implementar su cafetín escolar en el colegio Santa Rosa de Puno.

Su deseo es poder agrandar su tienda y ejercer su profesión.

A ella le gustan las reuniones ye que comparte con sus compañeras.
texts.en:
Sandra is a member of the "Third of May II" Communal Bank, which is located in the Puno district of Puno province in the department of Puno. She is 44 years old and is a single mother of three children. She has completed superior studies in agriculture and she lives in the Bellavista Jr. neighborhood. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for the last six years. She received an initial loan of 300 new soles, and she used this money to purchase merchandise for her small grocery store. At this time she needs a loan of 1200 soles to invest in the purchase of rice, sugar, milk, noodles, canned food, oil, etc. In addition, she will use it to run the school cafeteria at the Santa Rosa de Puno high school. Her goal is to be able to expand her store and to exercise her profession. She enjoys the communal bank meetings, because she shares them with her companions.

Translated from Spanish by Leah Karlins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase groceries for her store

loans.name: Ama  Amelie

texts.fr: cette femme est mariée et mère de 03 enfants, elle habite avec sa famille dans le quartier d'adidogomé à lomé. elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de boissons alcoolisées appelé "sodabi", elle s'approvisionne à l'intérieur du pays dans la ville de Lavié.son stock de boissons est épuisé, elle veut se réapprovisionner raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 10 bidons de 25 litres de "sodabi" et assurer le transport de la marchandise.
texts.en:
This is a woman who is married and the mother of three children.  She lives in the Adidogomé district in Lomé.  Her income-generating business involves commerce in an alcoholic drink called sodabi.  She stocks up from the country's interior in the city of Lavié.  Her stock of drinks is exhausted.  She wants to stock up again, which is the reason behind her request for a loan from WAGES for buying ten 25-liter drums of sodabi and for ensuring the transport of the merchandise. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For buying drinks

loans.name: Maribel Ines

texts.es:
Maribel es socia, del Banco Comunal “3 De Mayo II”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Puno, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 20 años de edad, de estado civil soltera sin hijos y presenta estudios superiores (Turismo), en la Urb. Aziruni.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace casi 01 año, obtuvo con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, este dinero lo utilizó para la compra de frutas. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 600.00 Nuevos soles, para invertirlo en su negocio de compra y venta de frutas, ella comprará plátanos, naranjas, mandarinas, papayas, uvas, manzanas, piñas, etc.

Su sueño es abrir una empresa de Turismo y ejercer su profesión.

A ella le gusta el apoyo que reciben en su Banco Comunal ya que sus compañeras son muy unidas.
texts.en:
Maribel is a member of the Communal Bank “3 De Mayo II”, which is located in the district of Puno, Puno Province, Department of Puno. She is 20 years old, single, and does not have any children. She completed a degree in tourism and lives in La Urb. Aziruni.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for almost one year. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to buy fruit.

Maribel is now requesting a loan of 600 soles for her fruit trading business. She will purchase bananas, oranges, tangerines, papayas, grapes, apples, pineapples, etc.

Her dream is to start a tourism company and utilize her degree. She likes the support she receives from her Communal Bank since her fellow members are very close.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bananas, oranges, tangerines, papayas, grapes, apples, pineapples, etc.

loans.name: Wilma Ines

texts.es:
La señora Wilma es socia del Banco Comunal “Inmaculada Concepción” que esta ubicado en la Distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 44 años de edad, es casada y madre de 5 hijos, ella estudió educación secundaria completa, vive en el Barrio San Juan, Jr San Juan.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace mas de 9 año, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para su negocios de elaboración de artesanías.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional, por ello viene solicitando la suma de S/. 2000.00 nuevos soles, con este monto ella va a adquirir bayetas (telas d ela zona), lana  de distintos colores, para elaboración de bordados, y lana de alpaca de diferentes colores para elaboración de prendas de vestir como chompas, chalecos, y accesorios.

Su deseo es poner una tienda de venta de artesanías en la ciudad de Puno, al mismo tiempo poder importar.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las reuniones.
texts.en:
Sra. Wilma is a member of the Communal Bank “Inmaculada Concepción” (Immaculate Conception), which is located in the district of Juli, Chucuito Province, Department of Puno. She is 44 years old, married, and the mother of 5 children. She has a high school education. Sra. Wilma lives in the neighborhood of San Juan, Jr. San Juan.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for more than 9 years. Her first loan of 300 soles was used as operating capital for her handicrafts business.

She now needs another loan in the amount of 2000 soles. She will acquire bayetas (a type of fabric produced in the area), different colors of acrylic wool, and different colors of alpaca wool for making embroideries and clothing such as sweaters, vests, and accessories.

Sra. Wilma hopes to have a store in the city of Puno where she can sell her handicrafts. At the same, she would like to import other products.

She enjoys her savings and her Communal Bank meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric & different colors of wool

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For growing corn

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: growing maize

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Cette dame a appris la couture et s'est spécialisée depuis deux ans dans le commerce de pagnes Baoulés qui sont des pagnes très appréciés à Lomé. Elle est mariée et a à sa charge 02 personnes. Son stock ayant connu une baisse, elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour reconstituer son stock avec 20 pagnes Baoulés de nouvelle qualité.
texts.en:
This lady learned sewing and has been specialized for the past two years in selling a sort of "pagne" (lengths of brightly colored African print cloth) which is greatly appreciated in Lomé: Baoulé fabrics. She is married and responsible for 2 people. Her stocks are low, so she is asking WAGES for a loan that will allow her to replenish them by buying 20 lengths of new-quality Baoulé "pagne" fabric.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing lengths of 'pagne Baoulé'

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: growing maize

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: growing maize

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary owns and runs a small clinic in the Pipeline area of Nairobi. She has been running this business for three years. Mary would like to diversify her income and has requested a loan of Ksh. 35,000 to add a larger stock of medicine and purchase a water tank. Given the drought Kenya is facing, water distribution has become a good source of additional income. A true business woman, Mary also hopes to enter the real estate business in the future. On a personal level, Mary hopes to one day own her own home. She describes herself as a self-disciplined and hard-working woman.



Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable micro-finance institution that offers savings and credit services to more than 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add stock of medicine and buy a water tank

loans.name: Maria Deisyis

texts.es: María Deisyis H. Z. tiene 5 hijos a su cargo y todos estudian con el sacrificio de su Madre. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio. A ella le gusta su trabajo por lo que siempre le gusta hablar con sus clientes de muchos temas y esto es una buena manera de tomar experiencia. El mayor desafío que enfrento María fue el tiempo por lo que tenía que hacerse cargo de su familia y su negocio, ya que sus hijos estaban muy pequeños y necesitaban la atención correspondiente además tenía que salir a vender sus productos. Con el dinero solicitado comprara ropa en general, adornos, calzado y bolsos. Su mayor deseo es obtener otro negocio.
texts.en:
María Deisyis H. Z. has 5 dependent children and all of them attend school because of the sacrifices she makes as a mother. She has been in the business of selling general merchandise for 6 years. She enjoys her job because she always likes talking with her customers about different topics, which is a good way to learn new things. The biggest challenge María faces is having enough time to take care of both her family and her business. Her children are very young and require attention, but she has to leave them in order to run her business.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy clothing, accessories, shoes and handbags. Her greatest desire is to go into another business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: La Superación 4 Group

texts.en:
Rosangel G. (second from right) is the coordinator of a group of five women who are all entering their first group loan with Esperanza. While this is her first group loan, Rosangel has successfully paid back an individual loan from Esperanza in the past. She is extremely excited to use her loan to advance the business she currently owns – a beauty salon. Three years into owning this salon, Rosangel styles hair, gives manicures, and works with fake fingernails, and she also sells used clothing from her home.

Rosangel currently lives with her husband and four children, ages 18, 17, 15 and 5 in a small house loaned to them by her aunt. She would love to buy her own home with her husband in the future. Currently he is working hard as a taxi and bus driver in town to augment the income Rosangel brings in. Another goal for Rosangel is to construct a small building next to her home, or elsewhere, to house her beauty salon. Currently, the salon is in her home, which while convenient isn’t the best place for a business when living with four children.

I strongly encourage you to loan to Rosangel and the others in her group in La Superación. Each of them have their own hopes and desires with their businesses and families, and your loan will immediately impact their lives and bring them one step closer to a more desirable living situation. For a list of all other Esperanza loans currently waiting for funding on Kiva, click on the following link: Currently Fundraising Esperanza Loans. Muchas gracias!

loans.use: beauty products and other materials

loans.name: Kodjo Hobuame

texts.fr: Ce Monsieur sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour reconstituer son stock de produits congelés et d'alimentation générale en état d'épuisement. Il exerce ce commerce depuis 2007 ce qui lui permet de se prendre en charge. Célibataire, il habite le quartier Gblinkomé à Lomé où il exerce son commerce.
texts.en:
This gentleman is asking WAGES for a loan to replenish his stock of frozen foods and groceries, presently almost expended. He has been in this business since 2007 and it allows him to support himself. He is single and lives in the Gblinkomé district in Lomé where he also has his business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of frozen foods and groceries

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is 25 years old and owns a small chemist's (pharmacy) in the Pipeline area of Nairobi. Since becoming a member of Faulu, Faith has increased her business knowledge from the training provided. She has requested her first loan of Ksh. 35,000 in order to increase her stock of medicine and attract more customers. She aspires to one day sell medicines wholesale.  On a personal level, Faith would like to live a comfortable life and one day own a home. She describes herself as honest and friendly.




Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable micro-finance institution that offers savings and credit services to more than 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add wider stock of medicine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For growing sweet potatoe

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For growing corn

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a 28-year-old mother of two who has run a small business selling charcoal for the past year. She has requested her first loan of Ksh. 25,000 in order to purchase additional bags of charcoal to sell. She would like to continue to expand her business, one day becoming a charcoal wholesaler. Janet’s hopes for the future include not having to worry about money, sending her children to school, and purchasing a plot of land on which to build a home.





Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable micro-finance institution that offers savings and credit services to more than 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add to her stock of charcoal

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent O. owns a beauty salon where a variety of hair styles are done for women. She is also a petty trader in Kwamikrom who sells assorted provisions. Millicent has received junior high education. She is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a petty trader whose income is too low to take care of the family.

Millicent has been selling goods since 2000. She is responsible for the housekeeping expenses. Her loan will be used to buy provisions for resale and hairdressing products for her salon. She hopes to reinvest the profit from her expanded business back into the business.

loans.use: to buy provisions for resale and hairdressing products for her salon

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen M. sells provisions, bags of rice and sugar in Kwamikrom. Stephen has received schooling through junior high. He is married and has two children. His wife is a trader.

Stephen has been selling provision since 1997. He is responsible for the financial needs of the entire family. His loan will be used to buy more provisions, sugar and bags of rice to sell. He will reinvest the new profits from his expanded business.

loans.use: To buy more provisions, sugar and bags of rice to sell

loans.name: Amelé

texts.fr: Cette femme est mariée et a 04 enfants à sa charge, pour apporter une contribution financière au foyer, elle a entamé en 2000 le commerce de charbon de bois, elle s'approvisionne à l'intérieur du pays et réalise ainsi de bonnes marges bénéficiaires sur ses ventes.faisant face actuellement à une rupture de stock elle veut reconstituer son stock raison pour laquelle Elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 30 sacs de charbons de bois.
texts.en:
This woman is married and has four children to support.  To contribute financially at home, she started doing commerce in charcoal in 2000.  She supplies herself from the country's interior and in this way realizes good profit margins on her sales.  Right now, facing an inventory shortage, she wants to replenish her stock. This is the reason behind her request for a WAGES loan for buying 30 sacks of charcoal.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For buying sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Christian

texts.en:
Christian A. is married and has four dependents. He has received schooling through junior high. His wife is a petty trader.

Christian sells provisions and building materials at Kwamikrom, which he has done since 2002. Christian uses his income solely to pay for the financial needs of his family. He will use the loan to purchase more provisions and building materials for resale. With the new profits from his expanded business, Christian plans to reinvest.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and building materials to sell

loans.name: Iriva

texts.en:
Irina is divorced and has two grown up children. She sells bed sheets at the central market in Pavlograd city and has been in this business for eighteen years. She has many repeat clients. This business is the only source of income for Irina.

Irina would like to borrow 9,000 UAH to purchase blankets and pillows. She has used Hope loans before and finds them very useful for her business.

loans.use: To purchase blankets and pillows to sell

loans.name: Desarrollo Comunitario 4 Group

texts.en:
Maria A. (far left) is extremely excited to receive her first loan from Kiva partner Esperanza International. For three years, she has maD. delicious frozen fruit juices which many in her neighborhood pick up for breakfast. Her flavors incluD. cantaloupe, passion fruit, cherry and pineapple. Along with these treats, Maria makes fresh bread to augment her sales.

Maria lives with her husband and one of her three children who is currently working at a local resort. While her son is now in his late 20s, he wants to return to school sometime soon. With only nine months of the Dominican equivalent of high school left, it is very possible that he can complete his high school, and then consider moving on to a more advanced degree.

In the future, Maria also hopes to apply any extra income to improving her home and to expanding the selection of goods she can afford to make and sell. She would love to begin selling more treats, such as cookies and other baked goods which would complement her frozen juice. She hopes, if her business takes off, to make her home out of cement blocks, rather than just wood. A home maD. of these blocks is extremely important to many Dominicans, as it withstands rain and does not rot away.

Esperanza International encourage you to give to Maria and the others in her group. All are committed to stewarding their loan wisely and have dreams and wishes to improve their living situation and that of their families.

Muchas gracias!

loans.use: To purchase juice making and baking materials

loans.name: Sona

texts.en:
Sona B. is the married mother of an enthusiastic family. Passing through many difficulties after she was internally displaced during the Armenian-Azerbaijan war, when she lost everything she had, she was brave to start from zero and build her own business again. She works for the well-being and happiness of her two sons.

Sona is a very hardworking woman who rises early in the morning to feed her cattle. She wants to improve the setup of her business to increase her earnings. In order to satisfy her goal for a higher quality of life, Sona needs to buy more cattle to raise for sale. She is seeking a loan of 2,000 USD for this. Let’s support this hardworking and talented woman so that she can obtain her goals!

loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Nigar

texts.en:
Nigar A. is the 58-year-old mother of seven children. She dedicated herself to raising poultry in the small city called Bilasuvar.

After she suffered from the Armenian-Azerbaijan conflict in 1992 she started her life from scratch to provide the necessities for her children. She raises poultry and sells them to the local market traders. The most popular are chickens and turkeys. Nigar is very polite to all her clients and that’s why people come to her.

Now, Nigar has applied for a 2,000 USD loan to increase the number of her poultry. This will allow her to increase her income and improve her life conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more poultry to increase her income

loans.name: Novrasta

texts.en:
Novrasta M. is the married mother of five children. Knowledge from her parents and grandparents has contributed to Novrasta's work breeding sheep in a special space in her home. Her work in animal sales generates a good income for her family.

Currently she has a small herd of twelve sheep at her house. Little by little, she would like to increase the variety of her animals and is seeking a loan of 2,000 USD. Novrasta’s dream is to see her children complete their education.

loans.use: To purchase twenty sheep and fodder

loans.name: Shahlar

texts.en:
Shahlar Q. is a hard-working man who is in agriculture. He acquired his abilities in animal breeding when he was very young and has worked at this business for a long time. He is a married father with responsibilities for supporting his three sons.

Shahlar is known as being very responsible and hard-working because, every day, very early in the morning, he starts his job taking care of his fields and raising cattle in his own pen located at his house. Shahlar works as a teacher at local school, but his main income comes from raising cattle.

Today, Shahlar trusts that his loan will be approved and he will be able to improve his business with the purchase of four cattle.

loans.use: To purchase four more cattle

loans.name: Sarmast

texts.en:
Sarmast Q. has an animal husbandry business. He has secondary education but, because he does not have a specialized education, animal husbandry is the only source of income for his family. He buys calves at the market for a low price, feeds them and then resells in the same market for more profit. He has a small barn where he breeds the calves.

Sarmast is 53 years old, married and has four children. He provides the markets with meat and his family with food. Sarmast wants to buy young cattle and needs a loan of $2000 US. He is very grateful to all those who can support him.

loans.use: To purchase four cattle

loans.name: İsmayıl

texts.en:
Ismayil J. is dedicated to the business of livestock. He distinguishes himself by having a lot of experience when it comes to livestock. He supports his spouse and five children and also provides for their education. Thanks to his hard work, he has been able to support his children so that they can get ahead.

Ismayil is hoping for the support of Aqroinvest with the goal of obtaining a loan of $2000 US. The loan will allow him to purchase young cattle, raise and breed them, and in this way, to earn more. Both Ismayil and his loving family will benefit from this loan.

loans.use: To purchase four cattle

loans.name: Qeyrat

texts.en:
Qeyrat S. is a farmer who grows potatoes, something he has done for six years. For Qeyrat, there is nothing better than being in touch with nature and watching the crops of his labor grow year after year. This is the only thing he knows how to do and what he likes most.

Qeyrat is 47 years old and married with two children. Now he wants to borrow money to purchase seeds and fertilizer for his crop. This is a first loan for Qeyrat and he promises to repay the loan in time without any violations.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Wanda De Los Angeles

texts.es: Wanda de los Ángeles Rodríguez L. tiene 23 años. Es una joven muy emprendedora. Ella tiene 1 hijo y es madre soltera por lo que su mayor prioridad es el desarrollo y el buen crecimiento de su hijo. Desde muy joven se dedico a este negocio, y siempre ha trato de brindar lo mejor de su trabajo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de mercadería en general, por lo que tiene clientes jóvenes. Ella tiene muchos proyectos en mente, pero siempre quiere mantener este negocio. El destino del dinero será para compra de productos como camisas, pantalones, faldas, ropa interior, calzado y bolsos.
texts.en:
Wanda de los Ángeles Rodríguez L. is 23 years old. She is a very enterprising young woman. She has one son and is a single mother, so her main priority is the development and good upbringing of her child. From a very young age she has dedicated herself to this business and always tries to offer her best to her work.
