The economic activity that she dedicates herself to is the sale of general merchandise as her clients are young. She has many projects in mind, but always wants to keep this business. The money is destined to buy things like shirts, pants, skirts, underwear, shoes and bags.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Alikram

texts.en:
Alikram K. has worked for the last three years in the difficult business of raising cattle. After purchasing his cattle, Alikram provides them with all the right conditions for their growth: taking care of their food and protection and making sure they don’t get lost. Once they’re fully mature, Alikram sells them in his area and also provides their milk for sale. His wife helps him with the care and feeding of his animals. Alikram was very excited to share with us the news that his cow is pregnant now.

He is an exemplary husband in that he always tries his hardest to provide food for his wife and son. Currently Alikram needs to purchase cattle to raise and for this reason has applied for $2000 US. He thanks Kiva for the support provided to entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase four cattle

loans.name: Vahid

texts.en:
Vahid M. has a lot of experience in cattle breeding because he has been observing it for more than 15 years. His wife helps him with his business. He is 51 years old, married and has two children. Vahid is a hardworking man who has fought to provide for his family and educate his children.

Over time, he has increased his sales, and now he needs assistance investing in his business. The business has been going well and he would like it to continue to grow. Vahid has applied for a loan of $2000 US to buy young cattle. He and his wife thank you very much for the support you offer them to continue this business, and for helping them give their children a better quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase four cattle

loans.name: Bakhtiyar

texts.en:
Bakhtiyar M. has a grocery store where he sells different kinds of foodstuffs. He began this enterprise six years ago with a starting capital of $100. Thanks to his perseverance and dedication, over time he has expanded his business and now it is a family-run business.

Bakhtiyar is married with two children. He has always been a hardworking man who has made sure, from a young age, that his family never goes without their daily bread. Today, Bakhtiyar needs to buy additional foodstuffs for increasing the variety of his goods. For this purpose, he is requesting a loan of $2000 US. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices, and push every once in a while, to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Dionisio Eduardo

texts.es: Dionisio Eduardo C. tiene 59 años. Ella tiene casa propia. Su actividad económica es la pesca. Hace más de 21 años que se dedica a este negocio. El un  hombre muy humilde por lo que sus productos los lleva a ofrecer a los diferentes mercados en donde sus clientes compran sus productos. Además cuando no logran vender todo una parte de sus productos son para su familia. Por lo que el trabajo incrementa cuando hay una época en el año cuando es la temporada de pesca. En futuro le gustaría comprar otro bote en donde pueda asignarlo a uno de sus hijos. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de materiales que son necesarios para desempeñar su trabajo.
texts.en:
Dionisio Eduardo C. is 59 years old and lives in his own home. He has been in the fishing business for over 21 years. He offers his merchandise at the different markets where customers buy from him. Whatever he does not sell, his family gets to keep. His business increases during fishing season. In the future, he would like to buy another boat so that he can assign it to one of his children.

The loan he is requesting will be used as operating capital to buy materials necessary for him to perform his job.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Exotic plants in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand the variety of goods in his grocery store.

loans.name: Betis Carolina

texts.es: Betis Carolina R. A. tiene 37 años de edad, es una mujer casada. Tiene 3 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de cosméticos. Hace más de 11 años que se dedica a esta humilde actividad. Ella dio inicio vendiendo cosméticos en un canasto en las afueras de su vivienda, en donde ofrecía pinturas de labios, pinturas de uñas de una manera muy humilde Betis se gana la vida. Posteriormente logro recoger un poco mas de dinero y decide invertir en este negocio. Actualmente ella es una persona que lucha por salir adelante con su familia. El motivo el financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra cremas, pintura de labios, pinturas de uñas, cremas faciales y delineadores. Su mayor sueño es que todos los esfuerzos que ha hecho por sus hijos sirvan para un futuro.
texts.en:
Betis Carolina R. A. is a 37 years old married woman. She has 3 children in her care. She sells cosmetics and has dedicated herself to this unpretentious activity for the past 11 years. She began selling cosmetics from a large basket outside her home, offering lipstick and nail polish. In this humble way, Betis earned a living. After saving a little more money she decided to invest in the business. These days, she is a person who works hard to succeed for her family. The motive behind the financing she is requesting is for working capital to buy creams, lipstick, nail polish, facial creams and eyeliner. Her greatest dream is that all the efforts she is making will give her children a future.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more cleaning fluids.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Doña Alicia de 43 años de edad es casada, tiene 2 hijos, uno mayor que le ayuda con los gastos del hogar y uno de 12 años en edad escolar, ademas cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo,  trabaja como enfermera en el Hospital Asuncion desde hace 17 años; esta solicitando su 8vo credito para mejorar su vivienda construyendo un porche, cabe mencionar que con los creditos anteriores ha logrado mejorar su casa poniendole la ceramica, aunque hasta en este credito sera beneficiada con el fondo Kiva.  El mayor sueño de doña Alicia es seguir mejorando su casita pues es el patrimonio que dejara a sus hijos cuando ella falte.
texts.en:
Doña Alicia is 43 years old, married, and has 2 children. Her oldest child helps with the household expenses, while the other child is a 12 year old student. She has the support of her husband. Doña Alicia has worked as a nurse at Asuncion Hospital for 17 years.

She is requesting her 8th loan in order to improve her house by adding a porch. It should be mentioned that her previous home improvement loan was used to install a ceramic tile floor, but this is the first time her loan has benefited from Kiva funding.

Doña Alicia’s greatest dream is to continue improving her house because it is the only family asset that she has to pass on to her children when she is gone.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a porch

loans.name: Safar

texts.en: Safar S. is a 43-year-old married father with two children. Safar has a small tea-shop where he provides clients with fresh and tasty tea. The tea ceremony is very important among Azerbaijani people and his place is quite popular in the region where he lives. He starts his working day at 11am and around 1pm people begin to come to his place which is usually open until 3-4am.  When his place became popular enough he was able to dedicate his whole time to the business.  Safar wants a loan to invest in tables, chairs and utensils.  He is requesting $2000 so he can expand his business, earn more profit, and in turn help his children complete their school studies and further continue studying at the University. The well-being of this family is in your hands. Contribute to the growth of his business and they will be grateful!

loans.use: To purchase tables, chairs, and utensils for his cafe.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase four cattle.

loans.name: Mirakhil

texts.en: Since he was young, Mirakhil V. has known work. His parents taught him how be successful as an farmer, and he learned very well. Now that he is a father, he still works as an farmer.  Thanks to his parents, Mirakhil now has the opportunity to move forward as a farmer, and he hopes to increase his agricultural products so that he can bring his loved ones a more promising life.  Despite being a good agriculturalist and worker he needs help to move forward and improve his production. This is why he is asking for a loan, so that he can buy more of the seeds and fertilizers he needs. They are very expensive, and without them his production will not improve. You can help Mirakhil keep moving forward with his development plans.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer, fuel, and lubricants.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase four cattle.

loans.name: Las Delicias Group

texts.es:
Banco D. Emprendimiento: LAS DELICIAS  fue fundado el 03 D. AGOSTO del 2009, a iniciativa D. un grupo D. señoras que tienen un pequeño negocio y desean surguir en un negocio, el grupo  esta en su 2do ciclo, compuesto por 16 personas,entre otras actividades estan la venta D. bijouteria, comida, costura y sastreria, promotoras D. cosmeticos, venta D. pastillas y refresco D. mocochinchi (durazno seco), venta D. helados, panaderia, pintado en tela, que son actividades que necesitan creditos rapidos.Las Señoras estan conforme D. trabajar con Emprender, porque aprendieron ahorrar y tener mucha responsabilidad, respeto y al mismo tiempo compartir con sus amigas y vecinas cada quincena.			
La Sra.ELDA M.  es Presidenta del grupo, es nueva  como presidenta del Banco D. Emprendimiento. Ella se dedica a la venta D. pan ademas D. ir a vender a provincia bijouteria, atienD. a sus hijos, es una persona amigable y muy dinamica, ademas D. ello es una persona cumplida y responsable .Tambien ella es unas D. las lideres del grupo y hace que todas cumplan con sus cuotas.			
La Sra. Juanita G. es la tesorera, socia antigua. Se dedica al rubro D. venta D. bijouteria y animales, dentro del rubro tiene 4 años D. antiguedad y tambien  realiza labores D. casa. Con los ingresos que percibe ayuda al sustento D. su familia y ademas D. considerarla que  es  responsable y cumplida en el grupo. 			
La Sra. Marcela T.,  ella es secretaria  del BE Las Delicias, se dedica al pintado en tela, realiza manteles, servilletas y pintado en poleras, tiene 18 años y aún sigue estudiando y perfeccionando sus tecnicas D. pintado en tela tiene, 3 años D. antigüedad  en el rubro, trabaja D. lunes a sabado 5 horas al dia, su trabajo mayormente es atender a la gente que visita su domicilio para hacerle los pedidos.
texts.en:
Bank of Entrepreneurship: LAS DELICIAS

This bank was established on August 03, 2009 as an initiative by a group of women entrepreneurs to develop their small businesses. The group is on its 2nd loan cycle and consists of 16 members. Their businesses offer the following products and services: jewelry, food, sewing and tailoring, cosmetics, medicines, refreshments (such as mocochinchi), ice cream, baked goods, hand-painted fabrics, and other activities that require access to quick credit. The members are satisfied with the work of Emprender because they have learned how to save and handle more responsibility. As a group, they respect one another and enjoy the time they share when they meet every two weeks.

Sra. Elda M. is the group president and new to this position. She sells bread and is planning to also sell jewelry. She takes care of her children and is a very friendly and dynamic person. Sra. Elda has also demonstrated that she is an accomplished and responsible leader, since she has met all of her loan commitments.

Sra. Juanita G. is the group treasurer and a long-time member. In addition to selling jewelry and animals, she also handles the chores at homes. With the income she earns, she is able to support her family. Sra. Juanita is considered one of the most respected and accomplished members of the group.

Sra. Marcela T. is the group secretary. She makes hand-painted fabrics used for tablecloths, napkins, and T-shirts. She is 18 years old and is still studying and perfecting her painting techniques. Sra. Marcela has 3 years experience with her business. She works 5 hours a day, Monday through Saturday. Her job is primarily to meet the people who visit her shop to place their orders.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase operating capital & purchase merchandise

loans.name: Umud

texts.en:
Umud A. is a farmer who cultivates corn, potato, cucumber, tomatoes, and water lemon.  He is doing his best to increase his yield to support his family. At the same time, Umud works as s driver. He is 42 years old and has 3 children. Umud has managed the farm for 13 years. Because of his farm, he has been able to feed his family and dreams of having all of his children graduate from school and college so that they can find better jobs for their future families. 

Umud is asking a loan of 2000 USD to buy seeds and fertilizer for his farm. He will use the loan to increase his yield and support his family. With the part of the loan, he will also purchase cattle. Let’s support this hard-working and talented man so that he can obtain his goals!

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase four cattle

loans.name: Claudia Anaite

texts.es: Cliente que viven con su madre tiene su negocio de venta de lubricantes y estudia a la vez, gracias a su negocio ella puede continuar con sus estudios en la universidad y colaborar con los gastos familiares, su madre le colabora en la atencion del negocio mientras ella va a la uiniversidad, Claudia pese a ser una persona muy joven es muy responsable.
texts.en:
This client lives with her mother and has a business selling automobile lubricants. At the same, she is also attending school. Thanks to her business, she can continue her university studies and work to cover her family’s expenses. Her mother manages the business while she is at school. Despite being so young, Claudia is a very responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase motor oil in bulk

loans.name: Yesenia Katherin

texts.es:
La señora YESENIA KATHERIN B. S., tiene 19 años, vive en el distrito de la Esperanza , provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Mar y Cielo II.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5º de secundaria, y no pudo continuar con estudios técnicos o superiores debido a que quedo embarazada. 
YESENIA, se dedica a la comercialización de quesos, roscas, quesillo, manjarblanco, kinkones.
Este primer crédito de 300 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de mas productos lácteos, los cuales los venderá en Trujillo de puerta de puerta.

YESENIA, sueña con tener un local donde pueda vender sus productos lácteos al por mayor y generar más ganancias.
texts.en:
Sra. Yesenia Katherin B. S. is 19 years old. She lives in the District of Esperanza, Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad – Perú. She belongs to the Communal Bank “Mar y Cielo II” (Sea & Sky II).

This entrepreneur completed her education through the 5th year of secondary school. She did not continue on to pursue any higher education because she became pregnant. Yesenia sells hard cheese, string cheese, cream cheese, and manjar blanco. In addition, she sells a dessert called kinkones (translated as “King Kong Cookies” – it is a layered cookie that contains fillings of peanuts, pineapple, and manjar blanco).

She is requesting her first loan in the amount of 300 soles. She plans to purchase more dairy products, which she will sell in Trujillo door-to-door. Yesenia dreams of having a vending post where she can sell dairy products wholesale and generate more revenue.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase dairy products for resale

loans.name: Martha De La Cruz

texts.es: La Señora Martha de la Cruz Alonso A. tiene 48 años de edad. Sus 2 hijos trabajan de manera independiente. Es una Señora muy luchadora y tiene un espíritu muy alegre. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es una pulpería. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio, ya que su esposa trabajaba en una empresa pero debido a ciertas circunstancias tuvo que ir a la guerra, y murió y con la ayuda de la familia logro salir adelante con este pequeño negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de granos básicos, detergente, jabón y golosinas en general. Su deseo es seguir apoyando a sus hijos, ya que ella es madre y padre al mismo tiempo.
texts.en:
Sra. Martha de la Cruz Alonso A. is 48 years old. Her two children work independently. This woman is a fighter, yet possesses a very cheerful spirit. She spends her time operating a grocery store and has been in business for 6 years. Sra. Martha’s husband was a company employee before he was drafted to fight in battle and eventually died in combat. With the support of her family, she was able to move forward with this small business.

The loan she is requesting will be used as operating capital to buy basic grains, detergent, soap, candy, and other general items. She hopes to continue supporting her children, since she has to be a mother and a father at the same time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
En el Centro Focal  “Juan Pablo II” se encuentra la Asociación Comunal “Nuevo Amanecer”, un grupo de señoras muy alegres y dinámicas, ellas se agruparon  por la necesidad de contar con un capital de trabajo que les permita generar ingresos, además desean lograr ahorros para cubrir eventos inesperados.

Todas tienen negocios diferentes como la  venta de chocolates, cosméticos, tienda de productos alimenticios, frutas y revistas y necesitan el préstamo para  la compra  de mercadería (chocolates, perfumes, fideo, arroz, naranja, mandarina, revistas).
texts.en:
The Community Association "Nuevo Amanecer" is located at the “Juan Pablo II” center. A very happy and dynamic group of ladies started the group because they were in need of working capital to start a business that allowed them to have an income and save to cover unexpected events. All of the members have different businesses such as the selling of chocolates, cosmetics, groceries, fruits and magazines. They are asking for a loan that will be invested in the purchase of goods (chocolates, perfumes, noodles, rice, oranges, tangerines, magazines).

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Santa Maria Group

texts.es:
Banco D. Emprendimiento: SANTA MARIA se fundo a iniciativa D. señoras que tienen un pequeños negocios y desean surgir en usus actividades. El grupo  esta en su 4to ciclo, compuesto por 12 personas;  en el grupo hay señoras que se dedican a la venta D. bijouteria, comida, promotoras D. cosmeticos, venta D. pastillas y refresco D. durazno, venta D. pan, tejidos artesanales, elaboracion D. colchones, que son actividades que necesitan creditos rapidos.			
La Sra.Eloisa M. es Presidenta del grupo, es antigua  como presidenta del Banco D. Emprendimiento Santa Maria. Se dedica a la venta D. comida, atienD. a su hijo, es una persona amigable y muy dinamica, ademas D. ello es una persona cumplida , con los ingresos que percibe ayuda al sustento D. su hogar.			
La Sra. Rosmery F. G. es la tesorera del Banco D. Emprendimiento Santa Maria. se dedica al rubro D. venta comida, almuerzo y cena, dentro del rubro tiene 5 años D. antiguedad y tambien realiza labores D. casa. Tiene 2 hijos, a los cuales los hace estudiar, las socias del grupo la consideran un ejemplo.			
La Sra. Deisy Amparo G.,  es la secretaria  del BE Santa Maria, se dedica a la venta D. zapatos además D. atender su ventita D. refrescos al mismo tiempo,  tiene 4 años D. antigüedad  en el rubro, trabaja D. lunes a sabado, 12 horas al día, su trabajo mayormente es atender a la gente que visita su negocio.
texts.en:
Bank of Entrepreneurship: SANTA MARIA

This bank was initiated by a group of women who wanted to develop their small businesses. There are currently 12 members (both men and women). They are in their 4th loan cycle and are engaged in various retail businesses such as jewelry, food, cosmetics, medicines, peach nectar, bread, hand-woven fabrics, mattresses, and other products that require quick access to credit.

Sra. Eloisa M. is the president of the group and has served in this capacity before. She sells food, takes care of her son, and is a very friendly and dynamic person. Through her accomplishments, she has been able to generate an income to help support her household.

Sra. Rosmery F. G. is the group treasurer. She has a local business selling food for lunch and dinner. She has 5 years of experience and also takes care of the household chores. Sra. Rosmery has 2 school-aged children. The other members look up to her as a role model.

Sra. Deisy Amparo G. is the group secretary. She sells shoes and also operates a refreshments stand. She has 4 years of experience and works 12 hours a day, Monday through Saturday. Her work mostly involves attending to the people who visit her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase operating capital & purchase merchandise

loans.name: Año Nuevo Aymara Group

texts.es: En uno de los Centros Focales de Pro Mujer  “Los Andes” se encuentra la Asociación Comunal “Año nuevo aymará”, están juntas hace  5 años aproximadamente, su presidenta es  Julia F. quién las organiza para elaborar su reglamento interno, además la Responsable Popular de Salud las orienta para hacer uso del consultorio. Todas tienen sus propios negocios como la producción de sillones, artesanía en macramé, salón de peinados, atención de librería, servicio de estampados, fabricación de cordeles y venta de cosméticos. Necesitan el préstamo para incrementar su capital de trabajo, comprando insumos y mercadería.
texts.en:
The Community Association "Año Nuevo Aymara” is located in one of the focal points of Pro Mujer "Los Andes". The members have been working together for about 5 years. Its president is Julia F. who organized them and developed internal regulations. She is responsible for Health guidelines for the use of the clinic.

All the members have their own businesses such as the production of chairs, macramé crafts, beauty salon, bookstore, print service, twine manufacturing and sale of cosmetics. They need the loan to increase working capital and to buy supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Frederick

texts.en:
Frederick takes pride in serving his customers well, which is why he is starting his own business. Previously, as a fire inspector for government agencies, he spent a lot of time checking day care centers and other commercial outlets for fire hazards. However, he wanted to be able to show his customers he appreciated their business by offering them discounts or giving them free services in exchange for repeat business. At government agencies, bureaucratic red tape made this impossible, so Frederick had to explore some other options.

Vehicle emissions inspection seemed a natural career course for him, because it would enable him to work for himself and use his prior training. A year and a half ago, with the idea to start an emissions testing center, he enrolled in and completed an emissions testing certification course.

Though Frederick deals with typical business challenges like finding a visible location for his center, he is so much happier now that he is able to offer his customers better service. After using his first ACCION USA loan to purchase an emissions analysis machine for his center, he plans to open up more centers in other counties in Georgia that require emissions testing.

loans.use: Emissions testing machine

loans.name: Fenumiai

texts.en:
Fenumiai S. is a 51-year-old woman living in Faleula Fogaa. She is married and has six adult children. Fenumiai owns and operates a general store from which she sells a variety of different products to the local community. She recently opened her store and is earning approximately 650 WST a month in business.

Fenumiai joined SPBD to gain access to their financial services designed to improve her living situation and business activities. She successfully repaid her previous loan of 4400 WST from SPBD that was used to purchase additional inventory for her store. Fenumiai is now requesting a loan of 3250 WST which will be used to purchase additional goods to sell. The loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Fenumiai from SPBD.

About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life for people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es: Eduardo es un joven de 21 años de edad, de 6 hermanos, él es el último. Hace poco falleció su padre, por lo que está muy pendiente de su madre, con la que vive, además de con uno de sus hermanos. Desde pequeño su padre le enseñó las técnicas agrícolas y por el momento está avocado en cultivar las chacras que sembró en vida su padre, hasta lograr comercializar los productos en el mercado de la ciudad de Tarma. Eduardo considera que la agricultura es muy rentable, pero necesita de mucho trabajo y alta inversión económica en fertilizantes y fungicidas. Eduardo recuerda con gran nostalgia cada una de las enseñanzas y métodos de su padre y los aplica oportunamente en cada una de sus siembras, donde es apoyado por su madre y su hermano. Para el futuro, Eduardo desea incrementar sus cultivos, en aras de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su madre. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, él ingresa en reemplazo de su padre al banco comunal, motivado por su madre y con el consentimiento de los demás integrantes. El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes químicos para sus cultivos de papas y arvejas.
texts.en:
Eduardo is 21 years old and has 6 brothers. He is the youngest child. Eduardo’s father recently passed away. He still lives with his mother and one of his brothers. As a boy, his father taught him farming techniques. His father made his living growing avocados, which he would sell in the market in Tarma. Eduardo considers farming to be very profitable, but it requires a lot of work and financial investment in fertilizers and fungicides. He remembers with great fondness each of the methods and pieces of advice that his father gave him for each type of crop. Eduardo has the support of his mother and brother. In the future, he would like to increase his production so that he can improve the quality of life for his family.

This is his first loan with MFP. Encouraged by his mother, Eduardo acquired his father’s membership with the communal bank and the other group members consented. The money he is requesting will be used to purchase chemical fertilizers for his crops of potatoes and peas.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Celestino

texts.es: Celestino tiene 48 años, es un hombre muy noble y trabajador, vive felizmente casado con la madre de sus dos hijos en su casa del campo. Por más de 28 años viene sembrando papa y arvejas, él está muy satisfecho porque sus cultivos siempre le han resultado muy rentables. Por ello, en aras de incrementar sus ganancias hace dos años sembró gladiolos, con los cuales le fue muy bien. Desde entonces se siente muy motivado por sus cultivos y más aun con el apoyo de su esposa, y el de sus hijos durante el fin de semana. Los meses de mayo y octubre es cuando Celestino obtiene mayores ganancias con sus flores, ya que por la docena le pagan entre 75 y 85 soles, sobrepasando el resto de sus ingresos. Estas ganancias le permiten pagar el alquiler de las chacras que utiliza, por lo que para el futuro se ha propuesto comprar sus propios terrenos de regadío. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, él esta muy entusiasmado de incorporarse a un banco comunal, por ello hace el compromiso de pagar puntualmente todas sus cuotas mensuales. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes químicos para que puedan empezar a abrir los capullos de sus flores.
texts.en:
Celestino is 48 years old. He is a very noble man and a hard worker. He is happily married to the mother of his two children, and they live in a house in the country. For 28 years, Celestino has been planting potatoes and peas and has been satisfied with his crops because they are very profitable. In order to increase his income, she started planting gladiolus two years ago and has become very good at it. Since he is motivated by his results, Celestino's wife and children decided to support him on the weekends in this endeavor.

The months of May and October are when Celestino earns the highest profits for his flowers. He generates between 75-85 soles per dozen, which surpasses the rest of his income. His earnings will be used to rent more land for farming, with hopes that in the future he will be able to purchase his own land for irrigation.

This is Celestino's first loan with MFP. He is excited to join a communal bank and is committed to make his monthly payments. The money he is requesting will be used to purchase chemical fertilizers to enable the buds to start blooming.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase baking equipment

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: Manuel tiene 54 años, es un hombre de buen carácter y laborioso en su trabajo, vive en su casa propia con su esposa y madre de sus 6 hijos, además de su nieto de 7 años. Desde niño apoyaba en las labores agrícolas a sus padres, pero cuando formó su propia familia empezó a sembrar de manera independiente papas, arvejas y maíz. Para atender sus cultivos con mucha paciencia se levanta a las 4 de la mañana, que es cuando aprovecha en regar o fumigar, para que a las 8 de la mañana sólo se dedique a remover y quitar las yerbas de sus cultivos. Cuando sus cosechas están listas las envía directamente al mercado más importante y grande de la ciudad de Tarma, donde generalmente logra vender sus productos a un buen precio. Por ello, Manuel se siente muy contento con su actividad, ya que trabaja en armonía con su esposa y todos sus hijos; por eso, para las cosechas no necesita buscar operarios, prefiere pagarles a sus hijos, de ese modo los motiva a que también siembren, pues reconoce que gracias a la agricultura los educó y les brindo una economía sólida. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, él ingresó a su banco comunal gracias a la invitación de una vecina, por lo que está muy agradecido. Asimismo, hace compromisos de sumarse a las reglas del grupo y pagar puntualmente cada una de sus cuotas. El dinero que viene solicitando es para la compra de fertilizantes químicos y 24 kilos de  maíz para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Manuel is 54 years old and lives with his wife in their own home. They have 6 children and also a 7 year old grandson. Manuel is known to be a man of good character and an industrious worker. He has been farming since he was a boy by helping his parents on their property, but when he started a family, he began planting his own crops of potatoes, peas and corn. Tending to his crops requires much patience. He wakes up at 4am to begin watering or fumigating. By 8am, he has moved on to removing weeds. When his crops have been harvested, he sends them directly to the largest market in the city of Tarma where producers go to get the best price. Manuel is very pleased with his work and with that of his wife and children. He does not have to hire workers to harvest crops because he would rather pay his children to do it. He hopes this will motivate them to start their own farms. Manuel acknowledges that agriculture has helped educate his children and provided for his family financially.

This is his first loan with MFP. He was able to join because he was invited by a neighbor, so he is very grateful. He is committed to following the group rules and making his payments on time. The money he is requesting will be used to buy chemical fertilizers and 24 kilos of corn for the next planting.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda es una joven madre muy trabajadora, tiene 29 años. Desde que nació su segunda hija su trabajo en el hogar se incrementó, además que apoya a su suegra por vivir en su casa. Realizar los trabajos agrícolas le place de sobre manera, ya que gracias a sus cultivos bien atendidos logra cosechar abundantes papas y arvejas de primera calidad, por lo que decidió enviarlos directamente a un mercado importante de la ciudad de Lima. El dinero de las ganancias obtenidas lo invirtió en la compra de un auto, con el que su esposo está realizando transporte de pasajeros. Yolanda no piensa dejar sus cultivos, por lo contrario, los ha incrementado, ya que sabe que ahora no tendrá dificultad en el transporte de sus productos. Ahora, en cuanto va cosechando va cargando directamente a su carro los sacos para transportarlos hasta el mercado de Tarma, por ello, siente que su trabajo se hace más liviano. Yolanda se siente muy feliz con sus cultivos y su movilidad, con la que posó orgullosa. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, está muy contenta de pertenecer a un banco comunal, pues lo que más la motivó a ingresar fue el seguro de vida que se incluye con el crédito. El dinero que ahora solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes químicos para sus cultivos y también para el pago de la tarjeta de circulación de su vehículo.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 29 years old and a hardworking young mother. Since the birth of her second daughter, her work at home has increased. She also supports her mother-in-law who lives with her at home. Yolanda manages to have time for farming along the way, and thanks to her attentiveness, she achieved an abundant harvest of potatoes and peas that are of high quality. She decided to sell her crops directly at the largest market in the city of Lima. Her earnings will be used to purchase a car that her husband can use as a passenger taxi.

Yolanda has no intention to quit farming. In fact, she plans to increase her production since she will no longer have difficulty transporting her products. She can load sacks of produce into her car and transport them to the market in Tarma, which will make her work load feel lighter. Yolanda is very happy with her harvest and the ability to move her produce.

This is Yolanda’s first loan with MFP. She is happy to be part of a communal bank. She was prompted to join upon learning that life insurance was included as a benefit of her loan. The money that she is requesting will be used to purchase chemical fertilizers for her crops and also pay for her driver’s license.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Grupo De Mujeres La Samaritana Group

texts.es: el grupo de mujeres la SAMARITANA esta integrado por seis persona que realizan la misma actividad economica ya que son miembros de la misma familia que viene trabajando mas de diez años  en la elaboracion de canastas de plasticos ser un grupo de mujeres muy sencillos y trabajadora con el fin de mejora el nivel de vida de su familia ellas necesitan el apollo de la institucion para incrementar su capital ya que se aproxima en el mes de septiembre la feria de la comunidad y como las fistas patrias.
texts.en:
The Samaritana Group of Women is comprised of six members who are all in the same line of business because they are related to one another. For over 10 years, they have produced baskets made of plastic. They are a simple group of hardworking women who want to improve the living standards of their families.

They have requested assistance from the institution to increase their capital, since the month of September is approaching, when the community fair and patron saint holidays take place.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Selina Asu F. is a 53-year-old woman living in the town of Vaitele K Fou.  She is married and has 12 adult  children.  To make a living, Selina owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food.  While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling ice cream in the local community.  Selina has been engaged in this business for over 1 year and earns approximately 300 WST a month from these activities.

Selina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Selina is requesting a new loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  The loan will be the first loan taken out by Selina from SPBD.  Selina plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Epenesa

texts.en:
Epenesa M. is a 35-year-old woman living in the town of Fasitoo tai.  She is married and has 6 school-aged children.  To make a living, Epenesa owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops.  While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting bananas for sale.  Epenesa has been engaged in this business for over 1 year and earns approximately 350 WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Epenesa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Epenesa is now requesting a new loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase harvesting equipment.  The loan will be the first loan taken out by Epenesa from SPBD.  Epenesa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment

loans.name: Martin Jesus

texts.es:
Martín es un padre de familia de 30 años de edad que vive con su esposa y su hijo de 03 años de edad en casa de sus padres en Lambayeque, una ciudad ubicada a 15 minutos de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 7 años, y está a cargo del pequeño terreno agrícola de su padre, quien por motivos de edad ya no puede conducirlo, este terreno se ubica en Capilla Santa Rosa, un caserío situado en la carretera Lambayeque – Mochumí y actualmente se ha sembrado maíz amarillo duro que es un cultivo muy comercial.

Su cultivo necesita ser abonado por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles para invertir en la compra de fertilizantes con la finalidad de aumentar la producción y rendimiento del cultivo.

Anteriormente tuvo un préstamo con nuestra Institución que fue cancelado puntualmente, por lo cual es considerado un excelente cliente responsable.

El sueño de Martín es comprar una pequeña casa para darle a su familia un techo propio.
texts.en:
Martín is 30 years old and the father of a 3 year old son. He and his wife live in his parents’ home in Lambayeque, a city located 15 minutes away from Chiclayo.

Martín has been farming for 7 years and is in charge of a small plot of land given to him by his father, who can no longer manage it because of his age. The land is located in Capilla Santa Rosa, a village located on the Lambayeque – Mochumí Highway, and has been planted with commercial grade yellow corn.

He is requesting a loan of 2000 soles to purchase fertilizers so that he can increase his production and crop yield. Martín had a previous loan with our institution that was repaid on time, so he is considered to be a good responsible client. He hopes to purchase a small house so that his family can have their own home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer for his cornfield

loans.name: Elmer

texts.es:
Elmer tiene 22 años y vive con sus padres y hermanos en el caserío Los Mochumanos, ubicado en el Sector Tambo Real, distrito de Pítipo, a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace dos años se dedica a la agricultura, posee una pequeña parcela agrícola que cultiva para sostener a su familia que ha venido pasando por muchos problemas desde que su padre empezara a tener serios problemas con su visión.

Sus dos hermanos menores, de 17 y 13 años, también están bajo su responsabilidad y es deseo de toda la familia es que continúen estudiando para tener un mejor futuro; su hermana de 17 años empezará a estudiar una carrera técnica el próximo año mientras que su hermano menor estudia todavía en el colegio de la zona.

Elmer ha sembrado una hectárea de maíz esta temporada y ha solicitado por primera vez a nuestra Institución un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles que serán utilizados en la compra de fertilizantes para abonar su cultivo.

El desea seguir ayudando a su familia y continuar apoyando a sus hermanos con sus estudios, Elmer es considerado por los vecinos de su comunidad como un joven muy trabajador y responsable.
texts.en:
Elmer is 22 years old and lives with his parents and brothers in the village of Los Mochumanos, located in the Tambo Real sector of Pítipo district, 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For 2 years he has worked in agriculture. He has a small parcel of farmland that he works to support his family, who has been going through difficult times ever since his father began to have problems with his vision. His 2 younger siblings, ages 17 and 13, are also his responsibility and it is the family's wish that they continue studying in order to have a better future. Elmer's 17 year old sister will be starting at a technical college next year while his younger brother attends the local high school. Elmer has sowed a hectare of maize this season and is requesting a loan for the first time at our loan institution. The 1,000 PEN will be used to purchase fertilizer for his crops. He hopes to keep helping his family and supporting his siblings' studies. Elmer is considered by his neighbors in the community to be a hardworking and responsible young man.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer for maize fields.

loans.name: 026 Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Cúc Vũ Thị is a 47 year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá. Cúc is the group leader of a six-member group loan request offered by Kiva partner the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 26 (026 Quảng Hưng).

Cúc is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Cúc operates a family member's livestock raising business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes primarily from raising cattle for sale. Cúc has been doing this business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2005, Cúc joined Kiva Partner the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cúc has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. She is now requesting a loan of 6,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. The loan will be her seventh loan from Kiva partner the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Cúc plans to use the additional revenue to improve her general living conditions.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1. N. Thị Vấn is a 36 year-old female requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her service-based business.

2. Ngô Thị Hà is a 28 year-old female requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her livestock raising business.

3. H. Thị Lan is a 27 year-old female requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her service-based business.

4. N. Thị Phượng is a 34 year-old female requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her livestock raising business.

5. P. Thị Lâm is a 27 year-old female requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her livestock raising business.

About the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas of Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Cúc Vũ Thị (53) là 47 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá. Cúc là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 26 (026 Quảng Hưng).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán. Cúc thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Cúc kiếm được khoảng 3000000 VND. Vào 2005, Cúc đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Cúc đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,079,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6,000,000 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 7th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1. N. Thị Vấn (78) là 36 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.

2. Ngô Thị Hà (74) là 28 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

3. H. Thị Lan (73) là 27 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.

4. N. Thị Phượng (75) là 34 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

5. P. Thị Lâm (87) là 27 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6000000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en:
Shiela F. is from the village of Gata Diot, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old. Shiela is married and has 2 very young children. To make a living, Shiela owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising pigs. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs to sell in the local community. Shiela has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Shiela joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Shiela has successfully repaid previous loans from GDMPC. Shiela is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Shiela from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Chhem

texts.en:
Chhem R. has lived on the farm since she was single. At 41, she is now married with seven children: five are single and the others are married and live away from the family home. Most of them are working in construction.

Chhem R. has always used her own farmland where she cultivates crops, while her husband helps her with the farm work. She sees this sector as their annual business. After the heavy rains fall, due to the coming of farming season, Chhem R. would like a loan. She will use half of her loan to hire a neighbor's plough to plow her land and then will use the rest of the loan to purchase fertilizer for growing rice.

loans.use: to pay for plowing her land and  purchase fertilizer for growing rice

loans.name: Julie-Ann

Julie-Ann has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fish to sell. Julie-Ann is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the second loan taken out by Julie-Ann from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

Rosefely Q. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 63 years old. Rosefely is widowed and has 1 child. To make a living, Rosefely owns and operates a sari-sari (general) store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste etc., in the local community. Rosefely has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rosefely joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosefely has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand product offering. Rosefely is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Rosefely from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.name: Ramado

texts.en:
Ramado B. is from the city of Dapitan. He is 43 years old. Ramado is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Ramado owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling clothing products in the local community. Ramado has been engaged in his business for over 4 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Ramado joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ramado has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Ramado is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Ramado from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
The older woman shown in the picture is Pov R., age 57, who lives in the province of Siem Reap, which is the best territory for farming. Pov R. is a married woman who is devoted to her two children; one is single and the other one is married.

Pov R. owns a piece of farmland that she inherited years ago from her grandmother. She grows various crops on it. Her husband works with her on the farm, and he is also a domestic carpenter. Pov R. will be using her loan to buy more fertilizer and some carpentry equipment to better support her husband's business.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and some carpentry equipment

loans.name: Chin

texts.en:
Chin C. is a 31-year-old and a resident of Siem Reap Province. Here, he has established a small family with other members since 1979. He currently earns a living by fishing around the lakes near his house, while his wife stays at home to be responsible for the daily housework. She also works in the farm. The couple has five young children who are of school age.

Chin C. is looking for a loan to purchase piglets to breed in the pen that he has already built next to his house.The loan will provide him with extra income. Note: Chin C.’s wife appears in the photograph.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna S. is from the city of Dapitan. She is 39 years old. Edna is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Edna owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks in the local community. Edna has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Edna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Edna is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to repair their house. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Edna from PMPC. She wants to have a better shelter for the family to live in.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair their house

loans.name: Sor

texts.en:
R. is a single mother of fifty-eight years old and blessed with one daughter who is married and still lives with her in the family home. R. was married, but her husband died of senility years ago.

R. currently relies on her daily income from her farming business; she raises pigs and cultivates a rice crop. Since 1999, she has started in this sector with her daughter. After she sells off all her mature pigs to buyers, she is still lacking some money to acquire other pigs to continue raising. That is why she decided to look for a US$ 600 loan to buy pig feed and piglets to raise; with the rest of the loan she will grow a rice crop.

loans.use: To buy pig feed and piglets to raise and  grow a rice crop

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes lives a peaceful life with her family in the rural village of Cebu in San Isidro, Isabela. She is now a widow and serves as father and mother to her 13-year-old son, Michael, who is currently studying in high school.

Mercedes manages a simple sari-sari store (community based store). Through her perseverance, she has been able to improve the business as the years passed by. Yet she still needs to continue improving the store to further sustain the needs of her family. 

In line with this, Mercedes decided to request a loan of PHP 5,000 from Kiva lenders. According to her, having the amount granted will enable her to expand her business and eventually make it grow little by little.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon R. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 56 years old, is widowed, and has five adult children. Corazon owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily raising chickens for sale. She is just starting this business. In 2006, Corazon joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. Corazon is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be her 8th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Lach

texts.en:
C. was born in 1984 and is a young man living with his older mother in Siem Reap Province. He is a determined man who tries to work hard for a profit. He currently works as internal staff for a hotel.

C. inherited a plot of land many years ago from his older mother. In addition, he builds rooms and runs a karaoke service (amateur singing to a recorded music background ) for income. He now lacks some parts of the equipment needed to support his service. He is therefore applying for a loan to purchase essential items such as speakers, microphones, and media players in order to continue the good service he provides.

loans.use: To purchase essential karaoke equipment items

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en: Criselda V. is from the town of Gata Diot, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 41 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Criselda owns and operates a business raising pigs. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Criselda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Criselda is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Nicole

texts.en:
Nicole L. is from the village of Catadman Manabay, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 36 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children.

Nicole owns and operates a business making and selling food, primarily selling banana cue (plantain, fried in boiling oil and held on a skewer) in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Nicole joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and for daily consumption. 


About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is married to Hero. She is 23 years old and works as a retailer of RTW (Ready-To-Wear) clothes in their rural village in Cebu in San Isidro, Isabela. The couple have children who inspire them every day. Thus, they are working hard to save for their children’s future education. Her husband is a farmer and they are helping one another to have a better way of living.

Maricel wants her RTW business to become profitable. She roams around their village to sell her products and most of her customers are her friends and neighbors. However, due to lack of financial resources, she is now seeking the support of Kiva lenders for her business. She is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 that she can use as business capital.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

location.town: Cebu, San Isidro, Santiago City, Isabela

loans.name: Hun

texts.en:
Hun V. is a 36-year-old construction foreman. He is married to Horm Yan, 29, and they have three school-aged children. His wife sells a few grocery items out of her home for income.

Currently, Hun V. finds it hard traveling to work or anywhere else, because he doesn’t have his own vehicle for his and his family’s transportation. Because he has no adequate money to buy it yet, he would like a loan from Kiva to add to his savings in order to purchase an old motorbike to ride to work at his building place.

loans.use: To purchase an old motorbike to ride to work

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia P. is from the village of Gata Diot, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old. Lilia is widowed and has 2 children. To make a living, Lilia owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising poultry. The main source of income for the business comes from raising chickens for sale. Lilia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Lilia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC. Lilia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Lilia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is a vendor of salted eggs in their village in Cebu, San Isidro, Isabela. Selling the products helps her to cover the basic needs of their family. This is her way of helping her family in earning a living for their family as well as money for the education of their children.

She is thankful that her husband Fernando is very responsible and works as a farmer. The couple is blessed with three children who are in high school and elementary level. Because of the growing needs of their family, Conchita would like to request a loan from the lenders amounting to PHP 5,000. She plans to use it as additional capital for her vending business. She hopes that her business will result in a good income.

loans.use: Additional Capital

location.town: Cebu, San Isidro, Santiago City, Isabela

loans.name: Roberta

texts.en:
Roberta O. lives in the town of Gata Diot, Clarin, Mismis Occidental. She is 45 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Roberta raises chickens. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from her work

In 2008, Roberta joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to improve her life and ability to engage in business. She is applying for a new loan of $175 to invest in expanding her small company. This loan will be the fourth taken out by Roberta from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to expand her business

loans.name: Ngong

texts.en: For more than eight years, Ngong L. has made a living running a small store out of her home. She sells items such as cooking ingredients, sweets, plastic goods and soft drinks. Almost all of her clients are neighbors who live near her home, and she typically earns about $3 per day. Her husband works in construction, and has also been hired by neighbors to build a house in the village. Ngong L. is 45 years old and has four children: three are married and one is single and still lives at home. Ngong L. has applied for a loan to buy more items to sell, and to buy a motorbike which her husband will use to ride to work.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell

loans.name: Jowena

texts.en:
Jowena B. lives in the city of Dipolog. She is 22 years old, married and has one very young child. To make a living, she owns and operates a store where she sells bamboo for walls and ceilings known locally as amakan. Jowena has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns about 3,000 PHP a month from her work.

In 2008, Jowena joined PMPC to gain access to financial services that can improve her life and business. She has successfully repaid three loans from PMPC, and has applied for a new one to expand her business and improve her family's life.  

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida makes a living selling salted eggs.  She is happily married to Bong Sr., who is a farmer. Her family lives a simple and peaceful life in the small village of Cebu in San Isidro, Isabela. Zenaida wants to expand her business and is asking for help from Kiva lenders to make this possible.  

She and her husband have four children, two of whom are still in elementary school.  Her two older children were not able to continue their studies because of a lack of financial resources. That is why she is working hard to increase her income and give her two younger children a better education. Zenaida is hoping that Kiva lenders will give her a chance to make her business grow.

loans.use: to expand her small business

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita V. lives in the village of Gata Diot, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 36 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Mercedita runs a sari-sari or general store where she sells products for daily use such as soap, shampoo and toothpaste. Mercedita has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month from her work.

Last year, Mercedita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid seven previous loans from GDMPC, and is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP to invest in expanding her business.

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a fish vendor in the rural village of Cebu, San Isidro, Isabela. She is married and is very diligent in her business in order to assist her husband in providing the needs of their children.

With her desire to make her business grow, she is now asking to borrow PHP 5,000 that she can use for her vending business. She usually purchase her products in Ramon, Isabela at a wholesale price and sells them at a retail price in the village.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

Paulita owns and operates a business raising vegetables, primarily planting and harvesting vegetables for sale in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Paulita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. loans.name: Yodgorjon

texts.en: A. Yodgorjon is 32 years old. He is married and has three children. Yodgorjon's goals are to grow in his personal life and in his business. His wish is to offer better service to his customers. His dream is that God continues to provide him with more life to get ahead and to fulfill his goals. Yodgorjon is a taxi driver and travels through the streets of Dushanbe, Tajikistan, in search of customers. He has owned his business for ten years. Currently Yodgorjon’s car needs some repairs and he wants to borrow 5,000 Somoni which will go towards repairs of his vehicle. Part of the loan will also be used to purchase tires. Yodgorjon thanks Kiva and all lenders that make this help possible. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To repair his taxi and to purchase tires

loans.name: Taskirya

texts.en: Taskirya is married with four children. She has a small business selling clothing and has been in business for thirteen years. She is an energetic, enthusiastic entrepreneur who operates her business simply but wisely. An example of this is times when she has needed to purchase new clothing inventory. Rather than close her business and travel herself to buy inventory, she has paid other clothing vendors to buy for her so that she can stay and keep her business open. Taskirya has requested a loan to help renew her supply of clothing. This loan will help her purchase a good supply of inventory so she can maximize her profits and continue working to develop her business. loans.name: Hakima

texts.en: Hakima is a hardworking woman and, since 1999, has dedicated herself to selling a variety of vegetables in the central market of Tursunzade. She characterized herself as happy and humble. She started her business with her savings which she had accumulated over a long period of time. Hakima is the mother of three children that she would like to offer an education as they are minors. Her biggest dream is to prepare her children to have professions so they don't have to suffer like she did since childhood, working hard labor. To realize this dream, Hakima now requests 2,000 Somoni. With this loan she wants to buy more goods to increase her earnings. He needs an alternative that can help him save for his children's higher education. Saidmalik requests a loan of $1000 USD that he will spend on purchasing seeds and fertilizer for his crop. Thanks to the quality of her products and the experience she gained in this sphere of business, she has earned a solid reputation among her customers. Accordingly, the demand for her goods has grown, allowing her to contribute significantly to the household. Now, Hakik requests 900 USD to spend on purchasing apricots which she will dry and resell. loans.name: Izat

texts.en: M. Izat is 46 years old and lives in Isfara town. He is married and has three children. Izat processes and dries apricots and sells them in the central local market. He is experienced in the business of making the dried apricots. Izat purchases apricots from local farmers wholesale and, after processing them, sells them to his customers. Because he buys his goods wholesale, his prices are lower than regular market prices. He offers a wide assortment of goods for clients of different means. All this allows Izat to make his business quite successful and it brings in a stable income for the family. Currently, Izat needs a loan of 600 USD to buy supplies so that he can continue to offer a good product to his customers. He expresses his gratitude to everyone supporting him.
