To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Ngeleli Group

texts.en:
Fidelia is a member of the Ngeleli borrower group,she is 39 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 2 children.Her children are aged 16 and 11 years.She also cares for other 2 dependents.

Fidelia started her own clothing business selling clothes 4 years ago,she works 10 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tsh.

This is Fidelia first loan from BRAC.She requested loan amount 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes for sale.

With the additional profit she gain from the use of this loan Fidelia hopes to save more money and expand her business.

Lucia is another member of the same borrower group she requested loan amount 200,000 Tsh in order to expand her own shop business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Mrs. Sothen Pha Village Bank Loan Group

texts.en:
The Village Bank Group consists of 21 people in Chrou Pisei village in Kandal province.  The members of the group selected Mrs. Sothen P. for their leader. She is 35 years old and the mother of a child who is attending the local school.

Mrs. Sothen P. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice for a living. In this plantation, she now faces a problem with plowing so she decided to ask for a loan to hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the field in order to grow rice. 

Her husband, Mr. P. Sipho, is a motorbike taxi driver and he also helps his wife on the rice plantation. 

The other members will use their loans for different purposes. All the members are in the picture but some of them are blocked.

loans.use: To hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the field in order to grow rice.

loans.name: Huruma E.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 26-year-old Huruma K. from Mbozi. Married with a one-year-old child, Huruma has owned and operated a small duka or neighborhood shop selling common household goods and grocery items since 2004

Working at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week and assisted by her husband, Huruma currently earns about $120 a month. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase more goods for reselling. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and the range of her products. Huruma thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more common household goods for reselling.

loans.name: Mrs. Yom Say Village Bank Group

texts.en: Fifteen people who all live in Chrou Pisei village in Kandal Province comprise this village bank loan, and Mrs. Yom S. is the village bank president selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns a 0.5-hectare field upon which she cultivates rice. The rainy season is the time to cultivate rice, but she cannot do so because she needs to plow the field first; thus, she is requesting a loan to hire a laborer with two oxen for this purpose and to buy more fertilizer to support the field.  Her husband, Mr. Tep Phin, helps his wife with the farming. Mrs. Yom S. is 46 years old and the mother of two children who are both employed in a garment factory.

loans.use: To hire a laborer with two oxen in order to plow her rice field and buy more fertilizers to support the field later.

loans.name: Asunta

texts.en:
Asunta H. makes a living selling bread and charcoal, and has applied for a loan to buy fish to sell. She is 47 years old and married. Her husband is a clerk in the United Nation Developement Programe (UNDP), Southern Sudan, Juba HQs. They have three children who attend school St.Bakhita Primary School, Kator Parish.  With the extra income made possible by this loan, she hopes to build a hotel and a retail shop  

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Khen Sokh Village Bank Loan Group

texts.en:
This loan will benefit 13 people in Boeng Krum Leu village in Kandal province, all of whom will use it to operate or expand their businesses. Mrs. Khen S. will use the loan to buy food for her pigs in order to support her current business of pig breeding. Her husband, Mr. Um Ros, is a taxi driver who makes a small income to support the family and also helps his wife with her business. Mrs. Khen S. is 42 years old and has three children, two of whom wO. in a car wash while the youngest attends the local school.

One member of this group has applied for an end-of-term loan, which means he is not required to pay any principal on the loan until it is due. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. These loans allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva loans

loans.use: To support various small busineses, including one that breeds pigs.

loans.name: Ipogolo D Group

texts.en:
Edina is a member of the Ipogolo d borrower group,she is 39 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 2 children,Her children are aged 20 and 18 years.

Edina Started her own clothing business 6 years ago,she works 8 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 90,000 Tsh.

This is Edina`s first loan from BRAC.she requested loan amount 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes for sale.

With the profit she gain from the use of this loan Edina hopes to save more money and expand her business.

Leonida is also a member of the same borrower group,she also requested loan amount 250,000 Tsh in order to expand her own food business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Getruda A.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 34-year-old Getruda N. from Mbozi. She is married and has three children, who are between the ages of 3 and 9. 

Getruda has made a living running a “mama lishe” since 2003. Café/Mama Lishe is the name for a local restaurant or café in Tanzania that usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long, wooden benches. The food is local: rice, ugali (a hot sticky dough, made from maize flour) and plantains (a cooked savory banana), all served with beans, vegetables, meat and a variety of sauces.

She works at the business for 12 hours a day, six days a week and gets help from one employee. Getruda currently earns about $130 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan to buy more rice, maize flour, salt, sugar and beans in bulk. In the future, she plans to open a new location. Getruda thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women through the provision of a leasing and leaseback-microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, because they are considered non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy rice, maize flour, salt sugar and beans in bulk

loans.name: Mrs. Chariya Chheang Village Bank Loan Group

texts.en: This loan will benefit 14 people who live in Boeng Krum Leu village in Kandal province. They will use the loan in different ways. Mrs. Chariya C. makes a living breeding pigs. She does not have a place to house her animals, and has applied for this loan to build one. Her husband, Mr. Leom Sarioeurn, is a policeman who makes a small salary to support the family. Mrs. Chariya C. is 42 years old, and she and her husband have four children, all of whom attend the local school.

loans.use: To build a place to house her farm animals.

loans.name: Mrs. Sophos Meas Village Bank Loan Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophos M. leads a loan group with 22 members, all of whom live in Boeng KrU. Leu village in Kandal province. The members of this group will use their loans for different purposes. 

Mrs. Sophos M. is a farmer who grows rice for a living. She faces a problem because she does not have oxen to do the plowing. That is why she has decided to ask for a loan to hire a laborer who has two oxen to plow her rice field. She will use the balance of her portion of the loan to buy more fertilizer to make her field more productive. Her husband, Mr. Oem Voek, helps her farm. Mrs. Sophos M. is 37 years old, and she and her husband have five children, four of whom attend the local school while the fifth is still an infant. All the members of this loan group are shown here.

Six people in this group have end-of-term loans and are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. This type of loan allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva loans.

loans.use: To hire a laborer with two oxen to plow her rice field, and buy fertilizer to make her field more productive.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria K. sells clothing at the village market. She has been in this business for 10 years. She is a very kind person. Maria enjoys being in sales and has many repeat clients. 

Maria would like to borrow 1,700 UAH to increase the assortment of clothes she offers for sale.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Ipogolo C Group

texts.en:
Cristina is a member of the Ipogolo C borrower group,she is 28 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 2 children.Her children are aged 10,7 years .

Cristina started her own clothing business selling clothes 3 years ago,she works 9 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 120,000 Tsh.

This is Cristina`s first loan from BRAC.she requested loan amount 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes for sale.

With the profit she gain from the use of this loan Cristina hopes to save money and expand her business.

Anna is another member of the same borrower group,she requested loan amount 200,000 Tsh in order to expand her own clothing business

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Zebiniso

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan
Зебинисо – женщина , которая  занимается продажей посуды и глянцевой посуды. Она по профессии работает учительницей по предмету математики. Зебинисо хочет получив деньги завести партию пластмассовой посуды для кухни. Она торгует на воскресных базарах.
Зебинисо устраивают все условия и критерии нашей организации.
texts.en:
Zebiniso is a woman who sells crockery and glazed dishware. She works as a math teacher. Zebiniso sells at the Sunday markets, and is seeking a loan to buy a stock of plastic kitchenware. She meets all of our organization’s qualifications and criteria.

Translated from Russian by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand her product offerings

loans.name: Mrs. Yoen Toey Village Bank Loan Group

texts.en:
The Mrs. Yoen T. Village Bank Loan group consists of 17 people who live in Boeng Krum Leu village in Kandal province.  All of the people will use their loans for different purposes. 

The members selected Mrs. Yoen T. for the village bank president. A farmer, she owns a 2-hectar field to cultivate rice for her living. Mrs. Yoen T. is 43 years old and the mother of six children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others attend the local school. Her husband, Mr. Some Khaem, is a motorbike taxi driver.

Although Mrs. Yoen T. and her husband try to work hard, they still have insufficient income to support their family. Thus, Mrs. Yoen T. decided to ask for a loan to buy a boat for her husband to start a fishing business. She hopes to increase her income with this new business. 

Three members in this loan are end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the end of the loan's term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because they are most beneficial for Cambodia's poor, who can repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a boat to start a fishing business.

loans.name: Afi Alice Pascaline

texts.fr: Cette dame est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. C’est pour cela que depuis 2004, elle se bat pour apporter un plus à son foyer par le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale dans son quartier à Tokoin Novissi à Lomé. Elle sollicite un prêt de WAGES pour l'achat de 10 sacs de riz, 5 cartons de sardines, 3 cartons de pâtes alimentaires et divers autres articles nécessaires.Elle compte sur son habileté pour faire fructifier ce prêt.
texts.en:
Mrs. A. is married and the mother of four children. This is why, since 2004, she has been trying to bring more money into the household by selling general food products in her quarter in Tokoin Novissi, in Lomé. She is requesting a loan from WAGES so she can buy 10 sacks of rice, five boxes of sardines, three boxes of pasta, and other essential items. She is counting on her skills to make a profit with this loan.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase general food products

loans.name: Mrs. Ratha Chuor Village Bank Loan Group

texts.en:
The Mrs. Ratha C. Village Bank Loan group consists of 19 people who live in BoE. Krum Leu village in Kandal province. All of the people will use their loans for different purposes.

The members selected Mrs. Ratha C. for the village bank president. She has 4 children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others attend the local school. Mrs. Ratha C. owns a hectar field to cultivate rice to earn her living. Her husband, Mr. Ngin Sinat, is a blacksmith in the local village. 

Although Mrs. Ratha C. and her husband try to work hard, they still have little income to improve their living condition. Also, Mrs. Ratha C.'s husband wants to start a fishing business so she decided to ask for a loan to buy fishnets for her husband. 

Fifteen members in this loan are end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the end of the loan's term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because they are most beneficial for Cambodia's poor, who can repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fishnets for a fishing business.

loans.name: Judith

texts.fr: Cette femme vend depuis 2004 dans son quartier à Tokoin Séminaire à Lomé des charbons de bois. Avec ce commerce elle contribue financièrement aux besoins de sa famille. Etant mariée et mère d’un enfant, elle sollicite un prêt de WAGES pour l'achat de 30 sacs de charbon de bois et couvrir les frais de transport.
texts.en:
Since 2004, Mrs. A. has sold charcoal in her neighborhood in Tokoin Séminaire, in Lomé. With this business she is able to contribute financially to her family's needs. She is married and the mother of one child. She is requesting a loan from WAGES to purchase 30 sacks of charcoal and also to cover her transportation costs.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase charcoal

loans.name: Sarafina

texts.en:
Sarafina is a member of the Ikweta North borrower group,she is 42 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 4 children.Her children are aged 12,16,8 and 22 years.

Sarafina started her own business selling local beer 2 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximate 150,000 Tsh.

This is Sarafina first loan from BRAC.she requested the amount of 150,000 Tsh in order to buy more commodities like wheat,sugar for her business.

With the profit she gain from the use of this loan Sarafina hopes to save more money ,pay school fees,get more food for family and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more wheat,sugar,

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fresh beef

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: N. Agnes is an energetic business woman of thirty years old. She is dealing with timber. She has been doing this business for six years. She would use the loan to purchase and transport timber from villages to the market place. She is a mother of one child in school. Her aim is to educate her child and build some rentals to build income to support her living in the future.

loans.use: To purchase and transport timber from villages to market place.

loans.name: Jean Damascene

texts.en:
Greetings from N. J.Damascene in Gasabo District, Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda!  Jean Damascene is 36years old, married with 4 children aged 12, 8, 5, and 5.

Jean owns a small shop where he sells different kinds of products as found on his picture. He has owned the business for 4 years.  He works every day from 6:00am to 10:22pm and earns a profit of approximately 120,000 Rwandan Francs per month.

Jean is requesting a loan worth 500,000 Rwf from Vision Finance Company s.a which will be repaid over 8 months.  With the increased profits that result from his loan, J.Damascene hopes to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: Expanding his store

loans.name: Avenir Plus Group

texts.fr:
Mado N. M. 34 ans, est trésorière de « l’Avenir Plus », un groupe constitué solidairement de 28 membres qui ont déjà reçu le crédit de Kiva à travers Hope Kinshasa RDC et l’ont remboursé correctement. 

Mado gère sa propre boutique et une terrasse dans un quartier situé un peu à l’ouest de Kinshasa. Elle a commencé l’activité commerciale en 2002 en vendant la friperie. Elle est parvenue avec le temps et les circonstances à la transformer en boutique et terrasse. Compte tenue de ses ambitions d’élargir ses affaires et de réaliser les projets de son foyer, Mado a décidé d’avoir un appui financier permanent à travers des prêts de Hope depuis 2008. Le prochain crédit lui permettra d’acheter des articles divers tels que des conserves, des sacs du riz, du sucre, du lait, et autres pour renforcer le stock de la marchandise de sa boutique. Sa rigueur dans le travail ainsi que la bonne gestion sont ses atouts qui font prospérer ses activités. Mado est mariée et mère de 6 enfants dont leurs âges varient entre 3 et 15 ans. Tous vont à l’école.
texts.en:
Mado N. M. is 34 years old and the treasurer of "L'Avenir Plus", a group made up of 28 members who have already received and fully paid back a Kiva loan through the microfinance institution Hope Kinshasa DRC. Mado manages her own store and a terrace in a neighborhood located a little bit west of Kinshasa. She started he business in 2002, selling second-hand clothing. In time and with improving circumstances, she was able to transform her business into a shop and terrace. Given her ambitions to expand her business and fulfill the projects she has for her home, Mado decided to gain steady financial support through loans from Hope since 2008. The next loan she is requesting will enable her to purchase various items, such as jams, sacks of rice, sugar, milt and other items to strengthen the stock of merchandise in her shop. Her hard work, as well as her great management are the "trump card" for her business - the reason it prospers. Mado is married and the mother of 6 children whose ages range from 3 to 15. All of her children attend school

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase various articles to improve the stock of the merchandise for her boutique

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: N. Fatuma is a 32 year old business woman. She has a charcoal business. She brings charcoal from villages and sells to customers in town. She has been doing this business for over seven years. She plans to use the loan for purchasing more bags of charcoal and expanding her business. She has two children who are going to school. She hopes to construct rental houses for future financial support.

loans.use: To purchase bags of charcoal

loans.name: Qart-E-One Group

texts.en: This is the Qart-e-one group. It is made up of three female members. Kubra is the group leader. Each of them would like to take a loan to expand her business and bring some new changes into her life. Kubra would like to take a loan for her husband who has a fruit cart. With the money he would like to buy more and different kinds of fruits. Freba wants to take a loan for her tailoring business. She has been a tailor for more than 6 years. She wants to buy a new sewing machine. Lida wants to take a loan for bead working. She can sew nice things using beads and now she wants to buy the materials required for her business. They have requested a total group loan of 30000 Afghani. They would like to mention that Kiva is a really effective process.

loans.use: Buying materials to expand their businesses

loans.name: Hope

texts.en: M. K. Hope is a 45 year old business woman.  She is a mother of three children, they are at school. She aims at educating her children and enlarging on her business.  She has been running a retail shop for ten years. She plans to use the loan to purchase more items in her shop: soap, sugar, salt, flour, sweets, biscuits, match boxes, etc especially essentials.

loans.use: To purchase more items in her shop

loans.name: Motema Mpiko Plus Group

texts.fr:
Munongo N. 48 ans, est président du groupe dénommé «  MoteM. Mpiko Plus » qui signifie en anglais « Courageous Heart ». Ce groupe est composé de 26 membres engagés solidairement à recevoir et rembourser des prêts de Kiva à travers Hope Kinshasa RDC. Il a déjà obtenu 2 fois les crédits de Hope qu’il remboursé correctement. 
Munongo a comme activité commerciale, la vente des pagnes dans la partie montagneuse située à l’ouest de Kinshasa. Il a acquit depuis 2002 une solide expérience dans ce secteur d’activité. Son affaire prospère grâce à la bonne gestion et au réinvestissement des bénéfices accumulés. Actuellement, son affaire lui génère un bénéfice de $20 par jour. Munongo utilisera le prochain prêt pour acheter des pagnes à revendre afin de satisfaire le besoin de ses clients et accroitre le revenu. Il est marié et père de 8 enfants âgés entre 4 et 21 ans dont 6 d’entre eux sont scolarisés.
texts.en:
Munongo N. is 48 years old and the president of a group called "MoteM. Mpiko Plus", which in English means "Courageous Heart". The group is composed of 26 members who together have received and repaid loans from Kiva through the micro-finance organization, Hope Kinshasa RDC. He has already received 2 loans from Hope and has properly repaid both of them.

Munongo's business is selling "pagnes" (colorful wax cloths) in the mountainous area located to the west of Kinshasa. Since 2002, he has had solid experience in the business sector. His business prospers that to his good management and reinvestment of the profits he accumulates. Right now his business generated a profit of $20 a day.

Munongo will use his next loan to purchase "pagnes" to re-sell, so that he can satisfy the needs of his clients and increase his revenues.

He is married and the father of 8 children, they are aged between 4 and 21 - 6 of the children are students.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase "pagnes" (colored wax cloths) for resale

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia I. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 49-years old and unmarried. Sylvia owns and operates a livestock raising business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from raising chickens, ducks, and turkeys for sale. Sylvia has been doing this for over four years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Sylvia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sylvia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Sylvia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be her fourth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve her general living conditions.

About PMPC:

Kiva partner Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en: Ahmed K. is a successful self-employed man who owns a commercial institute; he is a computer-training teacher by profession.  A 34-year-old businessman with six years of experience in his profession, Ahmed is requesting the loan to improve his facility and add more computers to expand the institute. His hopes are to improve and extend the institute and educate his children

loans.use: To improve his facility and add more computers to expand the institute.

loans.name: Asifiwe

texts.en:
Asifiwe is a member of the Ikweta centre,she is 26 years old woman she is married and a mother of 2 children.Her children are aged 4 and 1 years.

Asifiwe started he own food business selling  fruits,tomatoes, and vegetable 2 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 20,000 Tsh.

This is Asifiwe`s first loan from BRAC.She requested the amount of 150,000 Tsh in order to buy more fruits and vegetable.

With the additional profit she gain from the use of this loan Asifiwe hopes to save more money and expand her business

loans.use: To buy morem vegetable and fruits

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothing and kitchen utensils for resale.

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en: Cissy M., a 34-year-old self-employed woman, is a researcher by profession. Equipped with computers and a photocopying machine, she helps students with their research. Cissy has been doing this business for nine years now and is requesting the loan to purchase more computers, tables and chairs to accommodate more students.  She has two children whom she hopes to educate through to university.

loans.use: To purchase more computers, tables and chairs to accommodate more students.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Greetings from Emmanuel S. in Gicumbi District, Byumba Sector, Ruhengeli Province. This 41-year-old married father of three children aged 13, 10, and 7 also takes care of four other persons who are 35, 25, 20, and 16 years of age.

This entrepreneur owns a small shop where he has sold spare parts for the past five years. Assisted by one employee, he works daily from 7 a.m to 6 p.m., earning a monthly profit of 20000 Rwandan francs. Emmanuel is requesting a loan worth 500000 Rwf from Vision Finance Company to expand his store and pay school fees.

loans.use: Expanding his store

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia Y. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 57 years old. Cecelia is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Cecelia owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling coconut wine known as "tuba", firewood, and charcoal in the local community. Cecelia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Cecelia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cecelia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. Cecelia is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport motorcycle used in the business. This will be the 9th loan taken out by Cecelia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a lamination machine and a perforating machine

loans.name: Eveline

texts.en:
Eveline is a member of the Ikweta East,she is 33 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 3 children,Her children are aged 15,9,5 years.

Eveline started her own clothing business selling vitenge and khanga (fabric)4 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 40,000 Tsh.

This is Eveline first loan from BRAC.She requested the amount of 250,000 Tsh in order to buy more khanga na vitenge(fabric).

With the profit she gain from the use of this loan Eveline hopes to save money,pay school fees,get more food for family and expand her business

loans.use: To buy more vitenge and khanga

loans.name: Topista

texts.en: N. Topista is a business woman of forty-eight years old. She deals in used clothes; she has so far been selling clothes for five years. She is using the loan to bring more clothes (dresses, tops, skirts, etc) to her shop, that is, she wants to expand her business. She owns a plot of land where she wishes to build rental houses for income generation.

loans.use: To bring more clothes (dresses, tops, skirts, etc.) to her shop

loans.name: Ayovi

texts.fr: Cette femme souhaite avoir un prêt de WAGES pour donner une nouvelle orientation à son commerce de charbon de bois qu’elle exerce  dans le quartier Adidogomé à Lomé depuis 1992. Avec ce prêt, elle pourra acheter 25 sacs de charbon de bois et couvrir aussi ses frais de transport vers le lieu d'approvisionnement.Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants.
texts.en:
This woman hopes for a loan from the micro-finance group WAGES, to give a new direction to her business of wood charcoal. This has been her business in the neighborhood of Adidogomé in Lomé since 1992. With this loan, she will be able to buy 25 bags of wood charcoal and pay for its transportation to her place of business.

She is married and the mother of 3 children.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wood charcoal

loans.name: Hubertine

texts.fr: Cette dame ayant 02 personnes à charge et mariée exerce depuis 2003 dans le marché d’Adidogomé à Lomé le commerce de céréales, plus précisément les sacs de maïs. Elle sollicite vivement un prêt de WAGES pour acheter 25 sacs de maïs et pour lui permettre aussi de couvrir ses frais de transport.Elle compte beaucoup sur son expérience pour faire fructifier ce prêt.
texts.en:
Having two persons to support, this married lady has been doing commerce in grains at the Adidogomé marketplace in Lomé since 2003. She trades in sacks of corn to be exact. She is eagerly seeking a loan from WAGES for buying 25 sacks of corn and also for enabling her to cover the transport costs. She is counting very much on her experience for this loan to yield a profit.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of corn

loans.name: Resty

texts.en:
Resty is a member of the KInanambo borrower group,she is 32 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 2children,Her children are aged 18,8 years.

Resty started her own clothing business selling clothes (fabric)like kanga na vitenge 8 years,she works 12 hours a day nad earn monthly profit approximately 200,000 Tsh .

This is Restly first loan from BRAC.She requested the loan amount 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes(fabric) for sale.

With the additional profit she gain from the use of this loan Resty hopes to save more money and expand her business

loans.use: to buy more Kanga,Vitenge

loans.name: Essowè Anti

texts.fr: Cette femme exerce une activité particulière : elle tisse elle-même des pagnes traditionnels, activité qu’elle exerce depuis 1988. Son stock est presque épuisé, c'est pour cela qu'elle sollicite un prêt de WAGES pour l’achat de matériels de travail, en particulier 10 rouleaux de fils à tisser, en vue de moderniser son activité. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants.
texts.en:
This woman has a business that is special: she herself weaves traditional pagnes (colorful West African cloth).  This is work she has been doing since 1988.  With her inventory nearly exhausted, she is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy work supplies, especially 10 rolls of thread for weaving, with the aim of modernizing her business.  She is married and the mother of three children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy weaving supplies for her work

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a member of the Kinanambo borrower group,she is 36 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 4 children.Her children are aged 18,16,13,7 years.

Joyce started her own shop business selling rice,sugar,blue band etc 10 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 100,000 Tsh.

This is Joyce firs loan from BRAC.she requested the loan mount 150,000 In order o buy rice,wheat,blue band for her shop.

With the additional profit she gain from the use of this loan Joyce hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase shoes for resale

loans.name: Yawa Karim

texts.fr: Cette dame vend depuis 2007 en face de l’église Catholique d’Adidogomé à Lomé des sacs en plastiques pour apporter sa contribution financière à son foyer. Ces sacs sont très utilisés par la poulation dans leurs besoins de tous les jours. Son stock épuisant, elle sollicite un prêt de WAGES pour pouvoir continuer son commerce. Elle est mariée et a un enfant à sa charge.
texts.en:
There, opposite the Catholic Church of Adidogomé in Lomé, this lady has been selling plastic bags since 2007 in order to contribute financially to her household.  These bags are much in use by people from day to day.  Her inventory is exhausted.  She is requesting a loan from WAGES to continue her business.  She is married and has one child in her care.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For buying plastic bags

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a member of the Mbagala east borrower group,she is 30 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 3 children.Her children are aged 12,10, and 8 years.

Asha started her own food business selling bites 2 years ago,she works 8 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 50,000 Tsh.

This is Asha`s first loan from BRAC,she requested loan amount 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more Wheat,sugar,cooking oil etc for her business.

With additional profit she get from the use of this loan Asha hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more wheat,sugar,cooking oil.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is a member of the Mtivila A borrower group,she is 39 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 1 child.her child is aged 9 years.

 Robina started her own charcoal business 1 year ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 160,000 Tsh.

This is Robina`s first loan from BRAC.She requested the amount of 300,000 Tsh in order to buy more charcoal.

With the additional profit she gain from the use of this loan Robina hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal

loans.name: Irodu

texts.en:
Irodu E. is currently selling charcoal and is requesting a loan in order to stock more charcoal to sell. Irodu is a 38-year-old woman who married a policeman and has 3 children who all attend school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to have a charcoal storeroom.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: stock more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en:
Greetings from Kigali, Rwanda! M. ANGELIQUE is seeking her first loan from Vision Finance Company. For 7 years, Angelique has been doing salon services in the capital city of Rwanda, Kigali. She works from 7:00 am to 8:00 pm and employs 3 people to help her. She earns a profit of approximately 110,000 Rwandan Francs per month.

Angelique is requesting a loan of 500,000 Rwandan Francs to help her buy more materials; with the increased profits that result from her loan, Angelique hopes to expand her services.

This client is married with 4 children with the following ages: 10, 8, 4, and 2, and she takes care of 2 other persons, 12 years old and 20 years old.

loans.use: buying materiels

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en:
Boniface is a 27-year-old father of two who owns a small glass supply and fitting business in the Pipeline area of Nairobi. Boniface has run this business for the past three years. He has requested his first loan of Ksh. 50,000 in order to purchase a polishing machine, a drilling machine and a blasting machine for his business. Boniface hopes to one day own a big glass company. On a personal level, he would like to one day own his own home and give good quality education to his children. Boniface describes himself as diligent, patient, God fearing and determined.



Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To purchase a polishing machine, a drilling machine and a blasting machine

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a member of the Idunda east,she is 27 year old woman,she is single and a mother of 1 child,Her child is aged 4 years.

Anna started her own food business selling local beer 5 years ago,she works 10 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 170,000 Tsh.

This is Anna`s first loan from BRAC.She requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy wheat,sugar for her business.

With the profit she gain from the use of this loan Anna hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more wheat,sugar

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 32-year-old mother of three who owns a beauty shop in the Embakasi area of Nairobi.  She has requested her second loan of Ksh. 30,000 after successfully repaying her first loan of Ksh. 20,000 in order to diversify and open a fruit shop. 

Margaret hopes to one day grow her business into selling wholesale and buy plots of land and develop houses for rental units. On a personal level, she would like to one day own her own home and educate her children to the highest level. Margaret describes herself as diligent and social.



Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable micro-finance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Start a fruit shop

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 25-year-old mother of one who owns a boutique in the Embakasi area in Nairobi..  She has requested her first loan of Ksh. 15,000 in order to expand her stock. Esther hopes to one day grow her business into export and import of new clothes. On a personal level, she would like to one day own her own home and build rental units. Esther describes herself as diligent and determined.



Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable micro-finance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Expand her clothing business

texts.en:
Tumaini is a member of the Mafifi south borrower group,she is 23 years old woman,she is married and amother of 1 child.Her child is aged  2 years .

Tumaini started her own tailoring business 5 years ago,she works 10 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tsh.

This is Tumain`s first loan from BRAC,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more material for her tailoring business.

With profit she gain from the use of this loan Tumaini hopes to save more money and expand her business

loans.use: To buy more material

loans.name: Farahiya

texts.en:
Farahiya has owned and run a boutique and a fruit stand for the past nine years. A 29-year-old mother of one, she has requested her first loan of Ksh. 40,000 in order to buy stocks of clothes. She hopes that this loan will help to raise her income and allow her to pay school fees for her child and help her start importing clothes from Dubai. One day, Farahiya wants to buy a plot of land and build her own home as well as rental units and educate her children. She describes herself as jovial, faithful, innovative, talkative, and diligent.



Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable micro-finance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

texts.en: Lucila C. is from the town of Pana-on. She is 37 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Lucila owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2004, Lucila joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Lucila is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be her 15th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. To make a living, Lydia owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Lydia has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Lydia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lydia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. Lydia is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 9th loan taken out by Lydia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

texts.en:

The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of food products in the local community. Emie is just starting this business.

In 2009, Emie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. Emie is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Emie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

texts.en:
Esther owns and runs a small food kiosk and grocery in the Embakasi area of Nairobi. A 32-year-old mother of two, she has requested her first loan of Ksh. 20,000 in order to start a milk bar. She hopes that this loan will help to raise her income and allow her to pay school fees for her children. One day, Esther wants to buy a plot of land and build her own home as well as business premises. She describes herself as hard-working and friendly.

The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Antonia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. Antonia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. Dudu C. sells green vegetables and bananas and is requesting a loan in order to purchase more bananas to sell. Dudu is a mother of two children, 40 years old, and married to a soldier. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a shop.

loans.name: Flor De Illimani Group

texts.es:
Nicolasa F. de 65 años, vende papa en la feria “16 de Julio” ella pertenece al grupo “Flor de Illimani” del Centro Focal “Los Andes” y necesita el préstamo para la compra de mercadería.Las demás integrantes de “Flor de Illimani” también tienen  sus propios negocios, algunas se dedican a la comercialización  de productos como papa, fruta, carne, embutidos y dulce y otras a la costura de edredones. Todas necesitan  el préstamo para la compra de ropa, naranja, carne y tela. 
Ellas se sienten satisfechas por pertenecer a la familia de Pro Mujer y esperan estar juntas mucho tiempo.
texts.en:
Nicolasa F. is 65 years old. She sells potatoes in the “16 of July” market. She belongs to the group “Flor de Illimani” in the Andes Focal Center. She needs the loan to purchase merchandise. The other members of the Flor de Illimani group also have their own businesses. Some sell products such as potatoes, fruit, meat, sausages, and candy while others sew comforters. All of them need the loan to buy clothes, oranges, meat and fabric.

They feel satisfied to be members of the family of Pro Mujer and hope to be together for a long time.  

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise (potatoes, oranges, meat) and staples (material)

loans.name: Kivulini Group

texts.en:
Hidaya P., age 49, is married with four children ages 30, 27, 18, and 14. She has had a stationery shop since 2007.  She works from 8 am to 7 pm daily and is able to earn a monthly profit of about US$ 151. 

This will be Hidaya’s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to  start selling drinking water wholesale and has paid the loan back successfully. She now hopes for a new loan to expand the stationery shop.

Hidaya will share this loan with her group  Kivulinii which totals 16 members. These members hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture,  Hidaya is 4th from left back row.

loans.use: To expand her stock

loans.name: Funmi

texts.en: Funmi is 38 years old and married with 3 children. She is a fashion designer and she makes beautiful clothes for her customers. She also sells sarongs. She is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Sikiya

texts.en:
Greetings from Kigali, Rwanda! 

B. is 26 years old,he is single,he has an experience of 5 years in selling various goods as shown in his picture included. 

Sikiya needs his first loan from Vision Finance Company of 300,000 RWF. With this new loan, he hopes to expand his shop through purchasing more products in order to make more profit than before. 

Through accessing this requested loan, he will be able to pay for university and save for his future.

loans.use: more products

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is 43 years old and married with 4 children. He is a goldsmith and he also sells gold jewelry to make a living. He hopes for the loan amount of N150,000 to purchase more materials to make more gold jewelery to sell.  He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials to make more gold jewelry to sell

loans.name: Ysabel

texts.es: Ysabel es una carismática mujer D. 52 años, vive con su esposo Ernesto D. 55 años, quien trabaja en el puerto, y con su hijo Enzo D. 29 años. La casa donD. viven es propia. DesD. hace un año se dedica a la elaboración D. collares, pulseras y aretes, los cuales aprendió a confeccionar con la técnica D. bisutería. Esta actividad le está arrojando buenos ingresos económicos, además D. los negocios paralelos que tiene, pues también posee un motocarro que alquila a diario, elabora diversas manualidades y hace poco incursionó en la venta D. zapatos por pedido. Los deseos D. trabajar y D. progresar D. Ysabel son los motivos para ponerle tanta dedicación a su trabajo, el cual poco a poco va creciendo. Ella siempre está pensando en algún negocio nuevo que pueda poner en pie, pues no quiere depender sólo del trabajo D. su esposo. Aunque tener que estar pendiente D. tantas actividades la cansa, esto no es razón para que deje D. trabajar, más bien todo lo contrario, ella se exige mucho más y ya es costumbre ese ritmo D. trabajo. A futuro, Ysabel quiere expandir sus negocios y lograr mejores ingresos económicos. Con éste, son 15 los préstamos que ha tenido con MFP y cada uno D. ellos la han ayudado a sacar adelante sus negocios. Por su parte, siempre ha demostrado puntualidad y gran aprecio a las personas con las que trabajó en grupo, pues este es su primer préstamo individual. El dinero solicitado lo invertirá en tres D. sus negocios: comprará materiales para elaborar más joyas, incrementará su mercadería en zapatos y refaccionará su motocarro.
texts.en:
Ysabel is a charismatic woman of 52. She lives with her husband Ernesto, age 55, who works with their son Enzo (age 29) at the harbor. The family owns their house. For a year Ysabel has worked making necklaces, bracelets, and earrings, which she learned to make at a technical school for costume jewelery. This work is bringing her good income, along with the other small businesses she has. She owns a motor-taxi that she rents daily, makes a variety of handicrafts, and recently started selling catalog-order shoes. Ysabel's desire to work and make progress motivate her dedication to her work, which continues to grow. She is always thinking of new businesses that she could start, as she doesn't want to depend only on her husband. Although having so many activities makes her tired she doesn't think it's a reason to stop working; on the contrary, she demands more of herself and is already used to the workload. In the future, Ysabel wants to expand her businesses and earn better income. This loan will be her 15th with MFP and each loan has helped her advance her businesses. On her part, she has always been punctual and very appreciative of her fellow group members. This is her first individual loan. The money she requests will be invested in 3 of her businesses: she will buy materials to make more jewelery, increase her stock of shoes, and refurbish her motor-taxi.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase investment capital.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buying sewing machines

loans.name: Kelvin

texts.en:
Kelvin O. is 37 years old and married with two children. He sells clothes, jewelry and shoes.

Kelvin is requesting the loan of N100,000 to purchase more clothes and shoes to sell.  He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Carlota Jose

texts.pt:
Carlota José M., de 42 anos de idade, Natural da cidade de Maputo, distrito de Maputo, Província de Maputo, viúva e mãe de 2 Filhos de 17 e 09 anos de idade, vive na casa própria em Macassa, estudou até 12ª Classe, nunca parou de estudar teve somente algumas paragens devido a sua deslocação para Manjacaze. Alem dos filhos sustenta a neta que vive com ela.

Em 1982 saiu para Manjacaze com o seu irmão que estava transferido para trabalhar lá onde estudou ate 6ª classe, depois se deslocou para cidade de Xai-xai para tirar o curso de professores, em 1988 regressou para Maputo onde começou a trabalhar na EP1 de Macassa. 

Carlota trabalha como Professora desde 1988 e o seu rendimento mensal actual é de 5.523,00Mt com os quais sustenta a sua família e consegue poupar para fazer face às despesas de melhoramento da sua residência.

Conheceu a Hluvuku-adsema através da sua vizinha, este é o seu primeiro empréstimo, nunca teve empréstimo em nenhuma outra instituição.

Com o empréstimo de 15.000,00MT, pretende melhorar a sua residência comprando vários materiais de construcao como chapa de zinco, areia, cimento, pedra e outros. O seu maior desafio e concluir a sua obra.
Propõe se a pagar o credito sem problemas para poder aceder a outros empréstimos para mobiliar a sua casa.
texts.en:
Carlota José M. is 42 years old. She was born in the city of Maputo, district and province of the same name. She’s a widow and a mother of 2 children of 17 and 9. She owns her home in Macassa. She finished 12th grade, but she never stopped studying, except for some brief periods due to her relocation in Manjacaze. Besides her two children, she also supports her granddaughter who lives with her. In 1982, she moved to Manjacaze with her brother who was transferred to work there. She finished 6th grade there, and then she moved to the city of Xai-xai to obtain her teaching degree. In 1988, she moved back to Maputo where she began to work in EP1 (School grades from 1 through 5) in Macassa. Carlota works as a Teacher since 1988 and her current monthly salary reaches 5,523.00MT. With that money, she supports her family and manages to save to face the expenses of her home improvements. She met Hluvuku-adsema through her neighbor. This is her first loan and she never received any loans from any other association. With her 15,000.00MT she would like to make home improvements purchasing several construction materials such as zinc plates, sand, cement, stone and others. Her biggest challenge is to finish this project. She’s determined to repay this loan with no problems in order to access to other loans to be able to buy furniture for her home.

Translated from Portuguese by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Inácio Feliciano

texts.pt:
Inácio Feliciano M., de 48 anos de idade, Natural de Lichinga, província de Niassa, casado e pai de 02 filhos menores de 05 e 03 anos de idade, não vive na casa própria, fez 3º ano de engenharia eletrônica (nível básico), parou de estudar por causa de problemas financeiros. Sustenta a sua família com ajuda da esposa que é estudante e vendedora.

Nasceu em Lichinga (3.200 km a norte de Maputo) onde os seus pais estiveram a viver e em missão de serviço, tendo voltado para Maputo pouco tempo depois do seu nascimento.

É Professor afecto na casa do Gaiato (Orfanato e escola de artes e oficio de Boane) há mais de 07 anos. Teve formação de curta duração, apenas participou de um seminário em 2000. O seu rendimento mensal é de 6000,00MT com o qual e com ajuda da esposa que é vendedora (faz pequenos negócios na sua residência e em regime ambulatório) sustenta a sua família e consegue poupar para puder construir a sua residência.

Conheceu a Hluvuku-Adsema através de amigos e este é o seu primeiro empréstimo, nunca teve empréstimo em nenhuma outra instituição.

Com o credito de 25.000,00MT pretende comprar blocos, areia, cimento, chapa de zinco, barrotes e outros materiais de construção. O seu maior desafio e concluir a sua casa e continuar a estudar.
Propõe-se a pagar o credito sem problemas para poder aceder a outros empréstimos para electrificar e mobiliar a sua casa.
texts.en:
Inácio Feliciano M. is 48 years old. He was born in Lichinga, province of Niassa. He’s married and has 2 young children, ages 5 and 3. He doesn’t own his house. He completed three years of Electronic Engineering (basic level), but he dropped school due to financial problems. He supports his family with the help of his wife, who’s a student and a sales woman. He was born in Lichinga (3,200 km north of Maputo) where his parents lived while completing a service mission returning to Maputo soon after he was born. He has been a Professor on Casa do Gaiato (orphanage and arts and crafts school in Boane) for more than 7 years. He had a short professional education; he only took a seminar in 2000. His monthly salary reaches 6000,00MT. With that money he helps his wife, who’s a sale woman (she does small businesses at home and door to door). This way they support their family and are able to save to finish building their home. He met Hluvuku-Adsema through some friends. This is his first loan and he never received any loans from any other association. With this 25,000.00MT loan he would like to purchase bricks, sand, cement, zinc plates, bars and other construction material. His biggest challenge is to finish building his home and to continue studying. He’s determined to repay this loan without a problem in order to be able to request for other loans to connect the electricity and buy furniture for his home.

Translated from Portuguese by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 40 years old and married with three children. All her children are in school. She sells sarongs, shoes and bags to make a living.

Grace is requesting the loan of N100,000 to purchase more sarongs, shoes and bags to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs, shoes and bags to sell

loans.name: Bartolinas Group

texts.es:
En el Centro Focal “Juan Pablo” se encuentra la Asociación Comunal “Bartolinas” que recientemente se conformo con 10 integrantes, por la necesidad de incrementar su capital de trabajo, todas las integrantes del grupo cuentan con diversos negocios, algunas se dedican al tejido de mantas, otras tienen tiendas de barrio, y otras venden café, juguetes, material de escritorio. Ellas necesitan el préstamo para fortalecer sus negocios comprando materia prima (lana, cordel) y mercadería (dulces, carritos, hojas).
A ellas les agrada mucho que a parte del crédito puedan traer a sus hijos al consultorio y recibir orientación en el manejo de sus negocios.
texts.en:
The “Bartolinas” Communal Association is located at the “Juan Pablo” Focal Center. The group started up recently with 10 members because of the necessity to increase their working capital. All of the members of the group have different businesses. Some make shawls, others have neighborhood stores, and others sell coffee, toys, and stationary supplies. They need the loan to strengthen their businesses by buying materials (wool, yarn) and merchandise (sweets, toy cars, paper). They all really like the fact that, apart from obtaining credit, they can bring their children to group meetings and receive training about how to manage their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials and merchandise

loans.name: Nicolau Salvador

texts.pt:
Nicolau Salvador C., de 26 anos de idade, natural de Marracuene, província de Maputo, vive maritalmente e é pai de 01 filha de 02 anos, tem casa própria em Boane onde vive com a sua família, frequenta o curso de licenciatura na Universidade Pedagógica, Sustenta a sua família e ainda paga as despesas dos seus estudos.

Em 1990 saiu de Marracuene para Boane na casa do Gaiato (orfanato e escola de artes e oficio) onde estudou ate concluir o nível básico. Em 2002 fez o curso de professores no Instituto de Magistério Primario de Chibututuine no distrito vizinho da Manhica.

É  docente na casa do Gaiato há 05 anos e ganha como salario mensal na MINED ( outra instituição de ensimo) o valor de 5.000,00MT e 4.775,00MT, totalizando 9.775,00MT com o qual sustenta a família, os seus estudos e ainda consegue poupar para melhorar a sua residência.

Conheceu a Hluvuku-Adsema através de colegas de serviço que também nossos clientes, este e o seu primeiro empréstimo, nunca teve empréstimo em nenhuma outra instituição.

Com o empréstimo de 18.000,00MT pretende comprar diverso material de construção para concluir a sua obra. O seu maior desafio e concluir a sua obra, o seu sonho e concluir o ensino superior e depois casar-se.
Propõe-se a pagar o credito sem problemas para poder aceder a outros empréstimos para mobiliar a sua casa.
texts.en:
Nicolau Salvador C., 26, was born in the district of Marracuense, province of Maputo. He lives in Boane with his partner and two year-old daughter, in a house they own but that is still under construction. He's currently enrolled at the Pedagogical University of Maputo. Nicolau got his elementary teaching credentials from the Magistério Primário de Chibututuine. Since 2004 he has been teaching at "Casa do Gaiato", an Orphanage and Arts & Crafts School in Boane, where he himself studied and finished middle-school. Between his salary from Casa do Gaiato and the money he makes from teaching at another institution, Nicolau's monthly salary is 9.775,00 mt, which allows him to support his family, pay for college and also save some money. Nicolau heard about Hluvuku-Adsema thorugh friends. He plans to use his first loan to buy construction material to finish his house. He expects to pay it back without difficulties, and intends to apply for other loans in the future, to furnish his house. His hopes and dreams include finishing building his house, graduating from college and getting married.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction material to finish his house

loans.name: Xavier

texts.pt:
Xavier P. de 47 anos de idade, natural de Montepuez, província de Cabo delgado, casado é pai de 03 filhos, o primeiro tem 18 anos de idade e é estudante, o segundo com 10 anos de idade também e estudante e o terceiro tem apenas 03 meses de idade, vive na casa própria em Boane e esta a frequentar a 7ª classe, pois havia interrompido os estudos para cumprir o serviço militar obrigatório, sustenta a família com ajuda da esposa que e que agente de serviços da EPC-Namaacha.     

Nasceu em Montepuez e em 1987 mudou-se de Montepuez para Maputo pelo serviço militar obrigatório. 

Xavier P. é agente de segurança da empresa(SINER, segurança) afecto na subestação da EDM em Boane há 08 anos, foi formado pela mesma empresa em 2001 e a sua renda mensal e de 2.600,00MT, com o qual e com ajuda da sua esposa sustenta a sua família e consegue poupar para melhorar a sua residência. 

Conheceu a Hluvuku-adsema através da divulgação feita a quando da abertura da sucursal de Boane, este e o quarto empréstimo na Hluvuku, tendo se beneficiado de empréstimos de 9.200,00MT, 10.500,00MT e 13.000,00MT destinados a bens de consumo, comercio e habitação respectivamente, de salientar que tem reembolsado o empréstimo sem problemas. 

Com o empréstimo de 15.000,00MT, pretende comprar cimento, areia e pedra para concluir a sua obra. O seu maior desafio e concluir a obra.
Propõe-se a pagar o credito sem problemas para poder aceder a outros créditos para mobilar a sua casa.
texts.en:
Xavier P. is 47 years old and is from Montepuez in the Cabo Delgado province. He is married and has 3 children: the oldest is 18 and is a student, the middle child is 10 and is also a student and the youngest is only 3 months old. They live in their own home in Boane and he sometimes attends 7th grade classes. His schooling was interrupted when he had to fulfill his obligatory military service. He maintains his family with his wife’s help, who works as an EPC service agent in Namaacha. He was born in Montepuez and in 1987 he moved to Maputo for his military service. Xavier has been an insurance agent (SINER insurance) at the EDM branch in Boane for the past 8 years. This is his fourth loan with Hluvuku. His previous loans were for 9.200,00MT, 10.500,00MT and 13.000,00MT, which he used for basic goods, business and housing needs. All of his loans were repaid without any problems. With this loan of 15.00,00MT he wants to buy cement, sand and rocks to finish his project. His biggest challenge is finishing this project. He pledges to repay the loan without problems, so that he can continue with future loan cycles to improve his home.

Translated from Portuguese by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cement, sand and rocks for construction

loans.name: Armando Rodrigo

texts.pt:
Armando Rodrigo C., de 33 anos de idade, natural de Chokwe, província de Gaza, vive maritalmente e é pai de 04 filhos, dois primeiros frequentam a escola e os dois últimos não, vive na casa dos pais e esta a frequentar 4º ano do curso de licenciatura em gestão desportiva na Universidade Pedagógica. Alem da esposa e filhos sustenta os pais.  

Nasceu em Chokwe e ainda bebe saiu com os pais para Maputo, actualmente continua vivendo em casa dos pais com a esposa e filhos.

 Concluiu a formação no IMAP (instituto de magistérios primários) em 2000 e é Professor afecto na MINED (ministério da educação e cultura) desde 2001 auferindo actualmente um salário mensal de 6.000,00MT com o qual e com as receitas de 02 mesas de bilhar que tem, sustenta a família e consegue poupar para construir a sua residência. 

Conheceu a Hluvuku-Adsema através da sua colega de serviço que também é nosso cliente, este é o segundo empréstimo dele na Hluvuku-Adsema, tendo se beneficiado por um empréstimo de 25.000,00MT destinados a compra de material de construção, de salientar que o mesmo foi pago sem nenhum problema e que também já teve empréstimo no Tchuma. 

Com o empréstimo de 20.000,00MT pretende comprar blocos, areia grossa, cimento, chapas de zinco, barrotes e outros. O seu maior desafio e concluir a sua casa e a sua formação.
Propõe-se a pagar o credito sem problemas para poder aceder a outros empréstimos para mobilar a sua casa.
texts.en:
Armando Rodrigo C. is 33 years old and was born in Chokwe in the Gaza province. He is married and has 4 children—the two oldest are in school and the youngest two are not. They live with Armando’s parents. He is starting his fourth year in a Sports Management program in the University’s education department. Beyond caring for his children and wife he also takes care of his parents. He was born in Chokwe but moved to Maputo when he was still a baby. He still lives in the same house with his parents, wife and children. He graduated from IMAP (Institute for Primary Teachers ) in 2000 and he is currently a teacher at MINED (Ministry of Education and Culture) and has been since 2001. He earns a monthly salary of 6.000,00MT and also earns income from two pool tables that he owns. With that money, he supports his family and is saving to build a home. He learned about Hluvuku-Adsema through a colleague who is also a Hluvuku client. This is his 2nd loan—his first loan was for 25.000,00MT which he used to buy construction materials and was repaid without problems. He also had a loan with Tchuma. With this loan of 20.000,00MT he would like to buy bricks, coarse sand, cement, roof tiles, and other materials. His main challenge is finishing his home and his degree. He pledges to pay this loan without any problems in order to qualify for more loans in the future.

Translated from Portuguese by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: construction material

loans.name: İslam

texts.en:
İslam K. is 40 years old and is married with three children. He has operated a car-washing facility for the last seven years. He has come up the very hard way to become successful in his business. Now he is the owner and at the same time he is the operator.

İslam would like to expand his business by purchasing another pressure-washer and hiring a person to help him. For this reason he has applied for a 2,000 USD loan. We wish him good luck!

loans.use: To purchase a new pressure-washer

loans.name: Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
La asociación denominada “Fortaleza” trabaja junto a  Pro-Mujer hace cinco años,  a la fecha  cuenta con once miembros, que  han demostrado ser un grupo organizado en cuanto a sus cuotas de crédito.
Actualmente este grupo tiene negocios independientes, por ejemplo Roberto vende variedad de juguetes, otras se dedican a la venta de cosméticos, víveres, además también otras  socias  elaboran masitas y ofrecen servicio de te y cafetería. Necesitan capital para poder comprar mayores insumos o mercadería para obtener mayores ingresos que les permita ofrecer mejores condiciones de vida  a sus familias.
texts.en:
The group called “Fortaleza” (Strength) has been working with Pro-Mujer for five years. They now have eleven members and have demonstrated themselves to be a group that is organized in paying their loan amounts. Currently this group has a variety of businesses. For example, Roberto sells a variety of toys, others sell cosmetics, or groceries, and some members make sweetbreads and pastries and have tea and cafeteria businesses. They need capital in order to buy more ingredients and merchandise so they can have better incomes; this will allow them to provide better living conditions for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients and merchandise

loans.name: Selemane

texts.pt:
Selemane R., de 40 anos de idade, natural de Nampula, província de Nampula, casado e pai de 05 filhos de 17, 14, 11, 07 e 03 anos de idade, os quatro primeiros estudam e o ultimo não, vive na casa própria em Boane, estudou ate 7ª e teve que interromper para cumprir o serviço militar obrigatório. Actualmente sustenta para alem da família o sobrinho que se encontra a estudar no internato do Instituto Agrário de Boane.

Nasceu em Nampula e com 18 anos saiu para trabalho de serviço militar obrigatório durante 04 anos, depois foi trabalhar na RSA (republica da áfrica do sul) durante 05 anos aonde mais tarde veio à cidade de Maputo criar o seu lar e vive ate hoje com a sua família.

O seu trabalho e de comercio permanente, aprendeu a fazer o mesmo há 09 anos com amigos na RSA, não tem empregados conta apenas com ajuda da sua esposa, o seu rendimento médio e de 4.000,00MT com o qual sustenta a família e consegue poupar para fazer novos investimentos o que contribuira para o crescimento do seu negocio. 

Conheceu a Hluvuku-Adsema através de amigos que também são nossos clientes, este é o seu quarto na Hluvuku-Adsema tendo se beneficiado de empréstimos de 15.000,00MT, 18.000,00MT e 18.500,00MT todos destinados ao comercio.

Com o empréstimo de 20.000,00MT pretende comprar diversos tipos de roupas para revenda dos quais os melhores são o vestuário e rebuçados e o preço varia consoante o tempo. Os seus objectivos daqui para frente são de melhorar cada vez mais o seu negocio e sonha em um dia construir o seu estabelecimento comercial com mais espaço.
Propõe-se a pagar o empréstimo sem problemas para puder aceder a outros empréstimos.
texts.en:
Selemane R. is 40 years old and is from Nampula city in Nampula province. He is married and has 5 children who are 17, 14, 11, 7 and 3 years old. The oldest four are in school and the youngest is still at home. He owns a home in Boane. He studied until the 7th grade when he had to quit school in order to fulfill his obligatory military service. He not only cares for his own family, he also cares for a nephew who is studying at the Agrarian Institute of Boane. Selemane was born in Nampula and when he was 18 he left to complete his 4-year military service. After that he went to work in South Africa for 5 years, then returned to Maputo city to raise his family, which is where he lives today. He is a permanent salesman, which he learned how to do more than 9 years ago with friends in South Africa. He does not have any employees but he counts on his wife’s help. His average salary is 4.000,00MT per month which is enough to sustain his family and save a little for future investments that will help his business grow. He learned about Hluvuku-Adsema through friends that are also Hluvuku’s clients. This is his fourth loan with Hluvuku, the other three have been in the amounts of 15.000,00MT, 18.000,00MT e 18.500,00MT, all of which he used for his business. With this loan for 20.000,00MT he wants to buy a variety of clothing to resell. The best sellers are clothing and candy, both of which have a constantly varying price. His objectives are to continue improving his business and he dreams of one day building a commercial property with more space. He pledges to pay this loan without problems so that he will qualify for future loans.

Translated from Portuguese by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying and reselling clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase new products to diversify his business

loans.name: Raquel

texts.pt:
Raquel M. nasceu na cidade de maputo tem 50 anos de idade e é mãe de 4 filhos com idades compreendidas entre 9 e 19 anos todos freqüentam escola.
Raquel estudou ate 4 classe tendo parado devido à fraca condição financeira que os pais enfrentaram na era do colonialismo português.

Raquel passou a viver com seu marido quando tinha 24 anos de idade, no distrito de boane. Desde que saiu de maputo para este distrito nunca saiu para outra zona do pais, seu trabalho é de comercio (venda de refeições) no mercado central de Boane desde o remoto ano de 1986.

Aprendeu a fazer esta actividade de sua mãe. Não tem empregados, conta com ajuda das suas filhas que são também estudantes em turnos diferentes.
O seu prato do dia é carne de vaca com xima (massa de farinha de milho) que vende a 35,00MT cada refeição. O seu rendimento mensal é de 4.000,00MT que aplica no sustento da família e às vezes consegue poupar algum dinheiro na sua conta num banco comercial que opera no distrito de boane.

Raquel nunca teve empréstimos coom outros Bancos. Conheceu a Hluvuku-Adsema através das amigas, logo após a abertura da sucursal de Boane, tendo solicitado o primeiro empréstimo no valor de 8.000,00MT e outros subseqüentes nos valores de 10.000,00MT; 15.000,00MT e 20.000,00MT respectivamente para o exercício da mesma actividade.
Com o presente empréstimo de 25.000,00MT pretende comprar alimentos para confecionar e reforçar o negocio para poder responder a demanda cada vês mais exigente e crescente.

Propõe se a pagar o credito sem problemas para poder aceder a mais empréstimos coom finalidade de criação de frangos de corte.
texts.en:
Raquel M. was born in the city of Maputo. She is 50 years old and has four children between the ages of 9 and 19. They all attend school. Raquel went to school until the fourth grade and then had to stop because of the difficult financial situation her parents faced when Mozambique was still a Portuguese colony. Raquel went to live with her husband in the Boane district when she was 24 years old. She hasn't been anywhere else in the country since she left Maputo. She's worked selling meals in Boane's central market since 1986. She learned the business from her mother. She doesn't have any employees, and depends on her daughters for assistance. They alternate shifts when they're not in school. She serves beef with xima (a type of Mozambican corncake or polenta), which she sells for 35 meticals a meal. Her monthly income is 4000 meticals, which she uses to support her family, and sometimes manages to save a little money in a local bank account. Raquel has never received loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku-Adsema through friends. After the Boane office opened, she requested a loan in the amount of 8000 meticals, and further additional loans in the amounts of 10,000; 15,000; and 20,000 meticals, respectively.
