All of her loans have been used for the same purpose. Raquel will use this loan of 25,000 meticals to purchase ingredients for her meals and expand her business to respond to growing demand. She intends to pay off the loan in full without difficulty so she can request other loans that she will use to begin raising chickens.

Translated from Portuguese by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for prepared meals

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela O. is married and has three children. She has received schooling through senior high. Her husband is a mechanic who earns little for a living.

Angela is a hair dresser and also at the same time sells hair products in Hohoe, which she has done for two years. Angela uses her income in paying the children’s school fees.

For the expansion of Angela’s salon, she will use the loan to buy salon equipment such as hairdryers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Angela plans to build a house.

loans.use: To buy salon equipment such as hairdryers

loans.name: Ines Alberto

texts.pt:
Inês Alberto M. nasceu no distrito de Manjacaze província de Gaza (a 300 km da ciddade de Maputo) tem 56 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 1 filha de 22 anos de idade que frenquenta escola. Estudou ate 8 classe tendo parado por falta de visão e questões sociais (os pais tinham o mito de que as mulheres não deviam estudar muito).
Vive com sua família e sustenta também seus pais que se encontram distante, mas na sua responsabilidade.

Inês viajou muito pelo pais desde que saiu do distrito natal de manjacaze. Conhece 4 províncias do pais. Trabalha para o Ministério do Interior a mais de 34 anos como policia. Foi formada no ano de 1974 no centro de formação de policias de Matalane em maputo.
Tem como salário mensal 10.200,00MT que aplica no sustento da família e na construção da sua casa que está fazendo em fases com material convencional.

Nunca teve empréstimos com outros Bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku-Adsema através de colegas tendo aproximado para solicitar o primeiro credito no valor de13. 000,00MT.
Este é o seu segundo empréstimo com a Hluvuku-Adsema no valor de 20.000,00MT que prestende comprar materiais de construção da sua casa.

Propõe se pagar o credito sem problemas para poder aceder a mais empréstimos com o intuito de terminar a obra e posterior compra de mobiliário.
texts.en:
Inês Alberto M. was born in Manjacaze in the Gaza province (300 km from the city of Maputo). She is 56 years old, married, and has a 22 year old daughter who attends school. Inês attended school through the 8th grade. She dropped out due to poor vision and social issues (her parents believed that women shouldn't get much education). She lives with her family and also supports her parents, who although they live far away, are under her care. Inês has traveled a lot throughout the country since she left her native Manjacaze. She has lived in 4 provinces in the country. She has worked as a police officer for the Ministry of the Interior for more than 34 years. She completed her training in 1974 in the Matalane police training center in Maputo. She earns a monthly salary of 10,200,00 MT which she uses to support her family and build her home, a project she is completing in phases with conventional materials. Inês has never had a loan from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku-Adsema through friends when she approached the bank for her first loan of 13.000,00 MT. This is her second loan with Hluvuku-Adsema. It is for 20.000,000 MT which she will use to purchase construction materials for her home. She plans to pay off the loan without any problems so that she can have access to additional loans to finish her home and furnish it.

Translated from Portuguese by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Blanca Azucena

texts.es:
Blanca vive en el barrio Chiquinquirá en el sector la playa en Azogues, tiene 47 años de edad,  es divorciada y tienes 2 hijos de 21 y 18 años, aún viven con ella son solteros y estudian en la universidad,  viven en casa propia.

Trabaja en el comercio de funeraria desde  hace 20 años en sociedad con su madre,  en la calle sucre en el centro de Azogues, su servicio es las  24 horas del día y el negocio les deja una buena utilidad, las dificultades de este negocio es tener que levantarse las madrugadas para atender a sus clientes.

El préstamo que solicita los utilizara para ampliar el negocio comprando cajas, a saber que el precio de cada una de ellas es de 300 hasta 1200 dólares, incluida la capilla ardiente individual.

Blanca es socia hace 3 o 4 años aproximadamente  y le gusta los beneficios que aquí le brindan, sus metas son viajar por el país incrementando su negocio.
texts.en:
Blanca lives in the Chiquinquirá neighborhood in the La Playa sector in Azogues. She is 47 years old, is divorced, and has 3 children who are 21 and 18 years old. They still live with her; they are not yet married and are studying in the university. The family lives in their own house. Blanca has been in business with her mother in funerary services for 20 years. Their business is located on Sucre Street in the center of Azogues. The service is 24 hours per day and the business provides them a good living. The problem with this business is having to get up very early in the morning to tend to their clients. The loan she is requesting will be used to expand the business by buying coffins because the price of each one is between $300.00 and $1,200.00, including individual funeral chapel services. Blanca has been a member for 3 or 4 years approximately. She likes the services provided here. Her goals are to travel the country and to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy coffins

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace A. sells provisions such as canned fish, baked beans, and cocoa beverages in Hohoe. She has received primary education. She is married and has six dependents. Her husband is a trader.

Grace has been selling provisions since 1991. She helps her husband in paying the housekeeping expenses and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more provisions for resale. She hopes to reinvest the profits from her expanded business.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for her grocery store

loans.name: Leonora Alface

texts.pt:
Leonora Alface M. de 33 anos de idade natural da cidade de Matola, casada, e mãe de 3 filhas com idades compreendidas entre 6 e 16 anos que se encontram a estudarem nas escolas oficiais de Boane. Leonor estudou ate 4 classe tendo parado por dificuldades de varia ordem.
Vivem com seu marido, filhos e sua mãe que está sob sua responsabilidade.

Saiu de maputo para swazilandia (pais vizinho de Moçambique) em 2003, foi lá onde começou a fazer negocio de venda de roupa diversa. Regressou ao paìs com seu marido e continua a fazer o mesmo negocio.
 
Tem uma empregada que lhe ajuda no negocio. Vende roupa diversa, sapatos e cobertores obtendo um rendimento mensal de 6.000,00MT com qual consegue sustentar a família e ate poupar um pouco para mementos de crise.

Nunca teve empréstimo com outros bancos, desde que regressou da swazilandia, conheceu a Hluvuku-Adsema através de vizinhos e tendo aproximado e obteve o primeiro empréstimo de 20.000,00MT que destinava se ao reforço do stock.

Com o presente credito de, também, 20.000,00MT pretende adquirir mais mercadoria (comprar mais cobertores, roupa diversa e sapatos) para vender no mercado local de boane.

Propõe se a pagar o credito sem problemas para poder aceder a mais empréstimos com o intuito de expandir o negocio e melhorar as condições sociais da família.
texts.en:
Leonora Alface M. is 33 years old and from the city of Matola. She is married and has 3 daughters between the ages of 6 and 16 who are all studying in the official schools of Boane. Leonora attended school until the 4th grade but left school due to various difficulties. She lives with her husband, children and her mother, whom she supports. Leonora left Maputo for Swaziland (a neighboring country of Mozambique) in 2003. There, she began a business selling clothing. She returned to Mozambique with her husband and continued her business. She has an employee who helps her with the business. Leonora sells a variety of clothing, shoes, and blankets, with monthly earnings of 6.000,00 MT that she uses to support her family and even save a bit for emergencies. She has never had a loan with other banks. When she returned from Swaziland, she learned about Hluvuku-Adsema through neighbors and came to the bank for her first loan of 20.000,00 MT which she used to increase her inventory. With the current loan also 20.000,00 MT, she plans to purchase more merchandise (blankets, clothing, and shoes) to sell in the local market in Boane. She plans to pay off the loan without any problems in order to be able to request future loans with the goal of expanding her business and improving her family's social condition.

Translated from Portuguese by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy and sell clothing

loans.name: Jose Dolores

texts.es: Don José Dolores de 42 años, casado, comerciante desde muy joven  ha trabajado para ayudar a sus padres y luego a su propia familia, su esposa le tiene dos hijos de 2 y 11 años de edad,  su negocio es la venta de plásticos y electrodomésticos. Sus planes es poder terminar de construir su casa para darle una mejor seguridad a su familia. Con este crédito es su sexto préstamo el cual espera invertir en comprar productos plásticos, ropa, y electrodoméstico con esto espera incrementar el volumen de ventas y generar mejores ganancias. Da las gracias a la institución por el apoyo con los préstamos ya que es de muco beneficios.
texts.en:
José Dolores is 42 and married. He has been a merchant since he was very young. He has worked to help his parents, and later his own family. He and his wife have two children ages 2 and 11. He sells plastics and domestic appliances. His plan is to be able to finish building his house to give his family more security. This is his sixth loan. He will buy plastic products, clothes, and household appliances with the loan. He thanks the institution for the support of the loans because they are very helpful.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes, plastics, and household appliances

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es:
La asociación denominada “Primavera” trabaja junto a  Pro-Mujer hace cinco años,  a la fecha  cuenta con doce socias activas, cada dos semanas se reúnen en el centro focal Villa Exaltación, ubicado en la ciudad de El Alto.
Existen diferentes negocios  dentro la asociación como ser; la venta plásticos, víveres, abarrotes, shampoo,  también se dedican a la elaboración de almuerzos, los cuales los venden en pensiones. Necesitan capital para poder comprar mayor cantidad de mercadería  o productos, de esta manera generar mayores ingresos que les permita ofrecer bienestar a sus familias
texts.en:
The group called "Primavera" (Spring) has worked with Pro Mujer for five years. To date they have twelve active members who meet every two weeks at the Villa Exaltación center, which is located in the city of El Alto. They have different businesses such as selling plastic, supplies, groceries, and shampoo. Some of them also make food, which they sell at boarding houses. They need capital to be able to buy a larger quantity of merchandise or products. In this way they will generate more income that will let them offer their families well-being.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and/or products

loans.name: Philip

texts.en: Philip B. is married and has three children. He has received schooling through senior high. Philip sells provisions, assorted biscuits, and candies in Hohoe, which he has done for five years. His wife is a petty trader with a little income. Philip is solely responsible for the family financial expenses. Philip will use the loan to purchase plastic products to add to his provisions for resale. With the new profits from his expanded business, Philip plans to reinvest.

loans.use: To purchase plastic products for resale.

loans.name: Danelia Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Danelia de 47 años de edad, casada y con dos hijos de los cuales estudian, su esposo trabaja como maestro de obra, y la ha apoyado en todos los planes. Reside en Villa Venezuela, doña Danelia tiene una pulpería que logro poner hace diecinueve años con esfuerzo de su esposo para ayudar con los gastos y sastifacer las necesidades cotidiana ya que todo esta caro,  pero ha logrado administrar su negocio con la ayuda de Afodenic ya que gracias a los prestamos ha venido desarrollándose en el comercio, este es su noveno ciclo el cual va invertir en la compra de granos básicos, productos lácteos,  y productos de cosméticos ya que son consumibles por sus clientes. Con este préstamo espera obtener mejores ganancias. Sus planes a futuro es proyectarse en hacer más grande su negocio. Da las gracias a la institución por los beneficios alcanzados.
texts.en:
Danelia is 47 years old, married with two schoolaged children. Her husband works as a construction foreman and has always supported her goals. She lives in Villa Venezuela and has a small store which she managed to set up 19 years ago with the effort of her husband to help with the expenses and cover the daily necessities, since everything is expensive. She has managed to administer her business with the help of Afodenic, since thanks to the loans she has developed the business. This is her ninth loan, which she will invest in the purchase of basic grains, dairy products and cosmetics products, since those are the most popular with her customers. With his loan she hopes to obtain a higher income. Her future plans are to grow her business even larger. She thanks the Afodenic institution for the benefits provided.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of dairy products, grains, and meat

loans.name: Rosita Da Conceicao De

texts.pt:
Rosita da conceição de M. nasceu na cidade da Matola (a 22 km de Boane em direção a cidade de maputo) tem 36 anos de idade e é mãe de 2 filhos estando o mais velho a frequntar 7 classe na Escola Primaria completa de Boane.
Rosita parou de estudar na 9 classe devido a problemas de saúde. (tem dificuldades de vista). É solteira vivendo com os filhos e sua mãe que também esta sob sua responsabilidade.

Há sete anos que vem fazendo negocio num pequeno estabelecimento comercial formal a beira da estrada principal que liga maputo-Boane e Namaacha. Tem uma empregada que lhe ajuda nos trabalhos de venda de bebidas, refrigerante e outros produtos que os adquire a 8 km do local de venda. O produto com mais saída é cerveja e rende por dia cerca de 900,00MT que aplica no sustento da família e poupa no Banco comercial 3.000,00MT mensalmente.
 
Nunca teve empréstimo com outros bancos e este é o seu segundo  com a hluvuku-adsema e que obteve informações sobre a existência da instituição através de amigos. O primeiro empréstimo foi de 10.000,00MT que se destinava para reforço do stock de venda. Com o presente credito de 20.000,00MT pretende aumentar o volume do negocio comprando mais cerveja, refrigerantes e outros produtos.

Propõe se a pagar o empréstimo sem problemas para poder aceder a mais empréstimos com objectivo de expandir o negocio e melhorar a situação sócia econômica familiar.
texts.en:
Rosita da Conceição de M. was born in the city of Matola (22km from Boane heading towards the city of Maputo). She is 36 years old and has 2 children. Her older child is in the 7th grade in the Primary School of Boane. Rosita dropped out of school in the 9th grade due to health problems (she has vision problems). She is a single mother living with her children and her mother, whom she also supports. For the past seven years she has had a small shop on the side of the main road that links Maputo-Boane and Namaacha. She has an employee who helps her sell beverages, soft drinks and other products that she buys 8 km from the sales location. The most popular product is beer and she earns about 900,00 MT per day that she uses to support her family. She saves 3.000,00 MT monthly in a commercial bank. She has never had a loan through other banks and this is her second loan with Hluvuku-Adsema, which she learned about through friends. Her first loan was for 10.000,00 MT which she used to purchase more stock for her business. With the current loan of 20.000,00 MT she plans to increase the volume of her business by purchasing more beer, soft drinks, and other products. She plans to pay off the loan without any problems in order to have access to future loans with the goal of expanding her busienss and improving her family's socio-economic situation.

Translated from Portuguese by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and sale of various products (drinks, soft drinks, etc.)

loans.name: Arco Iris (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Arco Iris esta ubicado en el barrio Tres Marías de la parroquia Turí, a 15 minutos fuera de la ciudad de Cuenca, es un sector semiurbano, su clima es frío, su gente se dedica a la agricultura y el comercio, sus fiestas patronales las celebran en el mes de Mayo, en estas se realizan diferentes actividades como juegos pirotécnicos,  vacas locas, castillos, y muchas diversiones que llama la atención a propios y extraños.

El banquito esta conformado por 7 socias quienes son muy responsables y agradables con todos, el grupo es muy unido y colaborador así como también muy dedicado a sus labores.

A continuación citamos algunas socias que pertenecen al banquito y cuentan su testimonio:

María vive en el barrio Tres Marías, tiene 64 años de edad,  es viuda hace 20 años y no se ha vuelto a casar, tiene 5 hijos  de 40, 36, 34, 32 y 30 de edad,   los 4 primeros ya casados y con familia cada uno, el ultimo hijo todavía soltero vive con ella y es su compañía, todos sus hijos le ayudan económicamente ya que tiene que realizarse chequeos médicos todo el tiempo debido a que sufre muchas enfermedades y también por su edad, nos cuenta que ella ya no puede cultivar las tierras y debido ha esa razón entrego todo en herencias a sus hijos para que ellos las sigan cultivando.

Tiene 3 años siendo socia y ha realizado ya varios préstamos, se dedica a la crianza de pollos  los cuales están listos para la venta en unos 2 meses aproximadamente, los vende pelados por libras, y los entrega en tiendas o en el mercado.

Ahora tiene 50 pollos, el préstamo realizado lo va ha invertir en el alimento y compra de más pollos y así ampliar más su negocio, su meta es de que si Dios le da vida y salud seguir ayudando ha sus hijos y verles a ellos realizar sus sueños que se plantearon en la vida.

Marcia vive en el Barrio Tres Marías, vía ha Punta Corral, tiene 26 años es casada y su esposo le ayuda económicamente en la casa ya que trabaja en la construcción y entre ellos tienen una buena relación matrimonial en la cual concibieron  2 hijos de 7 y 6 años ellos estudian en la escuela Aurelio Ochoa de la comunidad y viven en la casa de sus padres.

Marcia trabaja en una fábrica de jeans de 8am a 12pm y de 1pm a 5pm de la tarde, también tiene un criadero de  15 pollos y  45 cuyes, cuenta que no tienen dificultad en sus 2 trabajos, a lo contrario le da muchas ventajas ya que así ha logrado comprar materiales como son hierro y ladrillo  para la construcción de su vivienda.

El préstamo lo va ha invertir en la compra de más pollos y ampliar su criadero ya que cada pareja de estos le cuestan 5,50, su meta es seguir adelante como hasta ahora lo ha hecho para construir su vivienda y darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.

Mariana vive en el Barrio Tres Marías, tiene 51 años es casada, su esposo es jubilado y le hace compañía en la casa, en su vida matrimonial han procreado 5 hijos de 29, 26, 22, 20 y 18 años de edad,  todos viven con ella, trabajan  y le ayudan económicamente, viven  en casa propia ya que con el esfuerzo y el trabajo en su juventud la construyeron.

Mariana se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos, agricultura y a la crianza de los animales, tiene 70 cuyes, 40 pollos, 3 chanchos y 8 pavos, no tiene horario fijo de trabajo, las verduras que cultiva en su terreno las vende en la feria libre (lugar comercial de Cuenca).

Lleva 3 años trabajando junto a la FUNDACIÓN  ESPOIR  y ya ha realizado  varios préstamos. Entre las socias son muy unidas y se llevan muy bien  y así lo demuestran en cada reunión ya que siempre se encuentran entre risas y bromas es un grupo muy alegre.

El préstamo que realiza hoy es para comprar mas pollos, cuyes ya que el costo de cada cuy pequeño es de 5 dólares, sus metas es seguir con crianza de los animales ya que es su sustento.
texts.en:
The communal bank, "Arco Iris" (Rainbow) is located in the Tres Marías neighborhood in the parrish of Turí, which is 15 minutes outside the city of Cuenca. It's a semi-urban sector, the climate is cold, and the people are dedicated to agriculture and business. They celebrate the town's founding during the month of May. During this time, different activities are held like games, fireworks, and other fun things that attract people from both inside and outside the town. The bank is formed of 7 members who are very responsible and friendly with everyone. The group is very united and collaborative. They are also very dedicated to their work. We will now profile some of the members of the bank: María lives in the Tres Marías neighborhood, is 64, and has been a widow for 20 years. She hasn't re-married. She has 5 children who are 40, 36, 34, 32, and 30. The oldest 4 are already married with families of their own. Her youngest son is still single and lives with her and keeps her company. All of her children help her financially since she has medical checkups all of the time since she suffers different illnesses because of her age. She tells us that she can no longer farm her land, and because of this, she has given her children their inheritance so they can keep farming it. She has been a member of the bank for 3 years and has had several loans. She raises chickens, which will be ready for sale in approximately 2 months. She sells plucked chickens by the pound to stores or at market. She now has 50 chickens, and she will invest the loan in the purchase of feed and more chickens so she can expand her business. Her goal is that God gives her life and health to keep helping her children and to see them reach their dreams that they have made for themselves in life. Marcia lives in the Tres Marías neighborhood. She is 26, is married, and her husband helps her with their home's expenses since he works in construction. Between them, they have a good marriage, and they have two children, who are 7 and 6. They go to the Aurelio Ochoa school in their community and live with them. Marcia works in a jeans factory from 8am-12pm and 1pm-5pm. She also is raising 15 chickens and 45 guinea pigs. She says she doesn't find it difficult to have 2 jobs. In fact, it gives her a lot of advantages since she has been able to buy materials like metal and bricks to construct her home. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of more chickens to expand her business since each pair of chickens costs $5.50. Her goal is to get ahead, to construct her home, and to give her children a better future. Mariana lives in the Tres Marías neighborshood, is 52, and married. Her husband is retired and keeps her company in the house. They have 5 children, who are 29, 26, 22, 20, and 18. All of them live with her, work, and help her financially. They live in their own home that they constructed with hard work when they were younger. Mariana does domestic chores, practices agriculture, and raises animals. She has 70 guinea pigs, 40 chickens, 3 pigs, and 8 turkeys. She doesn't have a fixed work schedule. She sells the vegetables she grows at a market in Cuenca. She has worked with Fundación Espoir for 3 years, and she has had several loans. The members are very united and get along very well. At each meeting, you can find laughter and jokes because this is a very happy group. This loan will be used to buy more chickens and guinea pigs since each guinea pig costs $5. Their goals are to keep raising animals since this is their source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more chickens, guinea pigs, and feed for their animals and to expand their businesses.

loans.name: Sabino Antonio

texts.pt:
Sabino António T., de 33 anos de idade, natural de Matola, província de Maputo, casado pai de 02 filhos de 09 e 04 anos de idade, os dois vão à escola e vive na casa própria em Boane. Interrompeu os estudos na 10ª classe por motivos profissionais mais tarde concluiu o nível médio. para alem dos filhos biológicos sustenta também um filho adoptivo que vive com ele. 

Nunca mudou da cidade tendo passado toda a sua infância, sua adolescência e a sua juventude na cidade que lhe viu nascer, onde vive ate hoje. Boane.  

Sabino T. é professor na casa do Gaiato (centro de artes e ofícios e orfanato) há nove anos, começou a trabalhar antes de fazer a sua formação profissional, só veio a fazer o curso no Instituto de Magistérios Primarios-Matola há quatro anos tendo como renda mensal de 10.000,00MT com o qual sustenta a família e consegue poupar algum para melhorar a sua residência.

Conheceu a Hluvuku-adsema através de amigos e colegas que também são clientes da instituição e este é o segundo empréstimo, tendo se beneficiado de empréstimo no valor de 12.500,00MT cuja finalidade era compra de material de construção.  Fez o reembolso do primeiro empréstimo sem problemas. 

Com o presente empréstimo de 15.000,00MT pretende comprar cimento, areia e pedra para concluir a sua obra. O seu maior desafio é concluir a obra e sonha em ter outra casa no campo onde poderá programar projectos de agropecuária.
Propõe-se a pagar o credito sem problemas para poder aceder a outros créditos para tornar possível o sonho de ser um empreendedor de sucesso.
texts.en:
Sabino António T., 33, was born in Boane, district of Matola, in the province of Maputo, where he still lives. Married and the father of three school-age kids (two biological and one adopted), Sabino lives with his family in a house they own and that is still under construction. In spite of his high-school studies having been interrupted for a few years due to his need to work to support himself, Sabino was able to go back to school and got his teaching credentials four years ago, from the Instituto de Magistério Primário-Matola (Elementary School Education Institute-Matola). He has been a teacher at "Casa do Gaiato" (orphanage and arts & crafts school) for the past nine years. His monthly salary of 10.000,00 mt allows him to support his family and save some money. Sabino heard about Hluvuku-Adsema from friends. He will be using this, his second loan, to buy construction material to finish his house. He expects to pay this loan back without problems, as he did with the first one. In the future, he hopes to apply for other loans to buy some land where he can build a second home, develop agricultural projects and realize his dream of becoming a successful entrepreneur.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction material

loans.name: Industrial Group

texts.es:
En uno de los Centros Focales de Pro Mujer “Panamericana” se encuentra la Asociación Comunal “Industrial”, están juntas hace 3 años aproximadamente, liderizadas por su presidenta Valentina Laime, se agruparon por la necesidad de contar con mayor capital de trabajo y mejorar sus negocios. 
Tejido  a máquina, elaboración de muebles,  venta de comida, refresco, papa y ropa son los negocios de las integrantes del grupo “Industrial” y requieren el préstamo para comprar materia prima como lana, madera y mercadería que les permita tener productos variados que ofertar a sus clientes.
texts.en:
In one of Pro Mujer's Panamerican centers, you will find the communal bank, "Industrial." They have been together for approximately three years, and they are led by their president, Valentina Laime. They formed their group because of their need for more working capital and to improve their business. They weave by machine; make furniture; and sell food, drinks, potatoes, and clothing. They need this loan to buy supplies such as wool, wood, and merchandise that will let them have more variety to sell to their customers.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies and merchandise

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en: Oscar A. sells music and video CD’s in Hohoe. Oscar has received tertiary education.  He is married and has four dependants. His wife is a trader. Oscar has been selling CD's since 1993. He is responsible for the financial needs of the entire family. His loan will be used to buy more music and video CD's to sell. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to buy land and build.

loans.use: To buy music and video CD's to sell.

loans.name: Aida

texts.es: Doña aida S. es una mujer que desde muy joven se ha dedicado a la venta de ropa y cosméticos para ayudar primeramente a su padres y cuando se caso a su esposo para solventar los gastos de su familia, tiene 54 años de edad, reside en el barrio Carlos Fonseca de la Farmacia Solmar. Procreo cuatro hijos de los cuales todos están casados, con Afodenic lleva cuatro ciclos trabajando y ha hecho de gran oportunidad para seguir ofreciendo sus productos a sus clientes, como la captación de clientes nuevos, vende al contado y al crédito de quincena. Con este crédito invertirá en variados cosméticos y perfumenes de los cuales espera obtener mejores ganancias, de los productos que venden son buenos ya que son de la Zermath conocidos por los clientes y a buen precio. Da las gracias a la institución por beneficios alcanzados no solo para su negocio si no para su familia.
texts.en:
Aida S. has worked selling clothes and cosmetics since she was a young girl. She did this primarily to help her parents. When she got married, she worked to help her husband with the household expenses. She is 54, and she lives in the Carlos Fonseca neighborhood of the Solmar Pharmacy. She has four married children. She has been working with Afondenic for four loan cycles. This has been a great opportunity to keep offering her products to her customers and to get new customers. She sells for cash and credit for two weeks. She will use this loan to buy various cosmetics and perfumes, which she expects to give her greater earnings. The products she sells are good because they are from Zermath, which is well known to her customers and at a good price. She is grateful to the institution for the benefits gained not only by her business but also for her family

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cosmetics and perfume

loans.name: Malwine

texts.en: Malwine M. sells cloths and plastic products in Kwamikrom. Malwine has received a junior high education.  She is married and has four dependants. Her husband is a trader who makes a little money for a living. Malwine has been selling clothes and plastic products since 1995. She helps her husband foot the family utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more children’s clothes and plastic products for resale. She hopes to reinvest the new profit from her expanded business.

loans.use: To buy more children’s clothes and plastic products for resale.

loans.name: Ithalie

texts.en:
Ithalie is a 32-year-old father of two who has run a small food kiosk for the last five years. He requested his first loan of Ksh. 20,000 in order to purchase additional stock of foodstuff like flour, sugar and rice. He would like to continue to expand his business, one day diversifying into wholesale foodstuff. He hopes to provide for his family, send his children to school, and purchase a plot of land on which to build a home. He describes himself as friendly, social and hardworking.



Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. It recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Don Juan Carlos de 45 años de edad, reside en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, casado su esposa trabaja en servicios domésticos, para poder apoyar a sus dos hijos de 8 y 9 años con los estudios, y poder solventar los gastos de la familia. El negocio del señor Juan es soldador eléctrico y la compra de vehículos usados lleva diecinueve años en este negocio, que inicio con ahorros y que poco a poco ha venido desarrollándose y obteniendo clientela, el lleva diez ciclo en Afodenic y se siente sastifecho por la oportunidad que le han dado con los prestamos que ha logrado comprar sus propios equipos. Con este préstamo comprara materiales de construcción para hacer un porche y tener mejores condiciones con su familia.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is 45, and he lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood. He is married, and his wife works in domestic services to be able to help support their two children, eight and nine, with their education and to be able to pay the household expenses. Juan’s business is electric soldering and buying used vehicles. He has been in this business for 19 years. He started the business with savings. Little by little it has been developing and gaining customers. He has been with Afodenic for ten loan cycles. He feels satisfied about the opportunity they have given him with the loans and that he has been able to buy his own equipment. He will use this loan to buy construction materials to build a porch and have better living conditions with his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to build a porch

loans.name: Bertha Francisca

texts.es: Bertha Francisca D. Narváez tiene 62 años de edad. Ella tiene varios créditos con Fundación León 2000, por lo que siempre se ha encargo de cancelar en tiempo y forma. Su actividad económica es la venta de refrescos. Hace más de 15 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Doña Bertha conduce todos los días un pequeño carretón en donde ofrece sus refrescos de manera ambulante, todos sus clientes esperan su llegada pues su refrescos son lo mejor para el inmenso calor.  A Bertha le gusta su trabajo a pesar de que es muy humilde, pero es por medio este que lleva el alimento diario a su familia. Ella necesita el crédito para la compra de azúcar, frutas, bolsas, hielo, pan y galletas. Su mayor deseo es obtener una lugar en donde ofrezca comida y así generar más ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Bertha Francisca D. Narváez is 62. She has had various loans with the Fundación León 2000, and she has always paid them on time and as agreed upon. She sells soft drinks. She has been doing this for over 15 years. Bertha takes her little cart every day to where she sells her soft drinks as a street vendor. All of her customers await her arrival because her soft drinks are the best for the immense heat. Bertha likes her work even though it is very humble. It is the means to providing her family with their daily food. She needs a loan to buy sugar, fruit, bags, ice, bread and crackers. Her biggest wish is to get a place where she can sell food and generate more income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Rosa Adelina

texts.es: Doña Rosa Adelina de 56 años de edad, reside en el barrio la primavera en la capital de Managua, soltera y con hijo recapacitado, pues le ha tocado duro salir adelante, para poder cuidar a su hijo, opciono estudiar belleza y instalar su propio salón de belleza el cual lleva diez año administrándolo, lo inicio con ahorros y prestamos, sus planes es poder abrir una cuenta de ahorro para dejar a su hijo bien para que le falte nada, ya que con mucho amor le ha enseñado ha salir adelante. Con este préstamo va a comprar cosméticos y tratamientos de belleza para aprovechar la temporada que se acerca la navidad. Da las gracias a la institución por hacer posible crecer en su inventario y de muchos beneficios para su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa Adelina, 56 years old, lives in the neighborhood of La Primavera in the capital of Managua. She is single and has a disabled son, so it has been difficult for her to succeed. In order to care for her son, she decided to study cosmetology and start her own beauty salon, which she has spent ten years running. She started it with her savings and loans. Her plan is to open a savings account to leave her son, so that he won't lack for anything, since she has lovingly taught him how to succeed.

With this loan, she will buy cosmetics and beauty treatments to take advantage of the Christmas season. She gives thanks to the institution for making it possible for her to increase her inventory and benefit her family.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and beauty products

loans.name: Juana Domitila

texts.es: Juana Domitila L. A. tiene 53 años de edad. Es madre soltera. Vive en su propia casa con sus 2 hijos que trabajan de manera independiente. Desde hace mas de 5 años que se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos. Por las mañanas vende su queso y cuajada en su vivienda, por lo que sus vecinos recurren a su casa en busca de estos productos Doña Juana los vende a un precio muy accesible. Sus hijos ayudan con estas tareas. El sueño de Juana es obtener su propio medio de transporte y estar siempre unidos en familia. El dinero que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima como queso, leche, cuajada y crema.
texts.en:
Juana Domitila L. A. is 53 years old and is a single mother. She lives in her own home with her two children, who are independent and work. For over 5 years, she has sold dairy products. In the mornings, she sells cheese and curds in her home, and her neighbors come to her house to find these products. Juana sells them at a reasonable price, and her children help her with this work.

Juana's dream is to obtain her own means of transportation and to always be together with her family. The loan that she has requested is for working capital to buy raw materials like cheese, milk, curds, and cream.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Giovanna Del Rosario

texts.es: Doña Giovanna de 42 años de edad, vende repostería y cosméticos desde hace siete años, el cual comenzó con ahorro que su esposo dio para iniciar, reside en el barrio Laureles Sur, su esposo es comerciante, tiene dos hijos de 6 y 15 años de edad que estudian su primaria, desde hora muy temprano prepara los alimentos para su familia, luego prepara la harina para hacer la repostería que hacer para vender que desde hace siete años vende, a si como ropa, y cosméticos. Con este préstamo es su noveno ciclo en Afodenic el cual ha sido de muchos beneficios en hacer las mejoras a su vivienda como  a su negocio. Con este crédito comprar materiales de construcción para hacer el baño de la casa y poder estar en mejores condiciones con su familia.
texts.en:
Giovanna is 42 years old. She has sold pastries and cosmetics for seven years, which she started to do with savings that her husband gave her to start. She lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood. Her husband is a trader, and they have two children who are 6 and 15 years old and are students.

Starting early in the morning, she prepares food for her family. Then she prepares the flour to make the pastries she will sell. She does this in addition to selling cosmetics and clothing, which she has been doing for seven years.

This is her ninth loan cycle with AFODENIC, which has helped her by improving her house as well as her business. With this loan, she will buy construction materials to build a bathroom for her house, which will improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build a bathroom in her house

loans.name: Haydee Apolonia

texts.es: Haydee Apolonia R. Hernández tiene 58 años,  vive con su esposo u sus 2 hijos. Desde hace mas de 20 años que se dedica a la compra y venta de cerdos. Desde muy joven trabaja en granjas ya que fue por medio de este trabajo que logro ofrecerles a sus hijos alimento y vestimenta. Ya que no tenía algo que le generara ingresos y decide dedicarse a esta actividad, por lo que no ha sido nada fácil. El desafío que Haydee enfrente es en las temporadas de lluvias ya que no puede salir a vender sus cerdos ya que hay un puente que está totalmente destruido y la vía de acceso para poder salir es mucho más difícil. El dinero que solicita es para capital de negocio para la compra de cerdos, vitaminas, desparasitantés y así ofrecer una mejor calidad de cerdos. El sueño de Haydee es construir un mejor lugar para colocar a los cerdos.
texts.en:
Haydee Apolonia R. Hernández is 58 and lives with her husband and 2 children. For more than 20 years she has earned her living buying and selling pigs. She has worked on farms since she was very young, allowing her to feed and cloth her children. She decided on this business because she had no other way to earn a living, so nothing has been easy. The challenge is the rainy season, because Haydee can't get out to sell her pigs. There's a bridge that gets washed away making the route out much more difficult. Haydee is seeking a loan for working capital to buy pigs, along with vitamins and antiparasitics so she can offer her pigs higher quality care. Her dream is to build a better place to keep her pigs.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es: Don  Pedro de 49 años de edad, reside en el barrio Santo Domingo en la capital de Managua, casado y con una bella familia de tres hijos de 7,8 y 12 años de edad, estudiantes de la primaria, su esposa tiene una pequeña pulpería la cual ayuda en los gastos del hogar, el tiene un taller de mecánica automotriz que desde hace veinte años trabaja, inicio como ayudante en una empresa luego adquirió experiencia la cual aprovecho para poner su propio taller el cual hasta ahora administra con los años ha logrado hacer una clientela buena. Con este crédito lo quiere para hacer un muro en el taller para tener una mayor seguridad. Sus planes es remodelar el taller y prestar un servicio en buenas condiciones para captar nuevos clientes. Da las gracias Afodenic por los bienes adquirido tanto en su negocio como en lo personal.
texts.en:
Pedro, 49 years old, resides in the neighborhood Santo Domingo in the capital city of Managua. He is married and has a beautiful family with three children -- 7, 8, and 12 years old -- who are all primary school students. His wife has a small store, whose profits help pay for household costs. Pedro has a mechanic shop where he has worked for the last 20 years. He began as an assistant at another workshop and later acquired enough experience to open his own garage, which he currently manages. Over the years, he has developed a good clientele. With this loan he wants to build a wall for the workshop in order to improve security. His plan is to remodel the workshop and provide service in good conditions to attract new clients. He gives thanks for the assets -- both professional and personal -- that he has acquired through AFODENIC.

Translated from Spanish by Colleen Godfrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to make a wall

loans.name: Bertha Cecilia

texts.es: Bertha Cecilia Téllez J. tiene 41 años. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de ropa. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Ella dio inicio a este negocio con esfuerzo propio para ayudar en los gastos de su familia. A pesar de las dificultades que ha enfrentado le han servido para proporcionarles a sus hijos lo necesario como es el pan de cada día.  Ella prendió este negocio de una manera muy rápida ya que tenía el interés en ganar dinero. Ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de faldas, camias, pantalones, camisolas y ropa interior. Sus deseos son obtener una tienda en donde sus clientes puedan apreciar todos sus productos.
texts.en:
Bertha Cecilia Téllez J. is 41 years old, and has two dependent children. She sells clothing, which she has done for more than five years. She started this business with her own effort, in order to help with her family's expenses. In spite of the difficulties she has faced, this business has allowed her to give her children the necessities of life, like daily bread.

Her business took off quickly since she is motivated to earn money. She is requesting this loan to use as working capital to buy skirts, shirts, pants, camisoles, and underwear. Her desire is to have a store where her customers can appreciate all her products.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Vicente De Jesus

texts.es: El señor Vicente es un hombre  que se ha dedicado a trabajar para salir adelante con su familia, pues ha trabajado en obras de construcción  y hoy que se desempeña en cobranza de una casa comercial. Tiene 43 años, su esposa le tiene un hijo de 15 años estudiante, ella trabaja en como conserje para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar, reside en el barrio Memorial Sandino, sus planes para su familia es poder terminar de mejorar su casa. Con este préstamo en Afodenic lograra comprar materiales de construcción para agrandar un cuarto y poder estar cómodo, este es  su cuarto ciclo en la institución el cual da las gracias ya que se ha beneficiado para mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Vicente is a man who has dedicated himself to working so that his family can succeed; he has worked as a construction worker and now he works in collections for a home business. He is 43 years old, and he and his wife have a 15-year-old son who is a student. His wife works as a housekeeper to help her husband with household expenses. They live in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood.

His plans for his family are to finish improving their house. With this loan from Afodenic he will be able to buy construction materials to enlarge a room and be able to be comfortable. This is his fourth loan cycle with the institution, and he is thankful that he has been able to improve his home.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction materials to enlarge a room

loans.name: Damaris Del Socorro

texts.es: Damaris del Socorro M. S. tiene 43 años, su prioridad para ella son sus 3 hijos. Desde muy joven se dedico al trabajo como es la venta de cosméticos. Ella siempre ha tratado de brindar un buen servicio a sus clientes. La ubicación de su negocio es de manera ambulante, por lo que tiene que ofrecer sus productos a muchas personas. Siempre le ha preocupado brindarles a sus hijos los estudios necesarios para que no tengan problemas en un futuro. El dinero que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de pinturas de labios, pinturas de uñas, cremas y colonias. Su deseo es ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Damaris del Socorro M. S. is 43 years old, and her priority is her 3 children. Since she was very young, she has sold cosmetics. She has always tried to provide good service to her customers. Her business is door-to-door, so she offers her products to many people. She has always been concerned with giving her children the education they need so they don't have problems in the future.

This loan is for working capital to buy lipstick, nail polish, creams, and colognes. Her wish is to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es: Juan Francisco García Martínez tiene 67 años. Este señor se dedica a brindar el servicio de taxi de manera muy humilde y trabajadora. Hace más de 50 años que se dedica a este negocio. El inicio este negocio desde hace mucho tiempo, por lo que aprendió a conducir a pesar de esta muy joven él era un joven muy responsable ya que tenía que hacerse cargo de su familia, y trabajo muy duro para obtener su propio su propio negocio y decide comprar un carro y este es su medio de trabajo y así ha logrado proporcionarle a su familia lo más necesario. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de llantas, focos y proporcionarle mantenimiento. El sueño de Juan es comprar un nuevo carro y que asegurar más ingresos a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan Francisco García Martínez is 67 years old. He makes a living providing a taxi service. He is very humble and hard working, and has made a living in this business for more than 50 years. Juan started this business a long time ago, and learned to drive when he was very young; he had to take care of his family, and so he had to be very responsible as a young man. Juan worked very hard to set up his own business and decided to purchase a car. This is his source of income and it has enabled him to provide his family with what they need most. The funding Juan is requesting is for working capital, which he will use to purchase tires and lights and to perform maintenance on his car. Juan’s dream is to purchase a new car and thus guarantee more income for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es: La señora Dominga de 53 años de edad, casada y con residencia en Memorial Sandino, se dedica a la venta de mariscos el cual inicio este negocio hace veinte años, solo con la venta de pescado en cantidades pequeñas, para obtener sus propios ingresos, sus hijos están casados. Ella desde horas temprana se va a su tramo a vender la variedad de mariscos ricos en toda las especie y sano para la salud. En Afodenic es su décimo crédito y lo invertirá en la compra de mariscos para seguir ofertando cada día a sus clientes, lo cual espera obtener buenas ganancias y así poder seguir mejorando su tramo.
texts.en:
Domingo is 53 years old, married and lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood. She works selling shellfish, a business that she started twenty years ago to earn her own income; initially selling in small quantities. Her children are married. She goes early in the morning to her booth to sell a variety of delicious shellfish that are healthy. This is her tenth loan with Afodenic and will invest it in the purchase of shellfish to continue offering it everyday to her customers to obtain higher income to continue improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a variety of shellfish

loans.name: Isaura Suyen

texts.es: La joven Isaura Suyen de 27 años de edad,  se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos, el cual inicio con fondos propios que su marido ayudo, poco a poco ha ido creciendo y son tres años en este negocio. Reside en el barrio Reparto España en la capital de Managua con dos hijos de 4 y 9 años los cuales estudian en la escuela del barrio, con este crédito quiere comprar variedad de ropa para niños, damas y caballeros y seguir en las ventas. Sus planes a futuro es poder tener su propia tienda grande. Da las gracias Afodenic por la oportunidad con el préstamo que gracia a esto ha logrado superarse y tener sus propios ingresos que son de mucho para su familia.
texts.en:
Young Isaura Suyen, 27, operates a business, selling clothing and footwear, that she started with her own and her husband's savings. The business has grown, little by little, over the last three years. She lives in the Reparto Espana neighborhood of Managua with her two children, 4 and 9, who are studying in local schools. Isaura will use the loan to buy clothing for men, women and children so that she can continue operating her business. In the future, she would like to own her own store. She's grateful to Afodenic for giving her the chance to borrow money for a business that has allowed her to get ahead in the world and have an income that she can use to help support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise to resell.

loans.name: Afi Mama

texts.fr:
Cette dame exerce depuis 2001 la vente de produits alimentaires au grand marché de Lomé, grâce à son dynamisme et son sens des affaires. Elle sollicite de WAGES un prêt lui permettant d’acheter 02 cartons de pâte alimentaire, 03 bidons d’huile, 05 sacs de riz, 04 cartons de vins et divers produits
elle est célibataire sans enfants, c'est avec le revenu de son commerce qu'elle subvient aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
Thanks to her dynamism and her business sense, this woman started her business in 2001, selling food products in the big market in Lomé. She is asking the micro-finance organization WAGES for a loan which will enable her to purchase 2 cartons of pasta, 3 canisters of oil, 5 sacks of rice, 4 cartons of wine and various other products.

She is single and without children. It's with the revenues from her business that she is able to help pay for the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase food products

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Maria del Carmen  tiene la edad de 64 años, mujer dedicada  a su familia y a su trabajo, desde muy joven hace costura y vende ropa y cosméticos, el cual lleva veintinueve años en las ventas y ha sido un logro en su vida personal, reside en el barrio Sabana Grande, casada, sus hijos mayores de edad. El negocio lo comenzó con fondos propios y la necesidad de superación. Con este préstamo lograra invertir en cosméticos de la Avon, ropa nueva y variada, lo cual espera obtener captación de clientes nuevos. Da las gracias a la institución por los préstamos que obtenido es su octavo ciclo y espera seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria del Carmen, 64, is a women dedicated to her family and her business. Since she was very young, she's been making clothes and selling them, along with cosmetics, work that she's now been doing for twenty-nine years. She's had a happy personal life, as well. She lives in the Sabana Grande neighborhood, she's married and has grown children. She started her business with her own savings and a need to get ahead in the world. She will use this loan to buy Avon cosmetics and a variety of clothing which she expects will help her to capture new customers. She's grateful to the institution for the loan, her eighth, and expects to go on working.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise to resell.

loans.name: Juana Adilia

texts.es: La señora Juana Adilia de 39 años de edad, reside en el barrio Villa Reconciliación en la capital de Managua, soltera, su negocio es una comideria que desde hace nueve años administra el cual inicio con fondos que su exposo dio y ahorros que tenia, con el préstamo comprara zinc para cambiar el techo donde tiene el comedor y poder estar en las mejores condiciones con su familia y buena atención a sus clientes, ya que se le pasa con las lluvias que caen en este invierno, a futuro es poder invertir mas en la comideria. Da las gracias Afodenic por los beneficios alcanzados en hacer las mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Sra. Juana Adilia, 39, lives in the Villa Reconciliacion neighborhood of Managua. She is single. She operates a restaurant in her house that she started nine years ago with her own savings and funds provided by her former husband. She will use the loan to repair the roof over the dining area, work that will improve conditions for both her customers and her family during the heavy rains this winter. She would like to invest more in the business in the future. She is grateful to Afodenic for making it possible to improve her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials for roof repair.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Doña Maria Elena Hernández de 33 años de edad, casada, resida en el barrio Laureles Sur en la capital de Managua, su esposo trabaja en servicios de seguridad, ella tiene una pulpería de seis años el cual comenzó con pequeños prestamos, sus planes es poder agrandar su negocio para obtener mejores ingresos, tiene cuatro hijos de 3,5,9 y 14 años de edad, ellos estudian la primaria, con este préstamo va a comprar productos lácteos, carnes, y granos básicos para poder ofrecer a sus clientes. A futuro es poder hacer mejora a su vivienda, se siente sastifecha por los logros adquirido .
texts.en:
Dona Maria Elena H., 33, is married and lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood of Managua. Her husband works for a security firm. Maria Elena has owned a corner shop for six years, a business that she started with small loans. She wants to grow the business so that she can increase her income. She has four children, 3-, 5-, 9- and 14-years old, respectively, all in school. She will use this loan to buy dairy products, meats and basic cereals to resell to her customers. In the future, she would like to be able to improve her house. She is happy with her progress so far.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise to resell.

loans.name: Silvio Jose

texts.es: Don Silvio M., reside en el Georgino Andrade en la capital de Managua, su esposa le tiene dos hijos,  el tiene 47 años de edad, su esposa se dedica al cuido de los niño y del hogar, el se desempeña como panificador, en este trabajo lleva tres años, pues en la venta le va bien ya que muchos Nicaragüense es el alimento el rico pan, y hace variados, y ricos picos los cuales distribuye en las diferentes pulpería de Nicaragua anteriormente ha trabajado en servicios de seguridad, y de albañil. Sus planes es mejorar las condiciones de vida. Con este crédito va a comprar materiales de construcción para hacer mejoras a su vivienda y poder dar mejor seguridad a su familia. Da las gracias por el apoyo con este préstamo ya que lograra el objetivo de poder tener una casa digna para su familia.
texts.en:
Don Silvio M., 47, lives in the Georgino Andrade neighborhood of Managua. His wife has given him two children. She takes care of them and their house now. He works as a bread-maker, work that he's been doing for three years. Sales are brisk because bread is the favorite food of many Nicaraguans. The delicious bread, of various kinds, is sold to different corner stores around Nicaragua. Before becoming a bread-maker, Silvio worked as a security guard and a construction worker. He wants to make a better life. With this loan, he will buy construction materials to improve his house and make it more secure for his family. He is grateful for the help this loan will provide because it will allow him to meet his goal of providing a decent place for his family to live.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials for home improvements.

loans.name: Iccel Amanda

texts.es: Doña Iccel Amanda de 30 años de edad,  reside en el barrio Laureles Sur en la capital de Managua, tiene una pulpería donde vende variedad de productos, este negocio lo inicio con ahorros y prestamos que hizo en Afodenic es su sexto ciclo y se siente sastifecha ya que ha logrado aumentar su negocio y tener un mejor  inventario. Tiene un hijo de 4 años de edad, su esposo le ayuda administrar su negocio. Con este crédito invertirá en la compra de materiales de construcción para hacer su cocina y poder tener mejores condiciones. Sus planes a futuro es poder seguir incrementando su negocio y hacerlo una distribuidora. Da las gracias ala institución por los logros en su vida personal el cual ha beneficiado e su familia.
texts.en:
Iccel Amanda is 30 years old, and lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood in the capital, Managua. She has a small grocery store where she sells a variety of products. She started this business with her savings and with loans she received from Kiva partner Afodenic. This is her sixth loan cycle, and she is happy because she has been able to increase her business and improve her inventory. Iccel Amanda has a 4-year-old son, and her husband helps her manage her business. She will use this loan to invest in the purchase of construction materials for building a kitchen, which will improve her family’s standard of living. Her plan for the future is to continue increasing her business and become a wholesale distributor. She thanks the Afodenic organization for her personal achievements, which have been of great benefit to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing construction materials for building a kitchen

loans.name: Silvio

texts.es: El señor Silvio González de 39 años de edad, trabaja en servicios de seguridad, lleva ocho años desempeñándose, se siente contento por tener un trabajo  en donde puede ayudar a su familia, su sueldo es bajo pero peor seria no tener estos ingresos, su esposa tiene una pulpería la cual ayuda para ayudar a sus hijos con los gastos son cuatro los cuales estudian, y en tiempos libres ayudan en la venta a despachar, el anhelos de don Silvio es poder terminar de hacer las mejora a su casa. Con este préstamo quiere hacer un cuarto en la parte de atrás para tener un poco de privacidad con su familia, se siente contento por lograr este comienzo gracias a la institución.
texts.en:
Silvio is 39 years old and works in security services. He has spent eight years getting out of debt and is happy to have a job that allows him to assist his family. Though his salary is low, it would be worse not to have this income. His wife has a small grocery store that helps with the expenses of their four children who are still students. The children help at the store with sales and deliveries during their free time.

Silvio's goal is to finish making improvements on his house. With this loan he hopes to add a room onto the back in order to give his family a little privacy. He feels very happy to achieve a new beginning thanks to this lending institution.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING CONSTRUCTION MATERIALS TO BUILD A NEW ROOM

loans.name: Union Y Progreso Group

texts.es: Los socios del banco comunal “Unión y Progreso” esta representado por el señor Hernando y 13 miembros todos con calificación AA debido a que ya van cursando su tercer ciclo demostrando puntualidad responsabilidad y unión en el grupo. Una gran mayoría de los socios se dedican a la venta de ropa, libros, abarrotes en tiendas de barrio, comida, ladrillo y  a la confección de prendas de vestir de todo tipo. En el tiempo que trabajaron con el grupo han demostrado ser capaces de salir adelante a pesar de cualquier adversidad o competencia en el mercado ya que saben como trabajar. El nuevo financiamiento es para la adquisición de mercadería, insumos y materia prima para seguir agrandando sus negocios para darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus familias y poder perseguir un mejor futuro para sus hijos.
texts.en:
The members of the community bank 'Union and Progress' are represented by Mr. Hernando and 13 members, all with AA rating due to the fact that they are in their third loan cycle, demonstrating punctuality, responsibility, and unity in the group. A large majority of the members work selling clothing, books, groceries in neighborhood stores, food, and bricks and making articles of all types of clothing. In the time they have worked with the group they have demonstrated that they are capable of moving ahead despite any adversity or competition in the market since they know how to work. The new financing is for the acquisition of merchandise, supplies, and primary materials to continue expanding their businesses in order to give a better quality of life to their families and be able to pursue a better future for their children.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Amistad Group

texts.es: Las socias del banco comunal "Amistad" están representado por la señora Nelly Lourdes y conformada por 14 miembros los cuales se encuentran cursando su segundo ciclo demostrando responsabilidad, unidad, responsabilidad y sobre todo ganas D. salir adelante. Las socias D. este banco tienen diferentes actividades comerciales como la venta D. comida, frutas, abarrotes, ropa, F. y a la atención D. puntos viva, otras tienen tienda en sus barrios donD. venden artículos para el hogar. Como en todo rubro comercial siempre la competencia  es un factor que influye en las ventas diarias es por esta razón que las socias requieren del préstamo para poder hacer frente a la competencia con productos nuevos y D. alta demanda en el mercado. Los socios son integrantes unidos y con muchas granas D. sacar sus negocios a flote para darles a sus familias una mejor vida.
texts.en:
The partners of the community bank Amistad (Friendship) are represented by Mrs. Nelly Lourdes and incluD. 14 members who find themselves in the second loan cycle demonstrating responsibility, unity, and above all the desire to move ahead.The members of this group have different commercial activities such as the sale of food, fruit, groceries, clothing, flowers, and phone calling services. Others have stores in their neighborhoods where they sell household articles. As in all commercial activity there is competition which is a factor that influences the daily sales. For this reason the members require the loan to be able to face the competition with new products and to meet the high demand in the market. The members are integrated and united with a strong desire to keep their businesses afloat in order to proviD. a better life to their families.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Siempre Amigas Group

texts.es: Las socias  del grupo “Siempre Amigas” están representadas por la señora Maria del Carmen y conformada por 14 miembros los cuales residen en el mismo barrio, cada una D. ellas tienen sus propios negocios D. venta D. comida, costurera, venta D. pan, tienda D. abarrotes, venta D. refrescos empanadas, tienda D. ferretería, promotoras D. cosméticos, venta D. sabanas, edredones, venta D. ropa, cafés Internet. En cuanto a la competencia  en sus negocios indican que existe pero pese a eso a ello las socias saben como salir adelante con esfuerzo y confianza trabajando día a día por darles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. El destino del financiamiento es para ampliar la mercadería D. sus pequeños negocios y así poder generar un mayor ingreso que repercute en una mejor calidad D. vida para sus familias. Los antecedentes crediticios del grupo es muy bueno ya que cuentan con experiencia  en grupos solidarios gracias a créditos anteriores en entidades financieras similares a la fundación Agrocapital, dentro D. este grupo se pudo observar que son socias muy organizadas, unidas y muy responsables, ya que cada reunión llevan a cabo una rifa para hacer crecer su caja chica y así al finalizar el ciclo puedan tener un ahorro que ayuD. con sus gastos familiares.
texts.en:
The members of the group "Siempre Amigas" (Always Friends) are represented by señora Maria del Carmen. The group is maD. up of 14 members who live in the same neighborhood. Each one of them has her own business selling food, sewing, selling bread, running a grocery store, selling drinks and empanadas, running a hardware store, selling cosmetics, selling sheets and blankets, selling clothing, or running an internet cafe. They say that their competition exists, but in spite of this, they know how to get ahead by working hard and having confidence. They work every day to give their families a better quality of life. The financing will go towards expanding the merchandise in their small businesses so they can generate more income that will result in a better quality of life for their families. Their credit history is very good, and they have experience with communal banks thanks to previous credits from institutions similar to Agrocapital. Within this group, it was noted that the members are very organized, united, and responsible. At each meeting, they have a raffle to grow their treasury, so that at the end of each loan term, they can have savings to help with their families' expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 7mo crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (terminar una habitación repellandola), trabaja como  conserje de CETA INATEC desde hace 8 años, tiene 2 hijos,  la mayor tiene 15 años de edad y esta estudiando su 2do año de educacion secundaria y la menor de 12 años de edad estudia 4to grado de educación primaria;  Elizabeth es madre soltera y ha salido adelante con el cuidado de sus hijas, se caracteriza por ser honesta y muy trabajadora, vive en un barrio de la zona urbana en la zona # 4 en un lugar centrico del municipio de Nueva Guinea, su sueño es terminar de construir su vivienda y así gozar de mejores condiciones, que sus hijos estudien para que lleguen hacer alguien en la vida ya que ella no pudo estudiar una carrera por las condiciones economicas de sus padres y tener estabilidad laboral  para sacar a sus hijos adelante.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is asking for refinancing of her 7 month credit in order to invest in the improvement of her home (to finish plastering a room.) She has worked as a caretaker of CETA INATEC for the past 8 years. She has two children; the older one is 15 years of age and studying in his second year of secondary education. Her younger son is 12 years old and currently in the 4th grade of primary school. Elizabeth is a single mother and has gone forward with the care of her children alone, which demonstrates her honest and hardworking character. She lives in a neighborhood in the urban area of zone #4 in the central part of the municipality of New Guinea. Her dream is to finish constructing her home, and to provide the best conditions for her children to study so they are able to make something of their lives, since she was not able to get a degree given her parents’ economic conditions. She hopes to have the working stability to be able to push her children forward.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Kirkvold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To plaster a room

loans.name: Ametauna Group

texts.es: Las socias del grupo “Ametauna” están representadas por la señora Bleidy y conformada por 13 miembros dentro D. los cuales la mayoría son gente joven pero con muchas ganas D. trabajar como lo demuestran en sus puestos D. venta D. productos como empanadas, refrescos, cosméticos por catálogos, venta D. abarrotes, venta D. masetas, joyas y atención en café Internet. El nivel D. la competencia en  el rubro comercial es elevada pero ellas saben como salir adelante gracias a su dinamismo y ganas D. salir adelante. El crédito esta destinado para el crecimiento D. sus negocios comprando más mercadería, insumos y herramientas que ayuden generar una mayor utilidad que servirá para proporcionar a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. En cuanto a experiencia los miembros del grupo gozan D. ella gracias a créditos anteriores en entidades similares a la fundación Agrocapital, pero el mejor antecedente que presentan es su juventud que se refleja en  su dinamismo y las ganas D. salir adelante.
texts.en:
The “Ametauna” Group are represented by Mrs. Bleidy and consists of 13 members, among whom the majority are young people with much desire to work. This is demonstrated by their vending booths, selling products such as meat pies, soft drinks, cosmetics from catalogs, groceries, jewelry, and by service in an internet cafe. Their level of competence in the area of commerce is high and they know how to get ahead, thanks to their dynamism and desire to advance themselves.

This loan is to expand their businesses, buying merchandise, supplies, and tools which will help generate greater profits and proviD. their families with a higher standard of living.

Concerning experience, the group members have earned it thanks to previous loans from entities similar to the Agrocapital Foundation. But the best antecedent they offer is their youth as reflected in their dynamism and their desire to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: OPERATING CAPITAL FOR SEVERAL SMALL BUSINESSES

loans.name: Jeruzalem Group

texts.es:
el grupo solidario jeruzalem esta integrado por tres personas las cuales se conocen muy bien y son vecinos de la comunidad de san lorenzo,todos se dedican al comercio.
a continuacion se detalla las actividades que ellos hacen:
 
la sra. Maria Emilia B. es comerciante tiene 60 años de edad es madre soltera, depènden de ella tres hijos, se dedica a la venta de ropa en el mercado viejo de San Lorenzo, vende ropa desde hace 15 años, Maria necesita el prestamo para comprar mas mercaderia para poder vender en la 
feria del pueblo.

el señor Carlos Roberto H. esta casado con la señora Yohana Aguilar, no tienen hijos, los dos se dedican a la venta de chineria (articulos fabricados de vidrio) desde hace 03 años, el necesita el crédito para compra de mas mercaderia para poder venderla en la feria de San Lorenzo,
 
la señora Gladys Esperanza García tiene 63 años de edad,  es soltera no dependen de ella ninguno sus hijos, todos estan casados, Gladys vive sola su casa, su casa es muy bonita y se dedica a la venta de ropa usada desde hace 08 años sus ventas las realiza en los barrios y colonias de san lorenzo, la mercaderia se la envia su hijo de los USA. Gladys necesita el prestamo para comprar un fardo de ropa mixto.

todos ellos necesitan el credito para poder salir adelante.
texts.en:
The Jeruzalem Group is made up of three people who know each other well and are residents of San Lorenzo. They are all business people. The details of their activities are as follows: Maria Emilia B. is a merchant. She is 60 years old and a single mother. She has three children who depend on her. She sells clothing in San Lorenzo's old market. She has been selling clothing for 15 years. Maria needs the loan to buy more merchandise to sell at the town fair. Carlos Roberto H. is married to Yohana Aguilar. They do not have children. The two have been selling glassware for 3 years. He needs the credit to buy more merchandise, so he can sell it at the San Lorenzo fair. Gladys Esperanza García is 63 years old. She is single, with no dependent children, as they are all married. Gladys lives alone in her lovely home and has sold used clothing for 8 years. She makes her sales in the neighborhoods and districts of San Lorenzo. Her son sends her the merchandise from the USA. Gladys needs the loan to buy a bundle of mixed clothing. Each of them needs the credit to be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel McRoberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of used clothing and glassware (glasses, plates, cups, decorations)

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es: Doña Eusebia  está solicitando su 1er crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (cambiarle el zinc a la cocina que se encuentra en mal estado), trabaja como docente de el Proyecto para un Pueblo Nuevo, tiene 5 hijos pero solamente 2 dependen economicamente de ella,  los dos estudian 5to año de educacion secundaria, como tambien ayuda a su esposo a cuidar a sus ancianos padres con los gastos del hogar, su esposo trabaja como agricultor, doña Eusebia todos los dias se levanta a la cuatro de la mañana  para dejar el desayuno preparado y por las tardes planea sus clases y  termina de hacer los quehaceres de la casa, ambos se ayudan con los gastos de la familia, es una señora con alto espiritu de superación personal, muy responsable, es una docente que ama su trabajo ya que ayuda a muchos niños  a aprender a leer y escribir de la comarcas las Torres,  su sueño  es  que sus hijos estudien una carrera, tener estabilidad laboral, salud  y una vivienda con mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Mrs. Eusebia is asking for her first credit to invest in the improvement of her home (to change the zinc (roofing) in the kitchen that is in bad condition.) She works as a teacher for the Project for a New Town. She has 5 children but only 2 are still financially dependent on her, and those two are currently studying in their 5th year of secondary school. She also supports her husband in caring for his elderly parents with the costs of living. Her husband is a farmer, every day Mrs. Eusebia gets up at four o’clock in the morning to prepare breakfast, and in the afternoons she plans her classes and finishes doing the housework and chores, both help with the expenses of the family. She is a woman with the high spirit of self-improvement, is very responsible, and as a teacher she loves her work since she can help many children learn to read and write in the Las Torres region. Her dream is for her children to be able to study for a degree, to have working stability, health, and a home with better conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Kirkvold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to change the roof/ceiling in the kitchen

loans.name: Francisco Donato

texts.es:
el seños Francisco Donato B. es un emprendedor que se levanta a las  4:30 de la mañana para salir a cargar su producto y salir a venderlo a varios  barrios de la ciudad.
don Francisco es un padre soltero y el cuida a su hija que tiene 15 años y que la tiene estudiando.  
Francisco espera con este credito salir adelante con su negocio, el nos comento que su meta o sueño es poder comprar un terreno para poder hacer su casa despues y asi poder dejarle a su hija que es lo que mas quiere en este mundo un lugar en donde ella pueda vivir por el resto de su vida.
texts.en:
Francisco Donato B. is an entrepreneur that gets up at 4:30 in the morning to load his product and go out to sell it in various neighborhoods in the city.

Francisco is a single father and he cares for his 15 year old daughter who is studying. Francisco hopes that this loan will help his business get ahead. He has told us that his goal, or his dream is to be able to buy land to be able to build a house later. This way, he can leave it for his daughter. This is what he wants most in the world – a place where she can live for the rest of her life.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of white bread and sweets

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: El Carmen Group

texts.es: Las socias del banco comunal "El Carmen" esta representado por la señora Nelly y conformado por 13 miembros los cuales se encuentran cursando su tercer ciclo, demostrando unidad, honestidad, puntualidad y responsabilidad con su grupo y al institución. Este banco tienen diferentes actividades algunas venden comida o a la cocina, otras son promotoras D. cosméticos y otras se dedican a la venta D. ropa.
