Como en todo rubro comercial siempre existe la competencia D. la oferta y la demanda, pero las socias siempre están listas ofreciendo productos mas acorD. a la moda o innovando en nuevas comidas o en productos mas baratos. El crédito esta destinado para la diversificación D. productos y para invertir en lo que se refiere a cada uno D. sus pequeños negocios ya sea comprando mas mercadería a bajo costo o a la compra D. insumos y materiales que ayuden a generar un mayor ingreso para poder darles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. A pesar D. las adversidades son han demostrado ser un grupo dinámico y con muchas ganas D. salir adelante con su pequeños negocios que representan el sustento D. sus familias.
texts.en:
The members of the El Carmen community bank are represented by Nelly. The bank is maD. up of 13 members who are in their third loan cycle and have demonstrated unity, honesty, punctuality, and responsibility with their group and with the institution. The members of this bank have different businesses – some sell food or cook, others sell cosmetics, and others work in clothing sales. As in any commercial area, there always exists competition of supply and demand. However, the bank members are always ready, offering products in line with fashion, creating new foods, or selling cheaper products. This loan will be used for the diversification of products and to invest in each small business so that they can purchase lower cost merchandise, or purchase consumables and materials that help generate more income to help them give their families a better quality of life. Despite the adversities, they have demonstrated that they are a dynamic group with a great deal of desire to get ahead with their small businesses which are the means of support for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational capital

loans.name: Urania Del Carmen

texts.es: Urania  está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 3er crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (Repellar la casa), trabaja como docente de la Esc. Rubén Darío # 2, vive en la colonia La Unión de Nueva Guinea, tiene un  hijo de 6 años estudia pres escolar,  es una joven que ha luchado para que a su ancianos padres no les falte nada ya que ella es una hija muy responsable con sus padres,  es una mujer profesional, responsable, honesta,  trabajadora , profesa  la religión católica, sueña con tener un porvenir mejor, estudiar una maestria,  tener una vivienda bonita, trabajo, y seguir ayudando a sus padres.
texts.en:
Urania is asking for her third loan, to invest in the improvement of her home (to plaster the house). She teaches at the Ruben Dario School #2. She lives in La Union, Nueva Guinea, and has a six-year-old son in preschool. She is a young woman who has fought so that her elderly parents have everything they need, since she is a responsible daughter. She is a professional, responsible, honest, hard-working, Catholic woman. She dreams of having a better future, studying for a masters degree, having a nice home, working, and continuing to help her parents.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel McRoberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Plastering her house

loans.name: Las Intocables Group

texts.es: Las socias del grupo "Las Intocables" están representadas por la señora Victoria y conformados por 13 miembros los cuales van cursando tercer ciclo con agrocapital demostrando responsabilidad, unión, honestidad y sobre todo ganas de salir adelante. Las socias de este banco tienen diferentes actividades algunas venden comida, otras son promotoras de cosméticos,  otras se dedican a la venta de ropa, bolsas plásticas y a la venta de vidrio. Como en todo rubro comercial siempre existe la competencia de la oferta y la demanda pero gracias a la experiencia de las socias ellas pueden salir adelante haciendo sus productos mas acorde a las exigencias del mercado como ropa de moda y cosméticos a mas bajos precios, para esto es que requieren de un nuevo financiamiento ya que las socias tienen nuevos proyectos para generar mayores ingresos y es por esta razón el desean el apoyo económico para la adquisición de mercaderías, insumos y materiales nuevos para agrandar sus negocios y poder brindar a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The 13 members of the "Las Intocables" village bank, represented by Mrs. Victoria, are completing their third loan cycle with Agrocapital, demonstrating their responsibility, unity, honesty and -- above all -- desire to get ahead. The members of the village bank work in different sectors such as food sales, cosmetic sales and promotion, clothing sales, plastic bag sales and selling glass products. As in all commercial activities there is a balance between supply and demand, but thanks to their experience the members have been able to move forward, designing their products to meet the needs of the market, like stylish clothing and cosmetics at lower prices. This requires new financing, since the members are already working on new projects to generate more income and for this reason desire economic support to acquire merchandise, consumer goods and materials to increase the size of their businesses and bring their families a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kahn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Dimas Isaias

texts.es:
el joven Dimas Isaias F. se dedica al comercio, el cuenta con un negocio en el cual vende ropa para cama y planchas electricas, el sale muy temprano a diferentes barrios, colonias y caserios cercanos a la ciudad de Choluteca, tambien su producto lo distribuye en diferentes empresas estatales y privadas, el necesita el credito para comprar mas mercaderia al por mayor ya que tiene que viajar a la frontera en donde los productos son mas baratos. esto es para poder sacarle mayor ganancias a los mismos. su meta a corto plazo es poder montar una pequeña tienda en donde el tenga su producto en venta y tambien salir a vender.
el nos comento que se siente muy feliz ya que expresa que todo le esta saliendo bien y que tiene muchos deseos de superarse y salir adelante. desea tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The young man Dimas Isaias F. dedicates himself to commerce. He counts on a business in which he sells bedding and electric irons. He leaves very early for different neighborhoods, communities and settlements near the city of Choluteca. He also distributes his products through different state and private businesses.

He needs the loan in order to buy more merchandise at wholesale. He has to travel to the border where the products are cheaper. This allows him to take bigger profits. His short term goal is to be able to open a small shop where he can have his products for sale and also get out of traveling sales. He told us that he feels very happy since everything is going well and he has a strong desire to excel and get ahead. He wants to have a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bedding and electric irons

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Andrea Justina

texts.es:
En el departamento de León, la señora Andrea Justina M. dedica parte de su vida a la venta de ropa la que es comercializada a diario recibiendo a los clientes que le visitan para adquirir dicha ropa.

Ella se ha destacado por ser una excelente trabajadora y hoy en día ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener un crédito para la compra de la ropa y de esta manera continuar comercializándola en su localidad.
texts.en:
In the Department of León, Señora Andrea Justina M. devotes part of her life to the sale of clothing, which she markets every day, receiving customers who come to her to acquire clothes.

She has stood out through being an excellent worker. At present she has looked for support from Ceprodel in order to obtain credit for the purchase clothing and in this way continue marketing in her locality.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing

loans.name: Edelma Del Rosario

texts.es: Edelma está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 3er crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (construcción de una habitación), vive en la  colonia la Unión, trabaja como docente de la Esc. Rubén Darío # 2, desde hace 9 años tiene un hijo de 6  añitos de edad estudia su  primer grado, su esposo trabaja como albañil y comparten los gastos del hogar,  es una mujer  con alto espiritu de superación personal, muy responsable, es una mujer que ama su trabajo, su sueño  es  terminar de estudiar la carrera en ciencias de la Educación, tener salud  y terminar de construir su  vivienda para así darle  mejores condiciones a su familia.
texts.en:
Edelma is asking for refinancing of her 3rd loan in order to invest in the improvement of her home (construction of a room.) She lives in the La Union district, and has worked in education in the Ruben Dario School #2 for the past 9 years. She has a 6 year old son who is currently in primary school, and her husband works as a builder and shares the costs of their home. Edelma is a woman who loves her job. Her dream is continue her career to finish studying education science, to be healthy, and to finish constructing her home so as to provide better conditions for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Kirkvold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a room

loans.name: Justina De La Concepción

texts.es:
En la ciudad de León, la señora Justina R. es propietaria de su propio negocio de venta de bebidas las que son comercializadas por ella misma en su establecimiento donde es muy visitada por los clientes que compran dichos productos. Entre las bebidas que ella ofrece se encuentran las gaseosas, los jugos, el agua, entre otros.

Ella espera ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de las bebidas y así continuar en su negocio con el fin de llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
In the city of Leon, Mrs. Justina R. is the owner of her own business in the sale of beverages that she markets herself in her own establishment, visited by many clients that buy the said products. Among the drinks that she offers, one can find soft drinks, juices, water, and so on. She hopes to benefit from a loan to use for the purchase of beverages, and in this way to continue her business and to sustain her home.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Kirkvold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beverages (soft drinks, juices, etc.)

loans.name: Coronado Roca Group

texts.es: Las socias del  grupo "Coronado Roca" están representados por el señor Jorge y conformada por 16 personas las cuales van cursando su primer siclo con la institución pero cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios gracias a créditos con entidades similares a la fundación Agrocapital. La mayoría D. los socios se dedican a actividades comerciales D. venta D. productos como cosméticos, sabanas, colchas tejidas, verduras, comida, salteñas y a actividades como la costura D. prendas D. vestir la carpintería y el transporte público D. pasajeros. Como en todo rubro comercial siempre existe la competencia pero las socias saben como salir adelante diversificando sus productos y adecuándolos a las exigencias del mercado. El crédito esta destinado a la adquisición D. materia prima, insumos y materiales así como para la compra D. herramientas D. trabajo y mercadería que ayudaran a mejorar sus ingresos incrementando sus ventas y ayudando a mejorar la calidad D. vida D. sus familias.
texts.en:
The members of the Coronado Roca Group are represented by Jorge and are maD. up of 16 people who are going through their first cycle with the institution, but they have experience with group loans thanks to entities similar to the Agrocapital Foundation. The majority of the members sell products like cosmetics, sheets, woven bedspreads, vegetables, food, and salteñas (a type of empanada, or stuffed, savory pastry). They also have business activities like sewing articles of clothing, carpentry, and public transportation. As in any area of business, there is always competition, but the members know how to come out ahead by diversifying their products and adapting them to the demands of the market. The loan will go toward the acquisition of raw materials, supplies, and materials such as work tools and merchandise that will help improve their income, increasing their sales and helping improve their families' quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel McRoberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Esperanza Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Esperanza del Socorro L. se dedica a laborar arduamente por medio de la venta de bebidas como jugos y gaseosas y también en la venta de electrodomésticos como lo son televisores, abanicos, licuadoras, refrigeradores, entre otros.

El crédito lo solicitó para la compra de las bebidas y para la compra de los electrodomésticos y es por este motivo que ella esta confiando en que el crédito será aprobado y así mejorará las condiciones de su negocio en su localidad en el departamento de León.
texts.en:
Sra. Esperanza del Socorro L. dedicates herself to working hard through the sale of beverages, such as juices and sodas. She also sells electrical appliances such as televisions, fans, blenders, refrigerators and other items.

She is requesting a loan to purchase beverages and appliances. Sra. Esperanza is confident that her loan will be approved and will help improve her business, which is located in the district of León.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase electrical appliances & beverages

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es: El señor Juan Pablo A. O. , tiene la edad de 44 años , habita en el barrio los ríos , ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa la cual trabaja como comerciante para apoyarlo con los gastos del hogar , ellos tienen 9 hijos , cinco de ellos ya son independiente y cuatro tienen a su cargo y le apoyan en las actividades agrícolas , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , don Juan desde hace 20 años trabaja como agricultor , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta son las plagas que afectan al cultivo , el inicio está actividad con el apoyo de la reforma agraria y  con los préstamo se ha ayudado para salir a delante con la producción son nueve ciclo los que va trabajando con Afodenic y con este  préstamo va comprar fertilizantes e insumos para mejorar el cultivo.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan Pablo A. O. is 44 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Los Ríos, which is located in the town of Ticuantepe. Together with his wife, he works as a trader in order to earn money to pay for their household expenses. They have 9 children, 5 of whom are independent while the other 4 remain under their care. He plans to improve his family’s living conditions.

Don Juan has been farming for 20 years. His greatest challenge is getting rid of pests that plague his crops. He started his farm as a result of land reform and he feels that his loans have helped him move his production forward. He is on his 9th loan cycle with AFODENIC and will use the funds to buy fertilizers and supplies to improve his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers & farming supplies

loans.name: Juventud Group

texts.es: Los miembros del grupo “Juventud” esta representado por la señora Zulma M. y conformado por 12 miembros una mayoría D. los socios se dedican al transporte público D. pasajeros, a la chaparía D. vehículos a la soldadura con arco y oxigeno, entre las mujeres se dedican a la venta D. comida, pollo, masitas, ropa, salteñas y a la atención en cafés Internet. La competencia en el ámbito laboral es elevada ya que muchos D. los negocios bajan sus ventas debido al invierno ya que la mayoría D. las socias posee carritos D. venta D. comida, pero saben como salir adelante con esfuerzo y esperando que las ventas mejoren con el retorno D. la primavera. El destino del financiamiento es para la reparación D. sus vehículos así como para la compra D. repuestos y herramientas nuevas para sus negocios D. chaparía y soldadura; en cuanto a las socias el crédito esta destinado a la adquisición D. mercaderías, insumos y materiales para incrementar sus ventas y mejorar sus ingresos que son el sustento D. sus familias. Su experiencia crediticia es muy buena ya que algunos D. los miembros participaron en grupos anteriores y cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidaR..
texts.en:
The members of the group “Juventud” (Youth) is led by Sra. Zulma M.. There are a total of 12 members, some of whom are involved in business activities such as public transportation, auto body repair, and welding. The women primarily engage in retail businesses selling food, chickens, pastries, clothing, empanadas, etc. Some members also manage Internet cafés. Competition in the marketplace is fierce and business is down because of the winter season. This is especially true for the members who operate food carts, but they know that they can get ahead through hard work, and eventually sales will improve in the spring.

Some of the members will use their funding to repair vehicles, purchase spare parts, acquire new tools for their businesses, and purchase welding equipment. Other members will invest their loan in goods, supplies, and material that will help them improve their sales and support their families. They have had good experiences with credit since some of the members have participated with other groups and have worked with solidarity loans.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Isidra De Jesús

texts.es:
La señora Isidra R. labora en el departamento de León en su negocio de venta de frutas las que son comercializadas por ella misma con el propósito de mejorar su condición económica en su negocio que tiene en buen dirigir.

Ella ha logrado brindar las condiciones necesarias a su familia para su desarrollo y hoy en día una vez mas ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de las frutas como lo son los bananos para ofrecerlos en su establecimiento y satisfacer a sus clientes que a diario le visitan.
texts.en:
Sra. Isidra R. works in the district of León selling fruit. She hopes to manage her business well enough to improve her financial situation.

She has been able to provide for her family’s basic necessities. Sra. Isidra has come to CEPRODEL once again to request a loan so that she can purchase fruits, such as bananas, so that she can offer them at her vending location and satisfy her customers who pass by every day.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruit

loans.name: Ofelia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ofelia L. es una dama que labora en el departamento de León por medio de la venta de ropa que ella posee en su propio establecimiento ofreciendo todo tipo de ropa tanto para damas, caballeros y niños.

Se ha destacado por ser una excelente comerciante vendiendo la mercadería a los clientes y hoy en día atraviesa la necesidad de invertir en la compra de mayores cantidades de ropa y por ello ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito y así adquirir de sus proveedores la ropa para su comercialización.
texts.en:
Ofelia L. works in the district of León selling clothing from her own establishment. She offers all types of clothes for women, men and children.

It should be pointed out that Ofelia is an excellent businesswoman when it comes to selling her products to her clients. Today she has come to CEPRODEL to request a loan to acquire more clothing for resale from her suppliers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: Las Rositas Group

texts.es: El grupo “las Rositas” esta representada por la señora Maria Lourdes y conformada para 13 socios D. los cuales 4 son varones. Los miembros del grupo se dedican a diferentes actividades como ser la ventad D. empanadas, abarrotes, lácteos, fiambres, comida y entre los varones se dedican a actividades como al servicio D. transporte público y a la carpintería. En cuanto a la competencia los socios se organizan D. modo que no les afecta ya que van acorD. a las necesidades y exigencias del mercado. El crédito otorgado tiene como destino aumentar el capital D. trabajo para el crecimiento D. sus negocios, teniendo en lo futuro mayores ventas e ingresos para ellos. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia el grupo va cursando su segundo ciclo demostrando ganas D. trabajar y puntualidad en los pagos, por lo cual requieren nuevamente del apoyo económico brindado para mejorar aun mas sus ventas y por enD. mejorar los ingresos que son el sustento D. sus familias y sus ganas D. luchar día a día en el mercado competitivo.
texts.en:
The group “Las Rositas” is led by Sra. Maria Lourdes and is comprised of 13 members (9 women and 4 men). Most of the members are engaged in different retail businesses selling empanadas, groceries, dairy products, cold cuts, and prepared foods. The men are involved in business activities such as public transportation and carpentry. The members are not concerned about the competition because they go about focusing on meeting the needs and demands of their customers.

Their loans will increase their operating capital so that they can grow their businesses, increase their future sales, and earn better incomes. The group started its second loan cycle and the members fulfilled the necessary requirements to receive additional financial support by demonstrating their ability to work and make their payments on schedule. With their increased earnings, they will be able to maintain their households and keep fighting every day in the competitive marketplace.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Johana Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Johana C. López , tiene la edad de 32 años , habita en el barrio San Ignacio , junto a su esposo el cual trabaja y le apoya con los gastos del hogar , ellos tienen dos hijos actualmente estudiantes , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , desde hace 11 años se dedica a la agricultura , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento , ella inicio esta actividad con el apoyo de sus padres , los planes hacia un futuro hacia su cultivo es diversificarlo . Con el préstamo va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos lo cual espera poder tener una buena producción y vender a mejor precio en el mercado.
texts.en:
Sra. Johana C. López is 32 years old and lives in the neighborhood of San Ignacio. She works with her husband and helps him with the household expenses. They have two school-aged children. Sra. Johana has plans to improve her family’s living conditions.

In her 11 years of farming, her greatest challenge has always been a lack of financial capital. She started her business with the support of her parents and hopes to diversify her crops in the future. Sra. Johana is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and supplies in hopes of having a good harvest and selling her crops at the market for a better price.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers to improve production

loans.name: Simona Esperanza

texts.es:
En el departamento de León, en Nicaragua la señora Simona M. desde hace 20 años se ha dedicado a trabajar en la venta de cosméticos siendo comercializados por ella misma en su establecimiento y ofreciendo todo tipo de cosméticos como shampoo, fragancias, perfumes, pinturas de uña, aretes, entre otros. 

Todos estos productos son requeridos  comprarlos para ofertarlos en su negocio y por ello ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar dicho crédito y así continuar mejorando su situación económica y llevando el sustento a su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
In district of León in Nicaragua, Sra. Simona M. has been selling cosmetics for 20 years. She offers all types of beauty care products from her vending location such as shampoos, perfumes, nail polishes, etc. She also sells earrings and other costume jewelry.

Today Sra. Simona has come to CEPRODEL to request a loan to purchase the required products needed to restock her business. This will help her continue improving her financial situation and maintain her household.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Belcka Marilyn

texts.es:
La señora Belcka Marilyn, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Brisas”, Distrito de Bellavista, Provincia de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 27 años y es madre de 01 y uno que ya viene en camino y dependen de ella.  

Ante la necesidad de aportar al ingreso económico del hogar, motivada por su esposo emprendió su  negocio de crianza y venta de ganados vacuno y porcino que los ofrece a sus clientes,  con  el carisma y la buena atención que le caracteriza. 

El corral especialmente construido para la crianza de los ganados se encuentra en la huerta de su propia casa, a donde acuden sus principales clientes que son los “carniceros” que tienen sus puestos de venta de carnes en el mercado de la ciudad. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará 03 ganados vacuno para criarlos y luego venderlos.

Hoy se siente muy feliz del  servicio que brinda y agradece a Manuela Ramos, por apoyar a mujeres como ella que quieren trabajar y salir adelante, espera que sigan así por mucho tiempo y ayuden a muchas mujeres emprendedoras.
texts.en:
Sra. Belcka Marilyn is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Brisas” (The Breezes), which is located in the District of Bellavista, Bellavista Province, Department of San Martín. She is 27 years old, married, and the mother of one dependent child.

Given the need to contribute to the household income, Sra. Belcka was encouraged by her husband to start a business raising and selling cattle and pigs. Her customers know her for her charisma and attentiveness.

She constructed a corral specifically for raising cattle in the field outside of her home. Her main customers are butchers who have their own meat vending stalls at the city market. With her loan of 1000 soles, she will buy 3 heads of beef cattle that she will raise for future sale.

Sra. Belcka is happy with the service offered by Manuela Ramos. She is thankful that the institution supports women like her who want to work and get ahead. She hopes to continue her membership for a long time so that she can help other women entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 3 heads of cattle

loans.name: María Luisa

texts.es:
La elaboración de tortillas es una actividad muy común en Nicaragua siendo llevada a cabo en su mayoría por mujeres muy esforzadas que buscan la manera de obtener los ingresos económicos para sustentar su hogar.

La señora María Luisa M. elabora tortillas en el departamento de León teniendo su establecimiento que es visitado por los clientes para la compra de dichas tortillas. Ella se ha destacado por ser una excelente trabajadora y por elaborar deliciosas tortillas. 
Hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de la materia prima como es el maíz y la leña y de esta manera continuar en la elaboración de las deliciosas tortillas elaboradas por las manos de la señora María Luisa.
texts.en:
Making tortillas is a common everyday activity in Nicaragua that many women pursue in order to generate income to maintain their households.

Sra. María Luisa M. prepares tortillas from her food stand in the district of León. She has distinguished herself as a hard worker and through her reputation for making delicious tortillas. Today she has come to CEPRODEL to request a loan to purchase ingredients, such as corn, and firewood so that she can continue producing her tasty handmade tortillas.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients and firewood for making tortillas

loans.name: Hector Jose

texts.es: El señor Héctor José G., tiene la edad de 51 años, habita en el barrio la Borgoña , junto a su esposa la cual trabaja como domestica en una casa privada , para apoyarlo con los gastos del hogar , ellos tiene un hijo el cual le apoya con los trabajos agrícolas , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , don Héctor desde hace 18 años se dedica a la agricultura la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento , el inicio esta actividad con el apoyo de sus padres . Con el préstamo va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos y poder lograr una buena producción, da las gracias ala institución por los préstamo obtenido que gracia a ellos ha podido obtener mejores resultado en sus siembra.
texts.en:
Sr. Héctor José G. is 51 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Borgoña. His wife works as a maid in the home of a private client. Don Héctor and his son work on the family farm in order to provide for the household expenses, with plans to improve their living conditions.

He has 18 years of experience in agriculture. His greatest difficulty has been a lack of funding. Don Héctor started farming with the help of his parents. He will use his loan to purchase fertilizers and supplies to achieve a good harvest. He thanks the institution for helping him gain better results from his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers to improve production

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Carmen, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Brisas”, Distrito D. Bellavista, Provincia Bellavista, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 44 años y es madre D. 03 hijo, 01 que esta estudiando y depenD. D. ella. 

Carmencita, una mujer trabajadora y luchadora decidió vender comida, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, ubicado en un puesto que tiene al frente D. un Hospital D. su Distrito, ella nos cuenta que a diario tiene muy buenas ventas, es conocida por la sazón rica que le da a sus preparados y sus principales clientes son los mismos trabajadores D. este centro D. salud y moradores.

Esta muy contenta con el trabajo que realiza día a día. Es ella quien personalmente atienD. a sus clientes con el carisma que le caracteriza.

Con este préstamo D. S/ 3,000.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria D. sus alimentos como arroz en kilos, azúcar; aceites en galones, sacos D. papa, pollos en javas, verduras y también  algunos utensilios  para implementar su negocio y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Se siente llena D. vida y con ganas D. seguir adelante aun, tiene muchos sueños y metas en su vida. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  en iniciar su negocio.
texts.en:
Carmen belongs to the Las Brisas Community Bank, which is in the Bellavista district, Bellavista province, San Martín department. She is 44, married, and has three children. One child goes to school and is still dependent upon her. Carmencita is a hardworking woman and a fighter. She decided to sell food in a well set up place, which is located in front of a hospital in her district. She has good daily sales. She is known for the good seasoning she gives her food. Her primary customers are the people who work in the health center and neighbors. She is very happy with the work that she does day to day. She personally waits on her customers with her characteristic charisma. With this loan for 3,000 PEN she will buy supplies for daily food preparation like kilos of rice and sugar, gallons of oil, sacks of potatoes, cases of chicken, vegetables, and some utensils. These items are to use in her business and to give better attention to her customers. She feels full of life and has the desire to get ahead. She has lots of dreams and goals in her life. She is grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for contributing to the start up of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for food preparation

loans.name: Euloly

texts.es:
La señora Euloly, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Brisas”, Distrito Bellavista, Provincia Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 43 años, 03 hijos, 01 que aun estudia y depende de ella.

Euloly, una mujer que se siente capaz de cumplir sus metas, por lo que decidió implementar su propio negocio  de venta de abarrotes con el apoyo de su pareja. Nos cuenta que se inicio con la venta de  panes, poco a poco fue ahorrando y juntando su propio capital y con el prestamo de Manuela Ramos implemento mucho mas su negocio, ubicada en su misma casa, hoy ya tiene mucha experiencia en este tipo de actividad, es muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes.  

En la actualidad tiene una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acude a su tienda a comprar donde cuenta con todo lo necesario que el ama de casa necesita y es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,500.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, utensilios de aseo para el hogar y de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Euloly, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de seguir adelante y hacer realidad sus sueños. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ayudarla en iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarial.
texts.en:
Sra. Euloly is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Brisas”, which is located in the Bellavista district, Bellavista Province, San Martín state. She is married, 43 years old, and has three children, one of them who is still studying and depends on her.

Euloly is a woman who feels she is capable of achieving her goals. She decided to establish her own business of selling groceries with the support of her partner. She says that she started selling bread and gradually started saving money. This capital, in addition to a loan from Manuela Ramos, helped her improve a lot her business, which is located in her own house. Nowadays, she has already a lot of experience in this activity and is very well known and appreciated among her clients.

Currently, she has loyal customers who go to her shop daily, where they can find all the products a housewife might need. She personally serves her clients with her characteristic charisma.

With this loan of 1,500 new soles she will buy sacks of rice and sugar, packets of noodles, boxes of milk and canned fish of various brands, household utensils and hygiene products so that she can continue to provide her customers a better service.

These days, Euloly feels very achieved and more willing to keep working to make her dreams come true. She thanks Manuela Ramos for helping her to start her business and for helping many other women who also want to rise as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Giovanna Fernandes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise to increase stock

loans.name: Rafaela

texts.es: La señora Rafaela M. C. , tiene la edad de 30 años , habita en el barrio Los ríos , ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposo , él cual le apoya con los gastos del hogar , ellos tienen dos hijos , actualmente estudiantes , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , desde hace 16 años trabaja como agricultora , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento , ella inicio esta actividad con el apoyo de su papá , los planes hacia un futuro con su cultivo es diversificarlo . Con el préstamo va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para poder tener mejores resultados. Da las gracias a la institución por el préstamo otorgado ya que atrvez de ello logra mejores beneficios para su siembra.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rafaela M. C. is 30 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Los Ríos, located in the town of Ticuantepe. She lives with her husband, who helps her with the house expenses. They have two children, who are students. She plans to improve the life conditions of her family.

She works as a farmer for 16 years and the biggest challenge she faces is the lack of funding. She started this activity with the support of her dad and she plans to diversify her crops in the future.

With this loan she will buy fertilizers and materials to obtain better results. She thanks the institution for the loan she received since through it she will attain greater benefits to her planting.


Translated from Spanish by Giovanna Fernandes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers to apply to plantation

loans.name: Exilda

texts.es:
La señora Exilda, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Optimistas II”, Distrito de San Hilarión, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 50 años y 04 hijos, todos ellos ya independientes.

Su carácter y su anhelo de cumplir sus sueños, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes con cuyas ganancias aportaría al ingreso económico en su hogar, desde su  inicio a la fecha ha ido ganando clientes. Hoy en día cuenta con clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su bodega a comprar porque en ella  tiene todo los productos  que el ama de casa necesita y es quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos; galletas, fideos y sales en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Exilda, se siente con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando y muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Mrs. Exilda is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Optimistas II”, San Hilarión district, San Martín province, San Martín state. She lives in a common law marriage and is 50 years old. She has 4 children, all of them independent.

Her character and her urge to achieve her dreams motivated her to start her own business of selling groceries, from which she would bring income to her house. Since the start until today she has been gaining customers. Nowadays she has regular clients who daily go to her store, since she has all the products a housewife might need. She personally serves her customers, with her characteristic charisma.

With this loan of 500 new soles she will buy sacks of rice and sugar, packets of cookies, noodles and salt, boxes of milk and canned fish of a variety of brands, eggs and personal hygiene products in order to continue providing a better service to her clients.

Exilda is eager to continue working and is very grateful to the “Movimiento Manuela Ramos” for helping women like her have opportunities to succeed within their environment.


Translated from Spanish by Giovanna Fernandes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more merchandise to increase stock

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
el Sr. Francisco A. I. tiene 59 años de edad, es casado y tiene 2 hijos de los cuales 1 esta estudiando.
el se dedica a la compra y venta de pan blanco, dulce y galletas de todo tipo, tiene 14 años de dedicarse a este tipo de negocio, el esta ubicado en el barrio Moranzan de la ciudad de Nacaome, el ahora tiene su propio carro y se traslada a diferentes caserios y colonias cercanas de donde el vive.
en estos ultimos meses ha tenido una demanda muy grande con el producto que vende y desea comprar mas pan para poder tener mejores ventas ya que el pan solo se compra en la mañana por ser fresco.
su mayor sueño es tener una fabrica de produccion de pan.
el necesita el credito para comprar mas pan todos los dias.
texts.en:
Mr. Francisco A. I. is 59 years old, married, and has two children (one of which is in school). He buys and sells white bread, sweet breads, and cookies of all kinds. He has been doing this for 14 years. He lives in Moranzan, a neighborhood in the city Nacaome. He now has his own cart and goes to different farmhouses and neighborhoods in his area. In the past few months, he has had great demand for his products, and wishes to buy more bread, so that he can improve his sales -- he only buys bread in the morning, so that it will be fresh. His biggest dream is to have a bread factory. He needs the loan so that he can buy more bread every day.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying more white bread and sweet bread, and cookies.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Loydith

texts.es:
Loydith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Brisas”, Distrito de Bellavista, Provincia de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 59 años y es madre de 03 hijos, todos ya independientes.

Con la seguridad de tener una buena sazón para la preparación de diferentes tipos de bocaditos, por iniciativa propia con  su primer crédito de S/. 300.00 emprendió su negocio de venta de bocaditos,(dulcen pequeños propios de la región) ubicada en su misma casa, su principal herramienta es un horno, donde los asa. Trabaja con pedidos anticipados, para fiestas y cenas especiales, prepara buffets para matrimonios y cumpleaños.

En la actualidad, pese al tiempo transcurrido continúa con el mismo negocio, contando con una clientela ya fidelizada que acuden a su casa, donde ella los atiende con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como harinas de yuca, maíz y trigo, huevos en javas y cajas de leche y también  algunos utensilios  para implementar su negocio y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Esta preparada para todo y aun se siente con muchas fuerzas para continuar trabajando y seguir adelante, Loydith, agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Loydith belongs to Las Brisas Communal Bank in Bellavista, a district of the province Bellevista, in the department of San Martín. She is married, 59 years old, and the mother of 3 children, all of whom are grown. With a talent for cooking of different kinds of snacks, Loydith used her first loan of S/. 300.00 to, on her own initiative, launch her business selling "bocaditas" (small sweets from the region) out of her house. Her main tool is her oven, where she bakes her "bocaditos". She takes orders for parties and special dinners, and prepares buffets for weddings and birthdays. Now, despite the time that has passed, she continues to run her business, and has a faithful customer base that come to her house, where she serves them with her characteristic charisma. With this loan of S/ 1,000.00, she will buy ingredients such as flour (yuca, corn, and wheat), eggs, and cartons of milk -- as well as some tools to implement her business and better serve her customers -- for the daily making of her foods. She is ready for everything and still feels the strength to continue working and get ahead. Loydith is grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for contributing to the fulfillment of her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying ingredients and tools for the daily preparation of her food products.

loans.name: Elias

texts.es:
el sr. Elias S. tiene 69 años de edad, es casado, tiene 2 hijos de los cuales ninguno esta con el ya que formaron su propio hogar. el se dedica a la venta de productos de la canasta basica en su pulperia desde hace 23 años; Elias a luchado por mantener este negocio a traves de su buena administracion y su buena manera de tratar los clientes.
uno de sus mayores anhelos es tener un supermercado y vender toda clase de productos para que las personas del municipio de Langue no tengan que trasladarse a Nacaome a comprar algunos productos que no se encuentran en dicha comunidad.
necesita el credito para abastecerse mas de porductos y comprar productos nuevos para las exigencias de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Elias S. is 69 years old, married, and the father of two children, neither of whom are with him since they have made their own homes. He has been selling basic foods in his local store for 23 years; Elias has succeeded in maintaining this business through his good management and way of dealing with customers. One of his greatest longings is to have a supermarket and sell all types of products, so the people in the Langue are do not have to travel to Nacaome to buy products that they cannot find in their community. He needs the loan to stock up on more products and buy new products to meet his customers needs.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sugar, coffee, bread, beans, rice, milk, meat, soda, juice, corn flour, toilet paper, flour, soaps, margarine, butter, and oil.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
La señora Nilda, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Optimistas II”, Distrito de San Hilarión, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Separada, tiene 57 años y 08 hijos, que ya son independientes y son su gran orgullo.

Nilda, es una mujer que ha podido superar muchas dificultades en su camino de vida, ya que la separación que tuvo con su esposo, le afecto bastante moralmente. Ahora se encuentra mas superada y con ganas de salir adelante sola, con sus propios medios. Se inicio vendiendo cosméticos de la línea Unique que le dieron y le siguen dando muy buenos resultados y hoy en día con el negocio que maneja se siente muy contenta por lo logrado.

Con este préstamo de S/ 500.00, comprará productos de belleza para su stock como, perfumes para damas y caballeros, cremas, polvos compactos, lápices labiales, esmaltes de uñas,  asimismo invertirá comprando una vitrina para exhibir  sus productos.

Nilda, con su madurez es un ejemplo a seguir de muchas mujeres que se inician en un negocio y con perseverancia logran alcanzar sus sueños. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciar su propio negocio y a otras mujeres a crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Nilda belongs to Mujeres Optimistas II Communal Bank, in San Hilarión, a district of the province San Martín, in the department San Martín. She no longer lives with a husband, is 57 years old, and the mother of 8 children -- all now grown -- who are her great pride. Nilda is woman who has survived great difficulties on her walk through life. She had to separate from her husband, which had a significant affect on her. Now she finds herself in a better position and wishing to go on alone and get ahead with her own means. She started selling cosmetics from the company Unique gave her, and has been met with good results. Now with the business she manages, she feels very happy because of her success. With this loan of S/ 500.00, she will buy beauty products such as perfume and cologne, creams, powder, lipstick, and nail polish, for her stock, as well as display case to display her products. Nilda, with her maturity, follows the example of many women who have started businesses and who have, with persistence, succeeded in reaching their dreams. She is very grateful for Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her to start her own business and other women to grow as businesswomen.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Beauty products for her stock

loans.name: Nirian

texts.es:
La señora Nirian, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Optimistas”, Distrito de San Hilarión, Provincia de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 47 años y 06 hijos, 02 que aun estudian y dependen de ella. 

Deseando ver profesional a sus hijos y tener sus propios ingresos para poder lograrlo, decidió emprender su propio negocio. Nos cuenta que en su vida paso por altas y bajas, su carácter emprendedor que siempre la caracterizo, le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de comidas prepararas. Nirian, vende sus comidas en la carretera marginal, en un local acondicionado para atender a sus clientes. Poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes que son choferes, pasajeros, alumnos y por su buena sazón sus ventas le van muy bien,  los vende en las mañanas y en las tardes.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,200.00, comprará insumos para sus preparados como: sacos de arroz y azúcar, pollos y huevos en javas, plátanos en racimos, fideos y aceites en docenas, asimismo utensilios de cocina para brindar un servicio de calidad.  

Nirian, se siente con muchas fuerzas todavía para seguir con sus ventas de comidas, posteriormente desea implementar mas su negocio con un Restaurant bien acondicionado para brindar a sus clientes un mejor servicio y atención. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Nirian belongs to the Mujeres Optimistas Community Bank in the San Hilarión district, Bellavista province, San Martín department. She is 47, single, and has six children. Two of her children still go to school and are dependent upon her. Wanting to see her children become professionals with their own incomes, she decided to start her own business to make that happen. She has passed through highs and lows in her life. Her entrepreneurial character, which has always characterized her, served her to start her own business of selling prepared food. Nirian sells food in the Carretera Marginal in a spot well suited to waiting on her customers. Little by little she has become well known among her customers, who are drivers, passengers, and students, for her good seasonings. Her sales are going very well. She sells in the mornings and afternoons. With this loan for 1,200 PEN she will buy supplies for her prepared food like sacks of rice and sugar, crates of chickens and eggs, bunches of bananas, noodles, and oils by the dozen. She will also buy kitchen utensils to offer quality service. Nirian feels she has lots of strength to continue with her food sales. Later, she would like to further set up her business with a well equipped restaurant to offer her customers better service and attention. She is grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for contributing to the fulfillment of her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies to prepare her food

loans.name: Eduardo Antonio

texts.es: El señor Eduardo Rodríguez tiene 27 años de edad comarca Carlos Fonseca del municipio de Villa del Carmen, departamento de Managua, casado, viven en casa propia, dentro de sus planes esta la construcción de su vivienda para brindarle seguridad y protección su familia. Se desempeña en la Alcaldía de Villa del Carmen en el cargo de guardia de seguridad desde hace seis meses, ha encontrado dificultades en lo que es la culminación de un anexo en su propiedad. Gracias al préstamo en Afodenic lograra comprar materiales de construcción como: cemento, hierro, bloque, piso y otros. Ofreciéndole mayor comodidad.
texts.en:
Sr. Eduardo Rodríguez is 27 years old and lives in the Carlos Fonseca region of the town of Villa del Carmen, District of Managua. He is married and lives in his own home. He and his wife plan to undertake a home project that will provide security and protection for their family. Sr. Eduardo has been working for the town of Villa del Carmen as a security guard for the past six months.

He has had difficulty completing the extension to his house. Thanks to the loan from AFODENIC, he will be able to buy construction materials such as cement, iron, blocks, flooring, and other supplies. This will provide his family more comfortable conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to finish an extension to his house

loans.name: Paquita

texts.es:
La señora Paquita, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Brisas”, Distrito D. Bellavista, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Viuda, tiene 69 años y es madre D. 05 hijos, que ya son independientes. 

Motivada por su experiencia en la crianza D. gallinas se amino a convertir esto en un negocio, en inicio en muy pequeña escala invirtió los  S/. 300.00 D. crédito que recibió, obteniendo muy buenos resultados por lo que continúa con este negocio hasta la actualidad, en su propia casa.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 2,000.00 comprará gallinas ponedoras D. huevos, vitaminas, alimento balanceados en sacos para mantener las aves sanas y gordas y puedan producir mejor. 

Hoy se siente muy feliz D. la labor y servicio que brinda y agradece a Manuela Ramos, por apoyar a personas como ella que quieren trabajar y salir adelante, espera que sigan así por mucho tiempo y ayuden a muchas familias y mujeres emprendedoras.
texts.en:
Sra. Paquita is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Brisas” (The Breezes), which is located in the District of Bellavista, Department of San Martín. She is 69 years old, widowed, and the mother of 5 adult children.

Motivated by her experience in raising chickens, she started a small-scale business with the loan of 300 soles that she received. Her home-based business continues to experience good results.

Her new loan of 2000 soles will be used to buy egg-laying hens, vitamins, and sacks of feed so that her birds become plump and healthy so that they can produce more eggs.

She is very happy to be working and receiving the services of Manuela Ramos. She thanks the Institution for supporting people like her who want to work and get ahead. Sra. Paquita hopes to continue her membership for a long time and help other families and women entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase egg-laying hens, vitamins, and feed

loans.name: Ramona

texts.es:
La señora Ramona, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Brisas”, Distrito Bellavista, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 44 años y 03 hijas, 01 que aun dependen de ella.

Ramona, es una mujer con ganas de seguir adelante, se considera una mujer luchadora y eficiente.
Lleva 06 años dedicándose a la venta de dulces como: Mazamorras de maíz morado, arroz con leche, flanes, como vio que le genera buenos ingresos decidió implementarse mas en el negocio, sus ventas los realiza a partir de las 9:30 am. y sale por las calles a ofrecer sus productos, nos cuenta que le va muy bien y tiene buena acogida, por el rico sabor de sus dulces.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, comprará insumos para preparar sus dulces  como: Maíz morado, arroz y azúcar en kilos, manzanas y piñas, canela molida y otros ingredientes, para dar un rico sabor, en cuestión de utensilios comprará vasos y cucharitas de plástico.
 
Ramona, se siente una mujer tranquila y contenta con lo logrado. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a cumplir sueños y metas, así como a otras   mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Sra. Ramona is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Brisas” (The Breezes), which is located in the District of Bellavista, Department of San Martín. She is 44 years old, married, and has 3 children, of whom one is still dependent. Ramona is a woman who wants to get ahead. She is considered to be strong-willed and efficient.

For six years, she has been selling desserts such as mazamorra (porridge) made of purple corn, rice pudding, and custard. She started generating good revenues, so she decided to invest more into her business. Ramona starts selling her products on the street at 9:30am. She says her business is doing well and that her products are well-received because their rich flavor.

With her loan of 2000 soles, she will buy supplies to prepare her desserts such as purple corn, rice, kilos of sugar, apples, pineapples, ground cinnamon, and other ingredients that give her creations their rich flavor. She will also purchase utensils, such as plastic cups and spoons.

Ramona is content with her success. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for helping her fulfill her dreams and goals, as well as helping other women improve their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients & supplies for making desserts

loans.name: Silvia Isidora

texts.es:
La señora Silvia Isidora, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Optimistas II”, Distrito de San Hilarión, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 29 años y es madre de 02  hijos, 02 que aun dependen de ella.

Silvia Isidora, es una mujer alegre, perseverante y capaz de cumplir lo que se proponga, nos cuenta que poco a poco ha ido logrando algunas de sus metas y sueños que quería realizar,  en la actualidad se dedica a venta de colchas para dormir y le esta yendo muy bien ya que tiene clientes que la conocen y saben de su negocio.
La fortaleza y la perseverancia que le caracteriza, le ayudo a crecer como mujer independiente y esta muy orgullosa con lo logrado.

Con este préstamo de S/. 650.00, comprará  más productos para surtir su mercadería de colchas para la temporada de  frio.
Ella manifiesta que siente mucho orgullo por ella misma, por lo que logró y lo hizo con mucho entusiasmo y optimismo.

Dice: Agradezco la oportunidad que me da  Manuela Ramos  de  contar con los  préstamos que me ayudan a desarrollarme como mujer y pequeña empresaria.
texts.en:
Sra. Silvia Isidora is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Optimistas II” (Optimistic Women II), which is located in the District of San Hilarión, San Martín Province, Department of San Martín. She is 29 years old, in a common law marriage, and has 2 dependent children.

Silvia Isidora is cheerful and persistent woman who keeps her promises. She sells bedspreads. Although it has taken some time for her to achieve her goals, Silvia Isidora is doing very well at the moment because she has customers who know her and are aware of her business. Her strong will and persistence have helped her grow as an independent woman. She is very proud of her achievements.

Her loan of 650 soles will be used to buy more merchandise to add to her inventory of quilts and bedspreads for the cold weather season.

Silvia Isidora believes she has been able to achieve much because of her enthusiasm and optimism. She told us, “I appreciate the opportunity Manuela Ramos has given me through this loan because it has helped me grow as a woman and as a small entrepreneur.”

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise to increase inventory

loans.name: Yuvis

texts.es:
La señora Yuvis, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Optimistas II”, Distrito de San Hilarión, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 53 años y 06 hijos, 02 que aun dependen de ella.

Yuvis, es una mujer muy alegre y carismática, cualidad que le ayuda bastante en el negocio que maneja. Se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de diferentes líneas como: Unique, Oriflame y Avon. En la actualidad le están dando muy buenos resultados y hoy en día con el negocio que maneja se siente muy contenta. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 800.00, comprará productos de belleza para su stock como, perfumes para damas y caballeros, cremas, polvos compactos, lápices labiales, esmaltes de uñas,  asimismo una vitrina para exhibir  sus productos.

Yuvis, a su edad es un ejemplo a seguir de muchas mujeres que se inician en un negocio y con perseverancia logran alcanzar sus sueños. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciar su propio negocio y a otras mujeres a crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Sra. Yuvis is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Optimistas II” (Optimistic Women II), which is located in the District of San Hilarión, San Martín Province, Department of San Martín. She is 53 years old, single, and has 6 children (2 of whom are still dependents).

Yuvis is a cheerful and charismatic woman. These qualities help her in managing her business. She sells cosmetics from the following beauty lines: Unique, Oriflame, and Avon. She is experiencing very good results and is content with her business.

She will use her loan of 800 soles to purchase beauty products to add to her inventory such as women’s perfumes, men’s colognes, crèmes, compacts, lipsticks, nail polishes, as well as a display case for exhibiting her products.

Yuvis continues to be an example for other women who want to start their own business. She demonstrates that with perseverance, it is possible to achieve your dreams. She is very grateful to Manuela Ramos for helping her start her business and teaching other women how to develop as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products & a display case

loans.name: Maria  Magdalena

texts.es: La Señora Maria T. tiene la edad de 32 años, habitante de villa del carmen del departamento de Managua, casada su esposo le ayuda económicamente, tiene un hijo de siete años de edad, vive también con sus padres en casa propia, unos de sus planes que mas requiere cumplir es la construcción total de su vivienda, mujer emprendedora que desea lo mejor para su familia, trabaja en la Alcaldía de Villa del Carmen, en el cargo de concejal Propietaria, desde hace ocho meses. En el camino de cumplir sus planes se ha encontrado con diversas dificultades unas de ellas es la falta de financiamiento. Agradece a la Institución  por el préstamo que le otorgaron que le permitirá comprar una parte de materiales de construcción como: cemento, ventanas y zinc. Logrando un cambio a su vivienda y en su vida.
texts.en:
Maria T. is a 32-year-old married woman who lives in Villa del Carmen in the Managua area. Her husband helps her financially. She has a 7-year-old son and lives with her parents in her own house. The goal that she would most like to accomplish is to complete construction of her house. She is an entrepreneurial woman who wants the best for her family. She has worked for eight months as a proprietary town councilor in the mayor's office of Villa del Carmen. While trying to accomplish her goals, she has encountered various difficulties, one of which is the lack of financing. She thanks the Institution for the loan that they granted her, which will allow her to buy some of the construction materials, such as cement, wnidows and zinc, and thereby make a change in her home as well as her life.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials for improvements to her home

loans.name: Ursula Pahola

texts.es:
Ella es la socia Ursula, ella vive en la urb. Larapa en el distrito de San Jerónimo, a 35 minutos en colectivos.

Nuestra socia tiene 25 años de edad, ella es soltera y se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de prendas, para damas y caballeros, ella trae la mercadería desde la ciudad de Lima al por mayor y las vende aquí, de casa en casa, de institución  en institución, al igual que se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catálogos, la socia solicita el préstamo para hacer de ello un buen capital de trabajo y adquirir su mercadería para la venta futura.

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Ursula lives in Larapa in the district of San Jerónimo. She is 25, is single, and sells all sorts of clothing for both women and men. She brings her merchandise from the city of Lima wholesale and sells it here from house to house and business to business. She also sells cosmetics by catalog. She is requesting a loan to have working capital and to acquire more merchandise to sell in the future. She is thankful and values this loan that is being offered to her. She promises to make all of her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Carlos Rodolfo

texts.es:
El Sr. Carlos Rodolfo, es natural de la ciudad del Cusco, el vive en el barrio de San Cristóbal, ubicado a unos 10 minutos de la ciudad misma.

Nuestro socio tiene 45 años de edad, el es casado y tiene 2 hijos, nuestro socio es de profesión profesor en un colegió en la comunidad rural de Pucyura, nuestro socio viaja cada día a las 6 de la mañana y regresa a casa todas las tardes a las 4 p.m.; el socio solicita el préstamo para poder cubrir unas pequeñas deudas,  de este modo le es más fácil al socio pagar mensualmente al banquito comunal de a pocos y completar sus otras deudas.

El socio agradece y valora mucho el apoyo establecido así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de las cuotas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
Mr. Carlos Rudolfo is a native of the city of Cusco, and lives in the San Cristóbal neighborhood, just 10 minutes from the city. Our member is 45 years old, married and has 2 children. He is a professor in a high school in the rural community of Pucyura, and leaves every day at 6 a.m. and returns every afternoon at 4 p.m. . Mr. Rudolfo is applying for the loan to be able to cover a few small debts. In this way it would be easier for him to pay monthly to the community bank little by little and redeem his other debts. He very much appreciates and values the support that has been established in this way and commits to repaying the money in the established time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Payment of debts

loans.name: Oscar Carlos

texts.es:
Nuestro socio es el Sr. Oscar Carlos, el es natural de Cusco y vive en la calle pamtipata, el al igual que su esposa la Sr. Elvira, son socios del banco comunal choquequirao.

Nuestro socio es casado, y actualmente es jubilado, dedicándose al comercio minorista, el realiza todo tipo de trabajos, nuestro socio entró a formar parte del banco a insistencia de su esposa, desde entonces el ya es un miembro activo y participa de todas la s reuniones y actividades que se realizan dentro del banco, él normalmente realiza diferentes actividades en torno a l comercio minorista, enfocándose en el turismo, nuestro socio, requiere el préstamo para uso personal, generalmente el ve en cual de sus negocios invertir y lo hace, alternando en todos.

Nuestro socio agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago total de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our client Oscar is a native of Cusco, where he lives on Pamptipata Street with his wife Elvira. Oscar and his wife are members of the Choquequirao Community Bank. Oscar is retired, but he still spends a lot of time on business. He joined the community bank at his wife's insistence. Since then he has become an active member; he participates in all of the bank's meetings and activities. Oscar is involved in all kinds of business, but he usually focuses on tourism. This loan is for Oscar's personal use; once he sees a business that interests him, he will make an investment. Our client Oscar appreciates and values this loan; he has agreed to abide by the repayment terms and make all his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Gilda

texts.es:
La socia se llama Gilda, ella vive en el barrio de Kennedy, en el distrito de huanchac, está situado este barrio a 15 minutos de la plaza principal de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 51 años de edad, es soltera, no tiene hijos y trabaja aún en el instituto nacional de cultura, nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para uso personal, ella requiere un capital de trabajo para invertir en un pequeño negocio que tienen en mente hace ya mucho tiempo, ella aún no nos indica en que negocio, debido a que por sus creencias personales, ella desea guardar en secreto hasta que se cumpla su sueño.

Nuestra socia se muestra feliz y agradece el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago total de su deuda.
texts.en:
This member's name is Gilda and she lives in the Kennedy neighborhood of the Huanchac district of Cusco which is located 15 minutes from the city's main plaza. Gilda is 51 years old, is single, does not have children, and works at the National Cultural Institute. She is requesting a loan for personal use. She needs capital to invest in a small business that she has been thinking about starting for a long time now. She is not specifying what her business is yet, because due to her personal beliefs she would like to keep it a secret until her dream is realized. Gilda is happy and appreciates the loan being made to her in this way and she is committed to paying back the total of her debt.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Yuri

texts.en:
Yuri is 21 years old and is married with one child.  She works together with her mother selling cold drinks such as soda, beer and juices.  Yuri’s husband is an independent businessman.  

Yuri has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for a year and a half and is a member of the communal bank “Las Colinas” (The Hills).  She invested her very first loan of 300 soles in purchasing drinks for her business and will do the same with this loan of 1200 soles.

Yuri dedicates herself to her business full-time and is grateful to Manuela Ramos for showing confidence in her business by giving her loans.  Thanks to her loans, Yuri is moving forward with her business.  Yuri’s goals are to have her own business locale (a soda fountain, for example) and to study cosmetology.

loans.use: To buy more cold drinks for sale

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Natividad, ella vive en el barrio de collasuyo, en ucchullo grande, a unos 20 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene  53 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene  8 hijos (los dos últimos de 14 y 8 años), ella alterna sus diferentes actividades del hogar, con el comercio minorista, nuestra socia tiene un pequeño restaurante y ella misma cocina y se encarga de administrar todo, ella solicita el préstamo para poder invertir en mejorar su restaurante, para así poder llegara a mas personas.

Nuestra socia se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member is Ms. Natividad. She lives in the Collasuyo neighborhood in Ucchullo Grande which is about 20 minutes from the city of Cusco. Natividad is 53 years old, is a common-law wife and has 8 children (the youngest are 14 and 8 years old). She alternates between tending to different household activities, a retail business, and a small restaurant which she cooks for and runs herself. She is requesting this loan to be able to invest in improving her restaurant in order to then be able to serve more people. Natividad is committed to paying back her debt in the established term.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve her restaurant

loans.name: Norita

texts.en:
Norita is 49 years old and has six children. She is a single parent. Norita dedicates herself to selling “Unique” brand beauty products and shoes.

Norita has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for eight years and belongs to the communal bank “San Fernando II.” She invested her first loan of 300 soles (about $100) in beauty products and plans to invest this loan of 2,000 soles in buying, from the capital, Lima, more shoes to sell.

Norita has always been a hard-working woman; she has had to be strong in order to keep moving forward with her six children. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for her loans, especially now that her business has been growing. Norita’s goal is to someday own a restaurant because she enjoys cooking.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell

loans.name: Indira

texts.es:
La socia se llama Indira, ella es natural de la ciudad del Cusco, vive en el barrio de los andenes, en el distrito de huanchaq.

Nuestra socia es soltera y alterna sus diferentes actividades con su empleo, ella es ayudante de cocina en un restaurante, ella manifiesta que esta práctica le permite aprender mucho del trabajo en la cocina, ella aspira a ser cocinara de algún restaurante, por el momento ella solicita el préstamo para poder adquirir algunos electrodomésticos y así poder ir pagando poco a poco al banco comunal de su sueldo mensual.

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member is named Indira. She is a native of the city of Cusco and lives in the Los Andenes neighborhood in the Huanchaq district. Indira is single and balances various activities with her job. She is a kitchen assistant and aspires to being a chef of a restaurant. For the moment, she is resquesting a loan to be able to acquire some appliances and will be able to pay the communal bank little by little with her monthly salary. Indira appreciates and values the loan being granted her in the established term.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: personal use

loans.name: Elvira Emperatriz

texts.es:
La socia Elvira es natural del Cusco y vive en el barrio de pamtipata, en la letra 204.

Nuestra socia tiene 54 años de edad, es casada con el socio también, Oscar Carlos, ellos tienen 2 hijos y alternan sus diferentes actividades con el empleo que ella tienen en el instituto nacional de cultura en Cusco y a su ves la socia tiene un pequeño terreno el cual lo siembra  cada año con maíz, al cosechar ella vende parte de su cultivo y con otra se queda para hacer uso en su hogar. La socia requiere el préstamo para poder invertir como capital de trabajo en algunos proyectos con su esposo.

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member [of the community bank], Elvira, is a native of Cusco, and she lives in the Pamtipata neighborhood in number 204. Elvira is 54 years old and is married to another bank member, Oscar Carlos. They have 2 children and alternate the different activities that come with Elvira's job at the Instituto Nacional de Cultura in Cusco, and at the same time she has a small plot of land that she sows with corn each year. At the harvest, she sells part of her crop, and the rest remains for her household use. Elvira is requesting a loan to be able to invest it as working capital for a few projects along with her husband. This member is thankful for and recognizes the value of this loan, and she pledges to follow its repayments according to the outlined plan.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal Use

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 52-years old and married with three children. She is engaged in a variety of business ventures including selling Unique and Avon brand beauty products, selling cookware and sewing. Mary’s husband is a retired teacher.

Mary has been working with Kiva partner Manuel Ramos for three years and is a member of the communal bank “San Fernando II.” She used her first loan of 300 soles (about $100) to purchase fabric. She will use this loan of 1,000 soles to purchase fabric, specifically for making children’s undergarments.

Mary’s first business was sewing children’s clothing. She is now an entrepreneur involved in quite a variety of ventures. In addition to selling beauty products and sewing clothing, she also sews sheets and furniture covers. Mary’s goal is to conduct her own sewing workshop.

loans.use: To purchase fabric

loans.name: Jose Miguel

texts.es:
El socio Jose, reside en la ciudad del Cusco, el vive en el barrio de Larapa, situado a 30 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco

Nuestro socio tiene 36 años de edad, es casado  y tiene 1 hijo, nuestro socio  trabaja en la institución Micaela bastidas, el es docente de profesión, él requiere el préstamo para invertir en la compra de un electrodoméstico, de este modo el pagará al banco mensualmente parte de su sueldo.

Nuestro socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Jose is a resident of the city of Cusco. He lives in the neighborhood of Larapa, which is located 30 minutes from central Cusco. Jose is 36 years old, married, and has 1 child. He works at the Micael Bastidas Institute, where he is a teacher by profession.

He is requesting a loan so that he can purchase a household applicance. He will make monthly payments to his Communal Bank out of his salary. Jose appreciates that his loan was granted in a timely manner.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a household appliance

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is 53-years old and married with seven children. Julia has a small home-based restaurant. Her husband works in a timber business.

Julia has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for six years and is a member of the communal bank “San Fernando II.” She invested her first loan of 300 soles (about $100) in food for her restaurant and will do the same with this loan of 3,000 soles. Julia plans to purchase rice, noodles, sugar, oil and other basic necessities for preparing her meals.

For the entire time that she has been working with Manuela Ramos, Julia has been punctual with her loan payments. Her business has grown quite a bit. Now, not only does she sell meals out of her home, but she also prepares lunch for the staff of two nearby businesses: a bank and a petroleum company. Julia’s goal is to help her daughter through university.

loans.use: To purchase cooking supplies

loans.name: Sumacc Wari De Hornopampa Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Sumacc Wari D. Hornopampa se encuentra ubicado en Ccasupata, Distrito D. Yauli, en el Departamento D. Huancavelica.

Juliana es casada y tiene 06 hijos. Ella se dedica a la venta D. sus tejidos, conjuntamente con la venta D. quesos y huevos en la ciudad D. Huancavelica. Si bien al inicio un obstáculo fue tener capital para su negocio, gracias a los prestamos que obtiene a podido salir adelante. Juliana solicita un prestamos D. S/200 para poder comprar mas mercadería y recipientes para poder realizar sus ventas.

Juliana es socia del Bancomul Sumacc Wari D. Hornopampa. Es casada y tiene 06 hijos. Ella, tiene por negocio la venta D. artesanía (mantas o telares) que ella misma teje y borda. Juliana solicita un préstamo D. S/. 400,00 para la compra D. lana, la cual utilizara para realizar mas tejidos. Ella, se encuentra ahorrando para comprar sus maquinas industriales D. tejer. 

Simona es casada y tiene 07 hijos. Simona se dedica a la venta D. mantas, fajas, etc. que ella misma teje, las cuales ofrece en la feria. Simona, gracias al esfuerzo que mantiene en su trabajo ha podido enviar costear los estudios superiores D. sus hijos mayores. Ella requiere D. S/.200.00 para la compra D. lanas, materia prima y primordial en su negocio.
texts.en:
The Sumacc Wari D. Hornopampa Communal Bank is located in Ccasupata in the Yauli district of the Huancavelica region. Juliana is married and has 6 children. She sells fabrics as well as cheese and eggs in the city of Huancavelica. Although not having capital for her business was an obstacle at first, due to the loans she has obtained she has been able to move forward. Juliana requests a loan of 200 soles in order to be able to buy more merchandise and containers to use in her sales. Juliana is a member of the Sumacc Wari D. Hornopampa Communal Bank. Her business is selling handicrafts (blankets and fabrics) that she knits and embroiders herself. Juliana is asking for a loan of 400 soles to buy wool, which she will use for her knitting. She is saving in order to buy an industrial sewing machine. Simona is married and has 7 children. Simona sells blankets, belts, etc. that she knits herself, which she sells at fairs.
