Simona, thanks to the effort that she puts into her work, has been able to afford higher level studies for her older children. She requests 200 soles for the purchase of wool and other raw materials for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The Sumacc Wari de Hornopampa requests a loan of 3,400 soles so its 15 members can invest in their businesses.

loans.name: Erma Yrene

texts.en:
Erma is 42-years old and married with four children. Three of them are now independent. Erma dedicates herself to a variety of business ventures including selling drinks and cooked food from her home, and also selling clothes which she brings from the capital Lima. Erma’s husband works in the Army Intelligence Service.

Erma has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for six years and is a member of the communal bank “Las Dalinas II.” She used her first loan of 300 soles (about $100) for her food business. Erma plans to use this loan of 1,600 soles for two purposes. She will invest part of it in purchasing clothing for sale. She will use the remainder to buy a special cart for making “salchipapas” (hot dogs and french fries), which she will sell from the front porch of her home in the evenings.

Thanks to the help of loans from Manuela Ramos, Erma has not only been able to invest in her business ventures, but has also finished constructing her home. Erma’s goal is to someday have her own soda fountain.

loans.use: To purchase clothing and a special cart for making "salchipapas" (hot dogs and french fries)

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 36 años, vive en su casa propia con su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Hace más de un año y medio decidió dedicarse a la crianza de abejas para la producción de miel, para ello, arrendó un terreno donde instaló sus panales. Carmen se asesoró técnicamente para poder tener nuevos núcleos de panal y acrecentar su producción de miel, la cual consigue cada 3 meses y la coloca en recipientes de plástico para darle una mejor presentación a su producto. Sus clientes son personas que radican en otra ciudad, por ello, viaja periódicamente para abastecerles de mercadería, es así que logra conseguir las ganancias que le permiten sostener a su familia. Por el éxito en sus ventas, Carmen está planificando comprar más depósitos de panal para tener más miel disponible para su venta. Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, por lo que tiene muchas expectativas  de continuar trabajando para el progreso de su negocio. El dinero que está solicitando será invertido en la compra cajones de madera, envases de plástico y para mejorar la infraestructura de su casa donde pueda instalar su granja apícola.
texts.en:
Carmen is 36 years old and lives in a house of her own with her husband and their 2 children. More than a year and a half ago, she decided to start raising bees for honey production. To do this, she rented land where she set up honeycombs. Carmen consulted others on techniques in order to have new honeycomb groups and to increase her honey production, which she collects every 3 months and puts it in plastic containers in order to provide the best presentation for her product. Her clients are people that live in another city and that's why she travels periodically in order to supply them with merchandise. Thus, she makes income that allows her to provide for her family. Due to the success of her sales, Carmen is planning on buying more honeycomb deposits in order to have more honey available for sale. This is the second time that she has a loan with MFP, which is why she expects to continue working in order to grow her business. The money that she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of wooden crates and plastic containers and in the improvement of the infrastructure of her house where she can set up her bee farm.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase investment capital for her business

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es: Delfina tiene 55 años, vive con sus 4 hijos en la casa que heredó de sus padres. Hace más de 15 años se dedica a la venta de ropa tejida a lana y de materiales educativos hechos a mano por ella misma. Delfina es profesora en una escuela primaria y en sus tiempos libres y fines de semana desarrolla estas actividades. Sus clientes son sus propios colegas de trabajo, quienes le solicitan estos artículos educativos, los cuales ella elabora con mucha creatividad. Debido a la demanda y la rentabilidad de su negocio, Delfina desea incrementar su producción para obtener mayores ganancias. Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, por lo que se compromete a seguir realizando un trabajo responsable con las demás integrantes de su grupo y de velar por el bienestar común. El dinero que está solicitando le servirá para comprar grandes cantidades de lana, corrospun pegamento y otros materiales necesarios para elaborar sus prendas y artículos educativos.
texts.en:
Delfina is 55 years old, and lives with her four children in the house she inherited from her parents. For more than 15 years, she has been selling knitted wool clothing and educational materials that she makes by hand. Delfina is a teacher in an elementary school, and in her free time and on weekends she does these activities. Her customers are her own colleagues at school, who request these education articles, which she creatively makes.

Due to the demand and profitability of this business, Delfina wants to increase her production to earn a better income. This is the third time she has had a loan with MFP, and she is committed to continuing to be responsible with the other members of her group, and to ensure their common well-being. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy large quantities of wool, sheets of plastic, glue, and other materials she needs to create her clothing and educational articles.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rosario Del Pilar

texts.en:
Rosario is 29 years old and is married with two children.  She sells cold drinks, gelatin, flan and homemade popsicles out of her home.  Her husband owns a small hardware store.  Rosario and her family live in the city of Pucallpa.  

Rosario has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for two years and is a member of the communal bank “Las Triunfadoras” (The Winners).  She invested her very first loan of 300 soles (about $100) in selling fruits.  Rosario plans to invest part of this loan of 1800 soles in her home-based dessert business.  She will also invest part of it in purchasing fish for sale together with her father.  Rosario’s father buys fish in the small agricultural and fishing communities along the Ucayali, the wide brown river that flows past the city of Pucallpa and joins the Amazon to the north.  He then resells the fish in Pucallpa’s port.

Rosario’s loans from Manuela Ramos have enabled her to grow her business; she is now able to help her husband with household expenses.  Rosario has also used her loans to help him with his hardware business.  Rosario’s goal is to study pastry-making.  She would like to have her own little shop selling cakes, pies and other sweets.

loans.use: Cold drinks for sale; materials for making gelatin, flan and popsicles; river fish for sale

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: Elsa es una mujer emprendedora, tiene 48 años, vive con su  esposo y sus 3 hijos en la casa  heredada D. sus suegros. Hace 3 años decidieron, como familia, generar sus propios ingresos económicos D. manera independiente, es así que incursionan en el transporte D. pasajeros con el auto propio que adquirieron. Todos los días trabajan ofreciendo el servicio D. taxi, siendo su esposo el conductor y Elsa quien administra los ingresos y egresos del negocio. Adicionalmente, ha empezado a vender prendas D. vestir, las cuales ofrece a los pasajeros y a otros conductores D. taxi, D. esta manera esta pareja ha visto que sus ingresos han ido mejorando. Esto anima mucho a Elsa para continuar con sus planes a futuro D.  adquirir otra movilidad y ofrecer con mayor eficacia este servicio. Esta es la segunda oportunidad que tiene un préstamo con MFP, desD. que ingresó a su banco comunal no ha dejado D. ser responsable en los pagos, por lo que se ha ganado la admiración D. los demás integrantes D. su grupo, es por ello que nuevamente renueva su compromiso D. seguir siendo puntual. El dinero que está solicitando será invertido en la compra D. repuestos y el pago del mantenimiento D. su  herramienta básica D. trabajo, que es su auto.
texts.en:
Elsa is an entrepreneurial woman. She is 48 years old, and lives with her husband and 3 children in the house they inherited from her in-laws. Three years ago, they decided as a family to earn their own income independently. So, they began to transport passengers in the car that they bought. Every day they work, offering taxi services. Her husband is the driver and Elsa takes care of the income and expenses of the business.

In addition, she has started to sell clothing, which she offers to the passengers and to other taxi drivers. In this way, the couple has seen that their income is improving. This encourages Elsa to continue with her future plans to acquire another vehicle and offer their services more efficiently.

This is the second opportunity she has had to take out a loan with MFP. Ever since she joined her communal bank, she has not ceased to be responsible in her payments, and so she has earned the admiration of the other group members. That is why she has renewed her commitment to continue being punctual.

The money that is requested will be invested in buying spare parts and paying for maintenance on her basic tool for work, which is her car.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Car maintenance

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es: Liliana tiene 53 años, es casada y vive con el menor de sus hijos de 23 años en una casa arrendada. Desde hace más de 3 años se dedica a la venta de diferentes artículos, de acuerdo a la ocasión y época del año, pero preferentemente vende ropa para bebé. Liliana realiza largas caminatas en busca de nueva clientela, para ello, sale todas las mañanas y regresa a su casa por la tarde. De esta manera logra conseguir sus propios ingresos económicos que le sirven para cubrir los gastos de su hogar. Liliana está muy contenta por realizar esta actividad, pues le permite estar en plena comunicación con las demás personas de su entorno y para un futuro cercano desea seguir dedicándose al comercio pero establecida en local propio. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella ingresa a su banco comunal debido a la invitación de uno de los miembros, por lo que se compromete ser puntual en los pagos. El dinero que viene solicitando le servirá para la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería en prendas de vestir para todas las edades, para ello viajará a otra ciudad para abastecerse en grandes cantidades.
texts.en:
Liliana is 53 years old. She is married and lives with her youngest child, who is 23, in a leased house. For more than three years, she has been selling different items, depending on the occasion and time of year, but she prefers to sell baby clothing. Liliana goes on long hikes to find new customers, so she leaves her house every morning and comes back in the afternoon. In this way she has been able to earn her own income that allows her to cover her household expenses.

Liliana is happy to be doing this, because it allows her to communicate with the other people in her area, and in the near future she would like to continue selling but in an established store in her own area.

This is the first time that she has had a loan with MFP. She joined her communal bank because of an invitation from one of the members, so she is committed to being punctual with her payments. The money that she is requesting will be used to buy a larger quantity of clothing for all ages. She will travel to another city to stock up on large quantities.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Fidel Simon

texts.es: Don Fidel O. tiene 48 años de edad, casado tiene tres hijos, dos ya son independiente solo tiene a cargo una hija de 12 años, habita en la comarca la gallina en el municipio de Villa del Carmen del departamento de Managua, en casa propia. Los planes para con su familia es mejorar la vivienda y nivel de vida. Trabaja en la Alcaldía de Villa de Carmen desde hace seis meses, como guardia de seguridad, además tiene un terreno en donde esta cultivando. Requiere de financiamiento para realizar mejoras en su vivienda, en la parte de la Cocina comprar materiales de construccion como: cemento, bloque, reprisa otros materiales. Agradece a la Institución por brindarle la oportunidad de un Crédito, logrando cambio en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Don Fidel O. is 48 years old, married, and has three children. The two oldest children are financially independent; the one remaining in his care is his 12 year old daughter. His family lives in their own home in the area of La Gallina in the town of Villa del Carmen in the district of Managua. Don Fidel plans to make home improvements in order to improve the living standards for his family.

For the past six months, he has been working as a security guard. He also owns a plot of land that he cultivates. He is requesting a home improvement loan so that he can purchase materials to renovate a kitchen, such as cement, blocks, shelving and other materials. Don Fidel thanks the institution for the opportunity to access a loan so that he can make these changes to his home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to remodel a kitchen

loans.name: Lesther Rene

texts.es: El Señor Lesther Santamaría de 23 años de edad, habitante de la comarca California, Municipio de Villa del Carmen, departamento de Managua, esta casado, tiene un hijo viven en casa propia, se desempeña como ayudante del patrol desde hace seis meses, ha encontrado diversas dificultades para la construcción de su vivienda, ya que necesita un retoque en las paredes, piso y en la aria de la cocina. Don Lesther agradece a la Institución por el voto de confianza para con el préstamo el cual será utilizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, losetas, hierro, arena y piedrines. Con la finalidad de la linda, cómoda y segura vivienda.
texts.en:
Sr. Lesther Santamaría is 23 years old and a resident of the California region of the town of Villa del Carmen, District of Managua. He is married, has one child, and lives in his own home. He has been working as a patrol assistant for the past six months.

Sr. Lesther has encountered difficulties with the construction of his house. He needs to perform touch-ups on the walls, floors, and in the kitchen. He is grateful that the Institution has enough confidence to provide him with a loan. The funds will be used to buy construction materials such as cement, tiles, iron, sand and gravel. He hopes that these improvements will result in a home that is beautiful, comfortable, and safe.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to repair the walls, floors, and kitchen

loans.name: Melvin Arnulfo

texts.es: El señor Melvin Q. tiene la edad de 23 años, habitante de la comarca el Ceiba del municipio de villa del carmen, soltero, vive en casa propia con sus padres, trabaja en la Alcaldía de Villa del Carmen como técnico de catastro desde hace seis meses. Sus proyectos ofrecerle mayor comodidad y seguridad a su familia por medio de la construcción total de su vivienda y obtener un mejor trabajo con mayores prestaciones. Gracias al préstamo en Afodenic comprara materiales de construccion como: cemento, hierro, zinc, bloques para un anexo.
texts.en:
Sr. Melvin Q. is 23 years old and is a resident of the Ceiba District of the town of Villa del Carmen. He is single and lives in his own home with his parents. He is employed by the town of Villa del Carmen and has been working for six months as a technician in the land registry department.

He has undertaken home improvement projects in order to provide greater comfort and safety for his family. He would also like to secure a better job with more benefits. Thanks to his loan from AFODENIC, he will purchase materials such as cement, iron, zinc, and blocks to build an extension to his house.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to build an extension to his house

loans.name: Eddy Ivan

texts.es: El joven Eddy F. de 21 años de edad, habita en la comarca Chiquilistagua en casa propia con su madre, como planes tiene la construcción de su vivienda, así su familia tendrá seguridad. Trabaja  en la Alcaldía de Villa del Carmen en el Aria de Mantenimiento desde hace seis meses, ha encontrado dificultades para iniciar su proyecto, lo cual le da las gracias a la Institución por el préstamo. Comprara materiales de construcción como: cemento, hierro, azulejos, bloques y otros materiales. Permitiendo ser el comienzo de realizar su objetivo y brindarle poco a poco la protección infraestructural a su hogar.
texts.en:
Eddy F. is a young man who is 21 years of age. He lives with his mother in the Chiquilistagua region. He plans to build a home so that his family will feel more secure. He has been working for 6 months in the maintenance department for the town of Villa del Carmen.

He has encountered difficulty starting his construction project, which is why he is thankful to the Institution for this loan. Eddy will purchase materials such as cement, iron, tiles, block and other items. This will allow him to start his project so that he can slowly build up protection for his household.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to construct his house

loans.name: Ulises Antonio

texts.es: El señor Ulises Pérez tiene 43 años de edad, casado, reside en el municipio Villa del Carmen del departamento de Managua, su esposa ama de casa tiene dos hijos de 17 y 13 años de edad,  tiene como  planes en mejorar su forma de vida, trabaja en la Alcaldía Villa del Carmen como técnico de educación desde hace ocho meses, posee un pequeño negocio de variedades en donde vende los productos como: gaseosa, arroz, frijoles y otros. Gracias al préstamo en Afodenic lograra comprar: aceites, azúcar, cosméticos, y productos de uso diario. Generándole mayores utilidades y ofreciéndole a su familia mayores comodidades. Da las gracias  a la institución por el préstamo ya que se benefiaciara en poder invertir mas lo cual obtendrá mejores ganancia
texts.en:
Sr. Ulises Pérez is 43 years old, married, and lives in the town of Villa del Carmen in the district of Managua. His wife is a homemaker. They have two children, ages 17 and 13. He hopes to make life better for his family. Sr. Ulises has been working for 8 months for the town of Villa del Carmen as an education trainer.

He has a small variety store where he sells products such as soft drinks, rice, beans, and other items. Thanks to his loan from AFODENIC he will be able to buy oil, sugar, cosmetics, and other everyday household products. He hopes to generate better profits and offer his family more comfortable living conditions. He thanks the Institution for this loan and the benefit it will give him through higher earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase consumer products

loans.name: Franklin David

texts.es: El Señor Franklin C. tiene 30años de edad, habitante de la comarca  Carlos Fonseca del municipio de Villa del Carmen, casado su esposa ama de casa tiene un hijos de cincos años de edad. Brindarle mayor seguridad a su familia es unos de los objetivos más importantes. Trabajo en la Alcaldía de Villa del Carmen en el cargo del técnico de catastro desde hace seis meses, anteriormente trabaja en su casa y a domicilio como albañil, hombre emprendedor que coloca todo su empeño para ofrecerle un mejor presente y futuro a su familia. Don Franklin tiene un solar en donde tiene planes de sembrar maíz, se le ha presentado dificultades de falta de recurso económico lo cual es un alto pero no cambia sus ideas de llevar acabo sus planes. Agradece a la Institución por el préstamo comprar semillas y abonos para aplicar en el siembro. De este proyecto obtendrá ganancias para ir mejorando y aumentando las siembras y la infraestructura de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Franklin C. is 30 years old, a resident of the Carlos Fonseca region in the municipality of Villa del Carmen. He and his wife have a 5 year old son. One of Franklin's most important goals is to provide greater security for his family. He has worked in the mayor's office as a land/property registry clerk for 6 months; previously he worked from home as a builder. Franklin is an entrepreneur who puts everything he has into offering a better life and future life to his family. He has a plot of land where he plans to sow maize, but is having financial difficulties. These difficulties have not changed his mind about carrying out his plans. He appreciates the institution for their loan to buy seed and fertilizer. From this project he will obtain income to continue improving and increasing his crop yield as well as the infrastructure of his home.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seed and fertilizer for the sowing season.

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.es:
César es un padre de familia que vive con sus padres, su esposa y sus hijos de 3 y 4 años de edad en el caserío La Garita, un sector ubicado en la carretera Pimentel – Chiclayo, a 15 minutos de la ciudad.

Se ha dedicado a la agricultura durante casi toda su vida y de esta labor dependen no sólo el sustento de su esposa y de sus menores hijos sino también el de sus padres, los cuales son de edades muy avanzadas y están bajo su responsabilidad desde hace algunos años.

El ha sembrado una hectárea de camote en el terreno que poseen cerca a su casa, pero no cuenta con los recursos suficientes para seguir solventando los gastos de mantenimiento de su cultivo por lo que ha solicitado un crédito de 3000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de fertilizantes y foliares para mantener su cultivo y obtener una buena cosecha.

César desea seguir sustentando a su familia y también brindarle a sus padres una buena calidad de vida es por eso que trabaja arduamente en su parcela, ya ha solicitado anteriormente un préstamo a nuestra Institución y lo ha cancelado puntualmente por lo que es considerado un cliente responsable.
texts.en:
César and his family live with his parents. He and his wife have 2 children, ages 3 and 4. They live in the village of La Garita, a sector located along the road between Pimentel and Chiclayo; it is 15 minutes from the city. He has worked in agriculture almost all his life and depends on this work to support not only his wife and young children but also his parents, who are elderly and have been dependent on him since a few years ago. César has sowed a hectare of sweet potato on the land he owns near his house, but doesn't have sufficient resources to cover the costs of maintaining his crop. For these costs he has requested a loan of 3,000 PEN to cover maintenance expenses and obtain a better harvest. César hopes to keep supporting his family and also to provide a better quality of life for his parents. That's why he works so hard on his land. He has already had a loan with our institution and repaid it punctually, so he is considered a responsible client.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and topsoil to maintain sweet potato.

loans.name: Maria Rosa

texts.es:
María Rosa es una madre D. familia D. 42 años D. edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus 6 hijos en el distrito D. Santa Rosa, un distrito dedicado a la pesca y que se encuentra ubicado a 20 minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Como todas las familias que dependen D. la pesca artesanal como principal fuente D. ingreso económico, esta actividad no les proporciona el debido sustento ya que se trabaja sólo por temporadas; es por eso que ella maneja un pequeño negocio en su casa en donD. se dedica a vender productos D. consumos diario (arroz, azúcar, aceite, etc.) y otros productos D. primera necesidad, con el cual ha tratado D. sustentar a su familia durante las temporadas D. veda.

Este pequeño negocio no les pueD. brindar los ingresos necesarios para cubrir sus necesidades diarias, es por este motivo que se han visto en la necesidad D. solicitar un crédito D. 2500 nuevos soles para invertirlos en la compra D. una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado utilizado en el transporte D. carga y D. pasajeros) esta inversión permitirá aumentar los ingresos económicos diarios D. su hogar.

María Rosa desea que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y puedan estudiar carreras profesionales o técnicas que les permitan ganarse un sustento estable y no temporal como en el caso D. la pesca.

Ella ya tiene tres créditos solicitados a nuestra Institución los cuales ha cancelado puntualmente, por lo que considerada como una cliente responsable.
texts.en:
María Rosa, 42, lives with her husband and their six children in the Santa Rosa district. It is a fishing district, which is located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. Like all families who depend upon fishing as their primary source of income, they find that this activity is not enough to support them because they work only in season. That is why she runs a small business in her house. She sells daily consumption products (rice, sugar, oil, etc.) and other basic needs items. She has tried to support her family with this business during closed fishing season. This small business does not bring in enough income to cover their daily needs. That is why they see the need to ask for a loan for 2,500 PEN. They will buy a “mototaxi” (a motorized vehicle used to transport cargo and passengers). This investment will allow them to increase their daily household income. María Rosa wants her children to complete their education. She wants them to be able to study for professional or technical careers, which would allow them to earn a stable living as opposed to seasonal work like fishing. She has had three loans with the Institution, and she has paid them back punctually. Therefore, she is considered to be a responsible client.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a mototaxi ( motorcycle with body for transporting passengers)

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
Clara es una madre de familia de 41 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y su hija de 18 años de edad en el caserío Las Zarandas, distrito de Pítipo, ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 9 años y tiene un terreno en donde siembra lentejas, el cual se encuentra ubicado en el sector Calupe, a donde se llega caminando en 20 minutos desde su casa, todos los dÍas ella se dirige hacia ese lugar para trabajar en el terreno junto a su esposo, ya que la lenteja es un cultivo que requiere de muchos cuidados para producir de modo eficiente.

Ellos dan lo mejor de sí para sacar adelante su cultivo, ya que dependen de ello para sostenerse y para solventar los gastos de estudio de su hija, que se encuentra estudiando una carrera técnica en la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Los escasos recursos con los que cuenta para solventar sus gastos de consumo diario y mantenimiento de su cultivo de lenteja, le ha motivado a recurrir por segunda vez a nuestra institución para solicitar un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles, el cual piensa utilizar en la compra de fertilizantes y foliares para abonar y mantener su sembrío.

Anteriormente Clara ha solicitado otro crédito en nuestra Institución y lo ha cancelado puntualmente, por lo que considerada como una excelente cliente.
texts.en:
Clara, 41, lives with her husband and her 18 year old daughter in the town of Las Zarandas in the Pítipo district, which is located 45 minutes from the city of Chiclay. She has worked in agriculture for nine years. She has land where she plants lentils, which is located in the Calupe area. It is a 20 minute walk from her house. Every day she heads there to work the land with her husband. Lentils are a crop that requires much care in order to produce in an efficient manner. They give the best of themselves to get ahead with their crop. They depend upon the crop to pay the educational costs of their daughter. She is studying for a technical career in the city of Chiclay. The scant resources they have to support their daily expenses and the maintenance of their lentil crop have motivated her to come to the institution a second time to ask for a loan for 1,500 PEN. She intends to buy fertilizers and pesticides to fertilize and maintain her crops. Clara had a previous loan with the Institution, and she paid it back punctually. Therefore, she is considered to be an excellent client.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers and pesticides to fertilize and maintain her lentil crop

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel es un pescador de 63 años de edad que vive con su esposa y su hijo menor en la caleta San José, una zona pesquera ubicada a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El se ha dedicado casi toda su vida a la pesca de manera eventual, ya que es una actividad que no se realiza durante todo el año por las temporadas de veda, durante esas temporadas el se dedicaba a trabajar en un astillero cercano pero por su edad tuvo que dejar su trabajo y desde hace tres años tiene una mototaxi (un vehículo utilizado para el servicio de transporte) con el que gana el sustento diario para su familia.

Debido al constante uso, su vehículo ha empezado a sufrir desperfectos mecánicos, por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles a nuestra institución los cuales utilizará en el arreglo y mantenimiento de su unidad móvil para poder seguir sosteniendo a su familia.

Anteriormente Miguel ha tenido cuatro préstamos en nuestra Institución los cuales canceló en forma puntual, es una persona muy responsable que ha sabido mantener y sacar adelante a sus 10 hijos, 9 de los cuales ya están casados y tienen diversas ocupaciones en la zona en donde viven. El desea darle a su hijo menor la oportunidad de seguir estudiando y así poder asegurarle un futuro prometedor.
texts.en:
Miguel is a 63 year old fisherman. He lives with his wife and youngest child in the San José cove, a fishing region located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. He has devoted almost his whole life to fishing. This is temporary work. Because of the closed fishing season, he does not fish all year. During these seasons he worked in a nearby shipyard, but he had to leave that work due to his age. For three years he has had a “mototaxi” (a vehicle used for transportation), which he uses to earn the daily sustenance for his family. Due to its constant use, the vehicle has started to suffer from some mechanical problems. That is why he saw the need to ask the institution for a loan for 500 PEN. He will use the loan to fix and maintain his vehicle in order to continue supporting his family. Miguel has had four previous loans with the Institution. He repaid them punctually. He is a very responsible person who has known how to support and help his 10 children succeed. Nine of his children are married and have diverse jobs in the region where they live. He wishes to give his youngest child the opportunity to continue his education. This way he will be assured of a promising future.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance of mototaxi

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn M. is from the village of Lawis Panalsalan. She is 42 years old. Marilyn is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Marilyn owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Marilyn has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Marilyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 19,900 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Marilyn is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 11th loan taken out by Marilyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Dorina

texts.en:
Dorina R. is from the village of Calabayan, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old. Dorina is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Dorina owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting bananas to sell in the local community. Dorina has been in the business for more than 5 years.

In 2009, Dorina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dorina is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Dorina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and for daily consumption. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Expanding her business

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita R. is from the village of Usocan. She is 34 years old. Rosita is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosita owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Rosita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Rosita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Rosita is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Rosita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet P. is from the village of Macalibre. She is 23 years old. Janet is married and has 2 infant-aged children. To make a living, Janet owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Janet has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Janet joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Janet has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Janet is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Janet from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina M. is from the village of Cabunga-an, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old. Catalina is widowed and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Catalina owns & operates a business planting and harvesting corn for sale. Catalina has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Catalina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Catalina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from GDMPC. Catalina is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase corn seeds. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Catalina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees for her children and to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase corn seeds

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en:
Sari-sari store (community-based store) is the business managed by Lerma in her village.  She has been engaged in this business for 20 years and she can see its improvements.  However, it still needs further development to meet the growing needs of their family, especially their children.  

Thus, she wanted to avail a loan from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP5,000 as additional business capital.  She will use the loan to buy more stock for her store.  

Lerma is a resident of Barangay San Antonio, Jones, Isabela. She is happily married to Vilmar R. and they are grateful to have their two children: Vily - 19 years old and Villamark - 15 years old. Both are presently studying. She hopes to maintain their good family bonding and their successful business.

loans.use: To buy more stock for her store

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita L. is from the village of Lupagan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 67 years old. Teresita is widowed and has eight adult children. To make a living, Teresita owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 20000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 1997, Teresita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 12th loan taken out by Teresita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita L. is from the village of Gala, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 60 years old. Rosita is married and has seven adult children. To make a living, Rosita owns & operates a business planting & harvesting corn for sale. Rosita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Rosita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12000 PHP from GDMPC. Rosita is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Rosita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is a hog raiser.  Her desire to assist her husband in providing the daily needs of their family and in supporting the educational needs of their children motivates her to work hard.  She is married to Felix Jr. and they are blessed with four children, all studying.  Two are in college, one is in high school and the youngest is in kindergarten.  She is already 39 years old and is doing her best to become a responsible wife and mother to her children. She is also thankful for blessing her with a good and loving husband who supports her all the time. 

Nelia wants to develop her piggery business, thus requesting a loan from Kiva amounting to PHP4,000. She hopes that with that amount, she will be able to buy additional piglets and a sack of feed. She is hoping that someday, the pigs she is raising will double in number and she will have a stable business with the support of Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and feed

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en: Marivic A. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 39 years old, is married, and has five school-aged children. Marivic owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP every harvest. In 2008, Marivic joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Marivic is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase piglets to raise as an addition to her farming activities. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise

loans.name: Capianila

texts.en:
"Achieving success in life is a difficult thing to attain," said Capianila M.. She is thankful that she was blessed with five children and grandchildren that serve as her source of happiness.  

Capianila is already 56 years old but despite her age, she is still strong and very determined to improve her store for her family. At present, she would like to request a loan of PHP5,000 from Kiva lenders. She hopes that her loan will be granted for she plans to utilize the loan for the improvement of her store located in the rural village of San Antonio, Jones, Isabela.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora dreams of giving their children the best education she can afford. This is the main reason why she patiently cooks and sells snacks and ready-made foods in their neighborhood. She even sells her products in the elementary school. She wanted to have a small canteen or stall in the school where she can display her snacks.

Leonora is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000 that she can use for business expansion. She has been in this enterprise for two years and yet her income is still between PHP 150 – 200 daily. She wishes to have a progressive source of income for her family.

Leonora is 37 years old and married to Orlando. They have two children and they are both studying. She hopes to give her children the best education she can by making her business sustainable through patience, hard work, and support from the lenders.

loans.use: additional working capital

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora S. is from the village of Tabid, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old. Flora is married and has 4 children. To make a living, Flora owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising seaweed. The main source of income for the business comes from cultivating and harvesting seaweed for sale. Flora has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Flora joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Flora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Flora is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seaweed seedlings for production. This will be the second loan taken out by Flora from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase seaweed seedlings to raise

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en: “Patience is the key to success,” says Shirley, village store owner in San Antonio, Jones, Isabela. She wants her business to grow for the welfare of her children. With the full support of her husband, Shirley has been able to maintain her business for almost 25 years and still counting.  She would like to take out a loan from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP 5,000 as additional capital to expand her business.  She is planning to buy various sorts of merchandise such as vegetables, meat, and fish.  She is a very hard-working entrepreneur and always believes that having that attitude ensures her ability to become a progressive individual.

loans.use: additional working capital

loans.name: Mrs. Lorn Nuth Village Bank Loan Group

texts.en:
This village bank which consists of nineteen people is located in Pou Roung village in Takeo province, and all the members will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Lorn N. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members, and she is a pig breeder in the local village. Since this pig breeding business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets and pig feed to support her current business. Her husband, Mr. Mom Mao, is a rice farmer in the local village.

Mrs. Lorn N. is 56 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while another one is a construction worker. The third is a farmer while the youngest one is attending the local school.

Fourteen members in this village bank loan have end-of-term loans so these persons are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Lay

texts.en:
M. was born in 1975; she is a married woman and blessed with a son and a daughter. Both of them are pupils in the local public school. Her husband Vanak, 39, works driving a motorbike taxi. M. has built a pigpen behind her house where she raises many pigs to earn a living.

Because the pig-raising business is a very profitable one for M. and her family, M. has requested a loan of US$ 200 in order to buy additional feed and piglets to raise for sale during the period when pork commands the highest price. She proposes to begin selling a few grocery items as well, using the remainder of her loan.

loans.use: To buy additional feed and piglets to raise

loans.name: Mrs. Roatha Chhun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
ThirteE. people who all live in Pou Roung village in Takeo province make up this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Roatha C. is the village bank president, and she is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice to earn a living. Aside from this planting, she is a grocery store owner in the local village. Her husband, Mr. Thoang Nimun, helps her in the rice farming.

Although Mrs. Roatha C. and her husband try to work hard, they still earn too little income to support the family. Thus, Mrs. Roatha C. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow to start up a cow-breeding business. Mrs. Roatha C. is 39 years old and the mother of three childrE. who are all attending the local school.

ElevE. members in this village bank loan have end-of-term loans so these persons are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a cow to start up a cow-breeding business

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna has been engaged in the vegetable-vending business in their distant village of Casilagan of Ilagan, Isabela since 2007. She budgets her income to meet the needs of their family. She sells her own harvested vegetables in the nearest market and sometimes she sells them retail in their village by roaming around from one house to another. There are also instances when she buys a volume of various vegetables in their village and sells them at a higher price in the market. Edna is 48 years old, and her husband is working as a farmer. They have two children and she hopes that they may provide them with a good education.

Edna aspires to expand and make her business grow to achieve her goals in life. She is now requesting a loan of PHP 6,000 from Kiva lenders. This amount will be of great help in maintaining her vegetable-vending business. She also invested some of her income in the hog-raising business for additional income.

loans.use: additional working capital

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria D. R. is from the village of Bacolod, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old. Gloria is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Gloria owns and operates a tailoring business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing tailoring services to local community members. Gloria has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Gloria joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gloria is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional tailoring equipment such as needles and thread. This will be the first loan taken out by Gloria from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional tailoring equipment such as needles and thread

loans.name: Mrs. Ngoeun Paok Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan which consists of thirteen people is located in Chheu Teal village in Takeo province, and all the members will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Ngoeun P. is the village bank president and a silk weaver in the local village. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more silk for weaving. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this second loan.

Her husband, Mr. Lun Paing, is a laborer in Rubber Planting Company in Takeo province. Mrs. Ngoeun P. is 47 years old and the mother of six children, three of whom are employed in the Rubber Planting Company with their father. The others are attending the local school.

loans.use: to buy more silk for weaving.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana M. has been managing a 'sari-sari' store (community-based store) for 22 years through her patience and hard work. She is now 44 years old and married to Rubino Jr. The couple were blessed with six children and their family is happily living in San Antonio, Jones, Isabela. With her income, she is able to provide for some of their family needs and is glad that through the business, she is able to help her husband support their family.

To have continuous business improvement, Susana is now asking for a loan from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP 5,000. She believes that through the loan, her business will continue to become more profitable.

loans.use: additional working capital

loans.name: Armando

texts.en:
Armando U. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 42 years old. Armando is engaged and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Armando owns & operates a business providing video game services to local community. Armando has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Armando joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Armando is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to repair the video game units used in the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Armando from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair video game units used in her business

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza V. is from the village of Cabunga-an, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 38 years old. Liza is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Liza owns & operates a business selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Liza has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 1000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Liza joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Liza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Liza is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Liza from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Chan Sy Tum Village Bank Loan Group

texts.en: Fourteen people who all live in Chheu Teal village in Takeo province comprise the village bank loan. Mrs. CH. Sy T. is the village bank president selected by the members. She is a silk weaver in the local village. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it. So she decided to ask for a loan to buy more silks to weave. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with the loan. Her husband, Mr. Chum ChH., owns a small piece of land (0.2 hectare) to cultivate rice. Mrs. CH. Sy T. is 29 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom attends the local school and one is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy more silks to weave.

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: Kong N. is an older single mother who is blessed with three children. All of the children are married and still living with her. She currently stays at home and is responsible for the daily routine: cleaning house, caring for a grandchild, and cooking. The current family’s expense is contributed by her two daughters: one works as a seamstress in the garment factory and the other one is provides and sells beauty salon supplies in the village. Kong N. said that her daughter’s selling salon business is going well and smoothly, but her daughter complains that she is still lacking money to accumulate items to sell. Therefore, Kong N. has decided to seek a loan of US$600 from HKL to be used to buy more beauty salon equipment to continue the good service her daughter provides. She plans to use the rest of loan to order used clothes to sell at retail.

loans.use: To buy more beauty salon equipment

loans.name: Pricilla

texts.en:
“Maximize your effort to maximize your profit”, shares Priscilla towards achieving goals in life. She is a hog raiser and a snack vendor in their village.  Priscilla would like to purchase two more piglets to raise to improve her livestock business.  With this, she is asking for financial assistance from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP5,000.  This amount will not only assist her in raising her hogs but also in her snack vending business for the welfare of her family, especially her children who are presently studying. 

Priscilla is 46 years old, married and they are living in Casilagan, Ilagan, Isabela. They have four children; two of them finished a three-year course in preaching and they are now working as preachers.  Their third child is a college graduate and working as a saleslady in a drug store and one is still studying in high school.

loans.use: To purchase two piglets

loans.name: Sokly Heng Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Sokly H. is 31 years old and is the president of the village bank responsible for this 15-person loan. All loan recipients live in Chheu Teal village in Takeo province, and they will use the loan for various purposes. 

Sokly H. is a silk weaver. She decided to ask for a loan to buy more silk to weave, since her current business is doing well. She hopes to increase her income and provide a better life for her family. Her husband, Pon Theourn, is a corn farmer in the local village. They have one child who attends the local school.

loans.use: To buy more silk to weave.

loans.name: Bellie Grace

texts.en:
Bellie Grace is 26 years old. She is married to Reynaldo and he works as a farmer. The couple were blessed with two children: Dianne Faye, who is 6 years old, and Jesiekiel, who is 3 years old. Bellie Grace wanted to provide all the needs of her family, most especially to support the education of their children.  According to her, she needed to double her time looking for a better business and earn a living.  As a result, she ended up raising hogs, and she can see that it really helps their family.  

At the moment, she is now requesting business capital from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP 5,000.  This amount will assist her in maintaining her hog raising.  She believes that, through patience and hard work, someday she can expand her enterprise.  She hopes that lenders will grant her loan request for it will really give her hope to have a progressive life someday.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma S. is from the village of Capucao, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old. Emma is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Emma raises crops. Her primary source of income comes from planting and harvesting corn for sale. Emma has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Emma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and to increase her ability to engage in business activities. Emma is requesting a loan in the amount of of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Emma from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhom S. is a villager in the village of Chi Chrap in the province of Takeo. She is a farmer. She owns a piece of land upon which she cultivates rice. She currently faces a small problem in her rice-farming endeavors because she does not have enough money to purchase fertilizers to support the field. For this reason, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers in order to provide good conditions for her rice crop.

Mrs. Sokhom S. is 46 years old and is the mother of four children. Three of them are employed in a garment factory while the youngest one is attending the local school. Her husband, Mr. Chum Thea, helps her in the rice plantation: he is shown at the right in the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fertilizers in order to provide good conditions for her rice crop.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lolinda

texts.en:
Lolinda, 55 years old, manages a general store business in the village of San Antonio, Jones, Isabela. She and her husband, Gunzalo Sr., have been blessed with a big family: they have eight children, and they also already have grandchildren from the five of their children who are married. Their three unmarried children are Gunzalo Jr., 22 years old; Aileen, 18 years old and a Hotel and Restaurant Management graduate; and the youngest, Remelyn, who is 16 years old and a high school student.

Lolinda hopes to help her her business grow. In line with this goal, she would like to borrow business capital from Kiva lenders in the amount of PHP 5,000. She plans to use the loan to purchase additional grocery items that she can sell in her store. With some of the revenues from her business, she will continue to send Remelyn to school.

Lolinda wants the best for her family. She hopes that her business can help her children thrive.

loans.use: To use as capital for her business

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith A. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 44 years old and married, and she has two school-aged children. To make a living, Judith plants and harvests a variety of vegetables and fruits for sale. Judith has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month.

In 2008, Judith joined PMPC to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and to increase her ability to engage in business activities. Judith has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

Judith is requesting a new loan of 6,500 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be her fourth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad F. is a 53-year-old transport service operator living in the populous barrio of Bagong Silang, Caloocan City. Her husband, Alfredo, 54, is a tricycle driver.

Felicidad owns a fleet of tricycles. She manages four units of motorized tricycles, plying varied routes around Caloocan City. She has been in this business for a decade now. She employs three drivers, one of whom is her husband. She earns a total of approximately P 15,000.00 every month.

She has just finished paying off her latest loan from CCT. She is now applying for a new loan in the amount of P 14,000.00 which she intends to use toward the mechanical maintenance of her fleet.

Felicidad is looking forward to buying her fifth tricycle unit soon.

About CCT:

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

loans.use: To use toward the maintenance of motorized tricycles

loans.name: Chroeun

texts.en:
Mr. Chroeun U. lives in the village of Pam in the province of Takeo. He is a farmer. He owns a small piece of land upon which he cultivates rice for a living. He is currently facing a small problem in his planting because he does not have enough money to buy fertilizers to make his crop more productive. Therefore, he has decided to ask for a loan to buy more fertilizers to support the field. He plans to use the rest of the loan to hire laborers to work on the field.

Mr. Chroeun U. is 48 years old and the father of three children: one is a teacher and the others are studying in the local school. His wife, Mrs. Kaen Pok, helps him on the plantation. She is also presented with him in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers to support the field as well as to hire field laborers

loans.name: Yoeum

texts.en:
The two people shown in this picture over are Yoeum P. and her husband. This older couple established a small family home years ago in the middle of the best territory of the capital city of Phnom Penh, and they have given birth to seven children, two of whom are married. Three of their children are employed at a variety of occupations: one is a vegetable seller, one sells clams, and one is a building worker. 

Yoeum P. currently sells different kinds of vegetables in the market to earn a living, and her husband assists her in selling her produce. Recently, the family has been facing a big problem: the area surrounding their house is full of bad water due to the coming heavy rain season. For this reason, Yoeum P. would like to obtain a loan of $800 from Kiva’s partner HKL and will be using this loan to purchase a piece of land to make up for the poor land surrounding their property.

loans.use: To purchase a piece of land to cover the bad place

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 31 years old. She is married to Rosaldo, a construction worker in their village in the rural area of San Antonio, Jones, Isabela. The couple is thankful having been blessed with three children: Precious, age 9, Aubrey, age 8, and four-year-old Erich. Two of them attend elementary school and the youngest is at the preparatory level.

Joan manages a general store business as her way of helping her husband in providing for the needs of their family and also in sending their children to school. Due to insufficient business capital, Joan is now seeking financial assistance from Kiva lenders. She would like to take out a loan in the amount of PHP 5,000, which she will use for the development of her store.

She believes that patience and hard work are the key factors of having a progressive living. She hopes that lenders will lend her the amount that she is requesting so that she will be able to make her business profitable.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is known as a woman who is full of fighting spirit and strong determination. For her, as she puts it, “Poverty is not a hindrance in achieving one's dream in life. Just work diligently and face all the trials that will come along." She adds, "Don’t let anyone or anything bring you down." Merlinda dreams of giving her children a complete education despite their difficulties in life. She says that she will do everything she can for the sake of attaining their dreams for her children.

Merlinda is engaged in a retail business: specifically, a general store. She also raises livestock. To allow for a continuous business growth, she is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 7,000, which will to be used for the maintenance of her businesses. She plans to purchase food, supplies, and additional goods for the store.

Merlinda is 41 years old and married to Rodolfo, a Jeep transport driver. The couple have six children, five of whom are in school. Her youngest is just a year old. She hopes that through her patience and diligence, she will be able to fulfill her dreams of expanding her business to sustain the needs of her children.

loans.use: To purchase food, supplies, and additional goods for the store.

loans.name: Thuch

texts.en:
Mr. Thuch P. is a villager in the village of Pam in the province of Takeo. He is a farmer. He owns a small piece of land upon which he cultivates rice for a living.

This is the rainy season, which is rice cultivation season. Therefore, he decided to ask for a loan in order to buy rice seeds and fertilizers. These are needed to support the field in order to make his crop more productive. In addition, he will use the rest of the loan to buy piglets and pig food to start a pig breeding business.

He is a widower with three children, two of whom are also farmers. The youngest one is attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and fertilizers to support the field

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia B. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 46 years old. Letecia is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Letecia owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Letecia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Letecia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Letecia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Letecia is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital, and a motorcycle registration renewal. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Letecia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital, & motorcycle registration renewal

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia B. is from the village of Maluro, Tangub City, in Misamis Occidental province. She is 37 years old. Lilia is married. To make a living, Lilia owns & operates a business venture in the food sector running a bakery. The main source of income for the business comes from baking & selling a variety of baked goods in the local community. Lilia has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lilia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.
